name: Megan M
text: I have never gotten on here to write a review… But I absolutely have to talk about Canyon and his genuine care and concern for his patients. He is professional, compassionate, and is the best of the best at what he does. I cannot say enough kind words about Canyon… I just wanted it to be known that he is a wonderful caregiver and an asset to the UAB Russell clinic,

name: David Hogeland
text: Dr Haverstock has been wonderful! He's very detailed in his diagnosis as well explaining the recovery process!!

name: Justin Glover
text: Stupid address! Don't use if going to UAB

name: James Schilling
text: In and out. Great people working there.

name: Michael Myers
text:
Dr Trimm and Dr Bailey are the best and their nurses are wonderful.. House keeping in waiting room has a lot to be desired. Wrought iron table bottom dusty and nasty along with counter at desk under clear glass surface.. Makes you need to sneeze and looks awful..
I love BHC personnel they are always helpful....

name: Kathy Nelon
text: The doctor's, nurses and all of the staff are wonderful and very caring. My favorite doctor of all them are at BHC

name: Freya Renee
text:
I was very disappointed with my encounter here, the staff are awful.
I was referred by my dermatologist to have an X-ray done. I do not have insurance but was fully prepared to pay out of pocket.
The admissions clerk made a spectacle out of me not having insurance, getting her boss to see if they would see me or refuse me service.
Her boss tells me I need to get the specific code so she can look it up, which is literally her job.
She has all of my information and the dermatologist information in front of her and she tells me I have to do it myself, call her for a price, and then come back to get the X-ray.
This entire exchange was very loud and unnecessary, I left in tears.

name: April Rowell
text: Xx is Zaza zzzzzs zdx zzz cc zzz zzzz z. Z s.  Xxx

name: Sister Sabotage13
text: All of the staff have been caring and very attentive. I've never had a better stay in a hospital. The food leaves a but to be desired but I feel like I'll be great. It started in the er and now I've been in for 3 days. I'm getting great care. I couldn't ask for a better experience

name: Lisa Marie
text: DO NOT COME HERE FOR AN EMERGENCY. We were passing through and a family member had a serious seizure nearby. He was puking in the waiting room and no one cleaned it up. They said "housekeeping is gone for the day." The nurse wasn't wearing scrubs or a mask. Patient was barely able to communicate and they kicked his spouse out of the exam room. They attempted to kick the spouse out of the hospital completely, saying "no visitors." Refused to let family communicate with patient to gauge his decision-making abilities and kept saying he was fine, even though they had to come out to the waiting room to ask about meds and medical conditions because he couldn't communicate this information!! Place is filthy, please Alabama do something about your rural healthcare.

name: classic rock Kelley
text: I was so so sad to hear that this hospital 🏥 was closing. One of the best there was. Would have my loved ones there over Troy, Greenville and Luverne. Doctors and Staff were like Family.

name: Will Weider
text:
This community is lucky to have a quality local hospital and emergency room. They have great staff and provide personalized care.

When I was there the hospital leaders were serving nachos to the employees. I think this reflects the caring culture of the organization.

name: Talisa Reaves
text: Although we had a 3 hour visit, the staff was  phenomenal!!!! We had the sweetest nurses that actually took the time to talk to my children to keep from being scared and to help them feel better about our visit. My boys we’re running high fever and hurting all over, the staff immediately tested them. Our nurse was very gentle with my children during the nose and throat swabs that my 4 and 7 yr old didn’t even cry or flinch.  They ended up having the flu and one of our nurses even brought them suckers. All during this time they were serving 6 other patients for way more serious conditions. It meant so much to me that even though they were working under a lot of stress they still treated my children like their pediatrician would have.

name: Kiamonte Gulley
text: THE WORST HOSPITAL IN THE STATE DO NOT GO IF YOU ARE IN EMERGENCY NEED !!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Thomas Schofield
text: This review has been in waiting for years! Thank God for Google Dr Nami almost killed my dad in critical care due to neglect and negligence on her part I will not retire in Alabama instead Michigan thank God I will never see the inside of this band aid hospital

name: Daniel Taylor
text: Waited 4.5 hours for lower back pain from bulging disc flare up. Was never asked about my meds so I told the doctor that I was already taking nsaids and muscle relaxers daily as he rushed out of my room after 30 seconds. They bring me a muscle relaxer and an nsaid! When I asked the doctor about it, he said he NEVER gives anything more than that for pain. Uncaring ER staff who will not treat you pain.

name: lee black
text: Do not go here they will take you to court over the smallest amount of money and then if you still don’t pay they will garnish your wages. They are relentless when it come to pursuing you.

name: Isabella S
text:
There is a nurse there named “Troy” who has no bedside manner whatsoever and is unapologetic when addressed.
Definitely shouldn’t be working there.

name: Michael Owens
text: This place doesn't even deserve a star. Been here almost 2 1/2 hrs and haven't even seen doctor for a large gash in my 3 yr olds head.

name: Roger Mulnix
text: Sitting here almost 3 hrs and ain't been seen yet, website says 30minute pledge..just wondering when that kicks in?

name: kerri sanfilippo
text: Taking forever to see my ole man he might of had an heart attack

name: Brandon Hinson
text: Horrible service and horrible attitudes I think I would rather take my chances on making it to Montgomery during a life threating experience

name: JoAnna Hall
text: Slowest hospital EVER.

name: FRANBAR PRODUCTIONS
text: Saved my Life

name: Myra Grimes Lunsford Bedsole
text: I had a small surgical procedure done recently at AH.  Everyone was great!  I couldn't have asked for a better experience than what I received.  All the staff was very professional and very skilled at what they do.  Everyone from admissions, Dr. Kelly, outpatient staff to OR staff was awesome!  Thanks for all you do AH!

name: Carrie Grissett
text: I had the best birthing experience!  All the nurses, Dr. Carney, and Megan provided me with excellent care. The EVS and food services were very kind and did great job as well. I plan on having more babies and will definitely have them here at Andalusia health!

name: vickie grissett
text: The Outpatient Surgery Unit is great! They did a very good job with my husband when he was there. Nice, courteous, friendly and caring staff!

name: Deb Gladney
text:
In and out quickly for out patient surgery.
Every one was helpful and very good at their jobs. Can honestly recomend Andalusia Health.

name: Rick Taylor
text: I went in for upper GI with Dr. Day, last week. Everyone was awesome and very attentive to my needs. Very good experience with all the staff from check-in to check-out. I have used this facility on several occasions and have always gotten top notch prompt service. I am going back this Wednesday for a colonoscopy and hoping for the same kind of care. Thank all of you for your dedication.

name: Tyler Ryals
text: I had an EGD by Dr. Day. Excellent service from all of the staff from the time I walked in the door to register until I left to go home. I would recommend Andalusia Health to anyone looking for excellent and professional health care.

name: Douglas Blackwell
text:
I have had a lot of medical procedures the past few years, I have never had an experience as good as I had at Andalusia Health!  Dr. Long is top notch & has a great bedside matter, which I believe is missing these days.  Every nurse & hospital personal I came in contact with during my procedure was the most professional, caring , patience, nice & understanding group.  A special shout out to my nurse, I am sorry to say I do not remember her name because I got side tracked after she told me she was originally from Prichard, Al.  I have relatives from Mobile .  So I started calling her Ms.  Prichard.  She was absolutely
Amazing!   She took her time. She did not treat me or my wife like she was on a time schedule & had to get us out of there!  Wonderful experience when you are stressed & concerned.  The only average to low side was the front of the hospital morning receptionist, she was just a little grumpy!

name: Carrie Hawkins
text: My husband has had 2 procedures here in the last few weeks. Both times we had a great experience. Staff was friendly and helpful. Instructions for discharge were detailed. The outpatient surgery department and OR staff were great!

name: Carol Bray
text: Had aVERY nice experience at the Radiology department at Andalusia Health!! Called back 15 min before appointment. The ultrasound tech,Jason, was very nice and professional!!

name: William Hall
text: I had hernia surgery this morning in the outpatient unit. The place was spotless, staff were extremely nice, professional and very helpful!! I wish I could remember their names so I could publicly acknowledge them. I would recommend this place to anyone!! I hope I never need another procedure but if I do this is the place to be!! Thank y’all for the care that you provided me!!

name: Jason Hawkins
text: I had a great experience in the surgery department. I was made to feel at ease from the time I walked in the building. I felt the staff was knowledgeable and prepared for my procedure. The doctor was on schedule. I was provided with excellent instructions on discharge. Everyone was great!

name: Robin Eshbaugh
text: I experienced nothing but professionalism and care from the staff. From check- in through discharge everyone was great. Thank you

name: Jo Anna Straughn
text: I had outpatient surgery, all the nurses were amazing and put me at ease, provided me with everything I needed and thoroughly explained each step of prep for my surgery. Ava Morrow, Nicki Hall, Amy Rayborn, and Carrie Hawkins were my nurses and each of them were amazing. I would not hesitate to use this hospital for an outpatient surgery again.

name: Daniel Wells
text:
I had an outpatient surgery procedure recently. The entire staff was friendly and professional. Pre admittance and day of admittance went smoothly and surgery was a success. In and out in just a couple of hours.

Great job offering quality services to the local community.

name: Libby Barnes
text: My husband had outpatient surgery and we were pleased with the care, friendliness and positive bedside manner provided us.

name: Julie Bembiri
text: I had surgery here on Tuesday. From the ladies I met on Monday for my preop work until I had surgery and left on Tuesday...everyome the nurses and doctor were wonderful. Thank you for doing a great job❤

name: Candida Nelson
text: The staff in outpatient and surgery did a fantastic job.  The were friendly and kind and took great care of me. The nurse who took care of me during surgery, explained every well and Anesthesia and the tech were all professional and kind!  Thank you, your team did a great job

name: Sally Gaines
text:
Went to ER was taken back quickly. The gentleman was very polite and kind.
The nurses was not. She was using the needle digging around saying I can’t get any blood as it was pouring out and she had to wipe it up.
Dr Miller was very professional and kind. The nurse sure needs a new profession.

name: Loy Sordo
text:
It was ok a wonderful experience,the labor room was big.
We got treated good,The hospital fed me and my husband,hospital gave him a free mask, we received a upgraded meal with sparkling grape juice champagne bottle and a strawberry cake. The nurses
gave me everything i needed. My doctor was their, that was very important to me.Over all nice service.I would refer this hospital.

name: Keith Mckathan
text: Professional and polite, really had a great outpatient experience.

name: katara k
text: Had a very terrible experience working here will never go back. If you are in the medical industry and you are Afro Latina, Hebrew, or Any person of brown ethnicity do not bother to work here.

name: Sonja Godwin
text: I want to rate one part of the hospital the outpatient part. Went in as a patient for Dr. Day. I found the out patient staff to be very professional and seem to be concerned about my comfort and well fair.  While I don't remember much about the Operating room or recovery.  My pre-op  and discharge nurse Sarah was great, along with the anesthetist Willie.  There was a slight problem starting an IV but that was the only thing that could have went better.

name: Chris Reynolds
text: Just got home from outpatient surgery. All went extremely well. Nursing care was great. Anesthesia, operating room and recovery personnel were great. Great directions for aftercare from Dr. Wells. I stated to my wife as we left, we’re so lucky to have such a good facility locally.

name: Lauren Hose
text: I had a great experience with Andalusia Health. The staffing was friendly and helpful. I needed to get imaging done, and Andalusia Health was able to fit me in quickly and get me out efficiently which allowed me to get to work on time. I come from a bigger city where normally it would take weeks to get in. “Some times you wanna go where everybody knows your name..”

name: Heisenberg Parks
text: If there was an option for 0 stars I would give it. First off theyre the MOST inconsiderate hospital me or my family has ever had the displeasure of being sent to. Secondly theyre not a hospital, theyre a band-aid station. They don't even bother rating your pain. Everything from a scratch to a broken back gets Tylenol. If I broke my back and I'm paying out of pocket for the bill, give me something stronger than Tylenol. And third, my wife has called and called begging them to send a bill so that she can send it to her insurance company to be paid and they straight out refuse. They've sent everything BUT the actual bill. Do yourself a favor if you find yourself needing an ER trip. Go to Opp Hospital. Its not far its worth the extra miles. Andalusia WILL KILL YOU BEFORE THEY HELP YOU!

name: Mari B
text:
My issue is mainly with the ER. I went in with serious breathing issues and the flu. First off...the room was not at all clean which was disturbing! Next they took their time as I was put on a IV for my medication. They left me there without checking on me long after the bag was empty. They walked around talking outside and mind you....it wasn't busy at all in the ER!
On top of that they give me tylenol and another drug that could be OTC not telling me my Medicare and supplement insurance would not cover these OTC drugs and the amount I have to pay is astronomical!! I wish that there was a better hospital near me!!

name: Kristie Lagarde
text:
I really wish that you were able to give zero stars. This place doesn’t come close to deserving a half of star.
Yesterday while visiting our camp in Alabama I became very ill all of a sudden. Started passing out, loss of strength, shortness of breath, and severe vomiting. My husband rushed me to the nearest hospital which sadly was this one.
Never have I seen a hospital that instead of being manned by a human being you had to press a doorbell for assistance. With so many people in the waiting area no one could remember who pressed the button first and we were told it was a first come first serve basis. This is ludicrous. It should be based by emergency circumstances. After sitting down for a few minutes and no one coming to check on us another patient said he had been there for over 2 hours and hadn’t spoken to the first person yet. I asked my husband to drive to the nearest fire station so that someone on call could check my pulse, blood pressure something to ease my mind that I was not having a heart attack. Needless to say no one was at the fire station and thankfully we found The Main Street clinic that was able to see me. If you feel like you are dying you are better off driving to another hospital you may have better chances on surviving.

name: Crystal Lopez
text: Very bad experience

name: Daniel Sordo
text: Great memories. Thank you

name: Thomas Moore
text: I had surgery fri. Morn., all nurses and doctors were very kind and caring they took very good care of me during and after surgery.  Would highly recommend hospitals and staff.

name: Charlene Walls
text:
My 75 yr old mother was seen here and diagnosed with a very severe UTI, so severe she was slurring her speech and dropping things. It took 2 hours before they started any antibiotics or fluids. She was told a ambulance could get her back home as she had no ride, that was a lie. I found out the next morning she had to sleep in the waiting room from 10 p.m until she got picked up at 9 a.m..no.pillow, no blanket, no food and Not one person checked on her during the night. She should have been admitted but instead was placed in the waiting room...disgusting care...

home when she was discharged as I did

name: Alex Benet
text:
I just had my colonoscopy and EGD. The addition was fast and uneventful. In the outpatient surgery the room was clean and the gown and towels ready. The nurses were very polite and professional. The anesthetist came to my room for final questions and to sign the informed consent. They did bring me into the operating room where the full staff was ready. The procedures were done after i was under general anesthesia performed by Willie Furr, CRNA. The surgeon surgeon, Dr. Tim Day did come to my room about 30 minutes after the procedure to inform me about the preliminary results.
Great job, in about 1 hour I was ready to leave.
If you need a colonoscopy I highly recommend this facility.

name: Kirk Webb
text: Could not have been happier with this place. We were in the ER for quite a while, due to the rooms on the second floor being full. But once a room became available, they moved my wife right up there. The nurses were very helpful, knowledgeable, and kind. It did take a while for the doc to come see us and tell us what the verdict was, but there were other patients that were in much worse shape. My family has been here multiple times for this or that and I have no complaints.

name: Cameron Tankersley
text: Good. People writing bad reviews just don’t know how hospitals run and think everyone should bend over backward for their terrible mannered selves.

name: Amanda Owens
text: I wish I could give this place zero stars!! Do not waste your time going to the ER if you are bleeding out. They have no concept of what the word "emergency" means. The incredibly rude girl at the desk that had the nerve to roll her eyes at me needs to be FIRED! I'm currently in the ER in Dothan with my husband who will be having surgery soon...much better care here.

name: Amber Skye Cook
text: E.R. absolutely horrible. Had to wait almost an hour just to get a room in the back an another hour before I even saw the doctor. 10/10 would not recommend. It would be better to die in the comfort of your home.

name: Taylor Sikes
text: Bet hospital in the world... No Cap

name: Dance It Out
text: This place is the worst you can hardly get any service, the people don’t check on you what so ever, I have been here for 5 hours and have barely had anyone look at my friend I brought to the hospital. The staff is terrible, I’m disappointed this is my third time in this hospital with a bad experience like this. Someone take these people back to medical school and re-educate them in the field of medicine, because obviously they can’t do anything other than sit around and talk or go to the cafeteria.

name: kaleigh bowden
text: Really should be a zero!! I gave birth to my 3rd son at this hospital. Very very very unprofessional. This place is not equipped to care for newborns. My week old son still has 8 different little cuts in his heels from being poked for labs. Another spot in his hand from an iv. He was noted by a nurse to have rapid breathing a few hours after being born. And because the nurse felt my mixed babies complexion was not normal. Hint MIXED they started blood work. After keeping his under lights even when his levels were not high and poking and running labs when they all kept coming back normal. They continued to give him antibiotics and iv fluids against me. I am a lab technician myself. I knew his labs and his levels were fine. The Dr ignored my request all day. Even advised he was keeping him for jaundice for 5 days even though his levels were so low that he wasn't even a low risk. His breathing was rapid but his vitals were noted and taken when his temp was 99 degrees from the incubator or at the same time they were poking him for labs. After seeing his regular pediatrician I was notified that the levels were never high enough for him to have suffered any of the treatment that was given against my wishes repeatedly!!!! I even asked if I could sign an AMA form to have my son released. We were treated as prisoners with no regard this being my child and I not agree with treatment. I sincerely hope no other person or baby ever has to endure this horror. A birth is a wonderful beautiful thing but this is one awful experience I will never forget.

name: James Boswell
text: Used the ER on Friday 13th 2018 for my wife Hilda. The only gripe I have is the way you are handle when you arrive, they let you wait in the waiting room until they decide to take you. Should something be serious they have no way of knowing. This needs to be changed... Quickly.....

name: Denise Jewell
text: Stayed there in early June for 5 days due to surgery. Took my pillow with me because hospital ones are horrible. About a week after I got home, started noticing bites on me. I thought it was fleas since I have 2 dogs. IT WAS BEDBUGS! Still fighting the infestation. Of course I can't prove I got them from the hospital and nobody there will help me and I can never talk to the same person twice. Wound up having an allergic reaction to the bites and being put on steroids. Thanks a lot!

name: Jessica Armendariz
text: Do not attend this hospital unless you want to die, lose a limb, or be completely ignored. They will use you for your insurance/money. They will not treat you. They will act as if they are better than you. They have no idea what they are doing. Please, for the sake of your life. Do not attend this hospital!

name: Laura Baker
text:
For those who need to know and won't encounter rude employees. When you go I , ring the doorbell and a nurse will call you back. Both times they've gotten me back pretty fast and got us out fast. Only good thing about this ER.

Anyways, I have been to this ER twice since I moved here and BOTH times I have encountered RUDE employees. The nurses were nice and helpful, but as for the others, no. I get working on night shift isn't the best thing in the world, but please learn how to be nice to your patients. Worst hospital I've ever been too.

name: Kaytreen Ziglar
text: I really wish there was an option to give them 0 stars, they don't even deserve 1 star! 😤 This is the sorriest hospital I have ever visited! They have major additude issues (the nurses especially) and they take their precious time no matter how bad you're hurting! 😠 I really believe the only way they would actually MAYBE try and help you the way they should is if you flatlined, other than that......THEY WILL NOT DO ANYTHING FOR YOU!! If you need help of any kind the Andlausia hospital is not the place to come looking for it.. 🙅🏻

name: brandon stiller
text: A week after taking a drug test and not hearing nothing back my company calls and say they never sent it off... this is the 3rd time this hospital has messed up with paperwork

name: Deirdra Trawick Belton
text: I don't have any complaints with the Andalusia hospital,nor do I have any complaints with the doctors  or the nurses. my complaints are with Dr. Wells OBGYN clinic front desk staff in Andalusia . They are nasty with their patients ,they have nasty attitudes,they are the biggest liars I've ever known. and  unwilling to help in a serious situation I will be taking my complaint to CEO Clint Kendall. ASAP

name: Cyndi Oneal
text: 1 patient ahead of me...I was n there 2 1/2 hours.  Go elsewhere.....

name: Rob Bettis
text: For a regional hospital, I was very pleased. I had to stop in the ER, while traveling through town. The staff far exceeded my expectations. The service was quick and caring. It was a very positive experience.

name: colt eppes
text: The emergency room staff is awful. I came in with severe head trauma and was not seen for an hour. No one even checked on me in the waiting room and that is a state requirement with head trauma. I was bleeding all over the floor and everything. And here recently I went in with the flu only reason I went in there was because it was the middle of the night. I didn’t get proper treatment and a week and half later i get tonsillitis so I go to the Main Street clinic and they gave me antibiotics shots. Prescriptions and a steroid shot and iv fluids. AT A CLINIC. why the hell couldnt a hospital do that!

name: Hau Boutno
text: This place is the worst. While there are SOME very caring nurses and doctors, they don’t seem to be around often. Treatment is slow and drags on longer than it should. The air filters in the rooms are COVERED in a thick sheet of dust. Can’t imagine what they look like behind the A/C cover. Know-it-all CNAs talking down to family members, saying there are no such things as HIPAA release forms. Telling family members to go back to their rooms. I could go on and on. You might be better off going to another city’s hospital, unfortunately.

name: Terri Moore
text: My 2 year old grandson was admitted into the e.r. with a 102 degree fever. The e.r. doctor was rude and told my daughter in law he did not know what to do since he just had a fever. 530 am at 1030 am she is able to get him in to see his soon to be pediatrician. They swabbed him and it comes back that he has strep throat. How could a e.r. supposedly doctor not know to do a simple swab test? Do not take your babies to this e.r..

name: Joseph Land
text:
Andalusia, we have a problem. And it’s a big one.

On Monday (May 20,, 2019), my brother had an outbreak of Cellulitis, a bacterial skin infection that he has had since college. When he has a Cellulitis outbreak, he has to get medical attention immediately because it is a life-threatening infection that can spread into your lymph nodes and bloodstream quickly. Every single time he has had an issue, we have rushed him to the ER. Nearly every time he has been admitted for anywhere between 2 and 10 days. It is a serious condition.

Will is a truck driver. He was out to pick up a load when he came down with this infection and was so sick that he had to have a stranger take him to the ER at Andalusia Health. Typically, the ER nurses recognize the severity and get to him quickly. Not Andalusia Health. M the waiting room quickly, it was three hours before any medication was administered. Since he was on the road – and has insurance – he requested that they admit him for the night so he could regain his strength and get enough medicine in his system to get back home so he could see his doctor. Remember, he had to drive an 18-wheeler all the way back home. The ER staff at Andalusia Health knew this. They refused to admit him, telling him he “didn’t fit the criteria.” Please, can someone explain what criteria one must fit to be admitted into this hospital? Is it the Harvard of hospitals? He was extremely ill and had insurance. This should have been handled immediately.

While he arrived at the ER midday, since he didn’t get to see anyone until late, my mom called the ER to explain his medical history since they would not be able to contact Will’s regular doctor. The nurse she was talking to hung up on her mid-story. And, as Will was getting his bearings and getting dressed to go back to his truck to sleep for the night, he wasn’t fast enough for one of the nurses who told him – and I quote – “I know you aren’t feeling well, but you have to go. We need the bed.” Is Andalusia Health a Level 1 trauma center? The ER in a town of 8,787 (as of 2017) is that busy? The hospital has 88 rooms. Was 10% of the town so sick they needed to be in the hospital? I’m asking. No, seriously, I am asking. Someone please tell me.

Andalusia may or may not have Uber drivers, but my brother couldn’t find one. Nor a cab company. He had to call central dispatch and have a police officer take him back to his truck, where he slept overnight, with Cellulitis raging in his body. Without any medical attention. Because Andalusia Health failed. Big time. I don’t know who was on duty other than Sara Purvis, the certified nurse practitioner who saw him. But, I know that Kim Carol is the ER manager. I know that Amy Herrington is the director. I know that every time I have gone to their website, they boast the wait time being 30 minutes or less. I know that they claim to have “experienced” ER physicians and staff. I know that they failed to live up to that promise. I know that I expect a call from Kohen Johns Brannon today. I know that someone needs to clarify what happened and why it happened. I know that my brother is still sick and sitting in a truck in Andalusia, Alabama right now.

name: Secret Squirrel
text:
Horrible care facility. I entered the facility with my left index finger sliced open to the bone. I waited for over an hour and a half to be seen. Finally was put into a room just to watch TV for another hour. Finally a person come into the room to tell me there was nothing they could do for my cut. They sent me packing with some gauze and tape and told me to keep it clean. Days later it started to smell so I went to a real care facility that actually stitched my finger up. It healed but I no longer have feeling from the cut to my finger tip.

I received a bill for $275 a month later. I called and explained that they did nothing for me. A review was supposedly opened to explore the case. I was never apprised of the findings until a creditor called me to collect the money. Here I sit deployed in the desert of Iraq while my wife and kids are home worried about a debt collection.

I will be getting a lawyer to fight this!

name: Nicole Adamson
text: No star wasn't a option......be warned!!! In order to be seen by ER Dr you ring  a door bell to be seen by a triage nurse whom will take you to room.....my symptoms was heart issue, swelling and tight chest took them hour to ask who was next , I got in the room and dr came in and asked what was wrong the took my blood pressure and hooked things up to my heart all within 20 minutes dr said my heart was fine and I "could go home" so I had to take everything off...blood pressure cup and monitor and I walked out as I was told to do.......

name: Amanda Cain Few
text: Very friendly & knowledgeable staff they're takin gr8 care with my daughter during her pregnancy

name: Chris Spurlin
text: I was  at the hospital  with my gf we stayed  in there for 2 hrs today the doctor  had to be hunted  down  to come see us then when he came in he was a but hole from the word go he never looked  at my gf when she told him what was wrong with her and said what do you want  me  to do he is very rude!!!!!!!!

name: Madison Ward
text:
Terrible on call doctor.
Roger boyington

name: Zariaa Parks
text: This place is horrible and slow. When I came with my mother the nurse had a very bad attitude

name: violet cook
text: I wish I could give this place zero stars. I took a travel assignment there and stayed one day. the unit Manager was so disorganized. the employees were rude and jealous of travel pay. they still do paper charting, didn't have respiratory therapy at night, no person designated to watch telemetry for the entire hospital, AND I never got paid for an entire night of misery trying to work in this unsafe and hostile environment. they are the worst organization I have ever encountered.

name: Jared Nichols
text: Recently had an emergency visit to the Andalusia hospital, wow what a well run facility. Minor finger trama, was admitted, xrayed, dressed up the wound and had prescriptions in hand on the way out the door in 1 hour 25 minutes. Last time I had dealings with Crestview it was over 3 hours just to see the doctor for the first time. Andalusia is now my local hospital of choice.

name: Jennifer Brooks
text: Very over priced for mediocre care. Some of the nurses are very friendly but when I was in the er I had to ask to actually see the Dr. He was irritated by my request although he sent me a bill for $500 and the er bill was $1400 for 3 x rays and a shot. text: First impressions could be nice.  My wife is a diabetic with extensive conditions.  We have been to several hospitals on her behalf for extended stays.  The Andalusia Hospital was not only ill prepared to handle her condition when she was having a glucose low and her body was in the early stages of shutting down, but they immediately upon taking her back, which took 18 mins while gasping for air literally, cut her new shirt off even after we told them why she was short on air (diabetic ketoacidosis) and they did not listen at all, refused to listen, cut her shirt off even when she was able and we offered to take it off, then they refused to replace it!  They had the night Doctor to come see her and he said he was not able to help and he was calling another doctor, then after 20 more minutes we were informed that yes Andalusia Hospital was UNABLE to treat this condition, a common diabetic condition.  We had to leave that hospital, since they wanted to charge us for an ambulance trip to Pensacola FL, I drove faster and called the police depts ahead of my way and had no problem the entire way speeding very quickly, and she was treated immediately at the Pensacola Sacred Heart Hospital.  I will not return to Andalusia Hospital unless I have NO options.

name: J Darnell
text:
Great little country hospital...they've saved my accident prone husband more than a time or two! The doctors and nurses have all had the best attitudes, and they're always willing to work on ya even when you may not have the cash to cover the entire costs.

They've just opened their new sleep study lab, and we're looking forward to taking advantage of that opportunity close to home (and considerably more affordable).

We owe this hospital much gratitude, and I'm thankful they're there to service our rural community!

...but the picture with this listing is definitely not Lake Martin Community Hospital.

name: Leigh Haffner
text:
This is a very small rural hospital, with a very small medical staff and very limited resources. The Doctor who I saw was very informative, thorough and knowledgable. I felt like I was in good hands! I only waited for 2 hours as opposed to the 6+ hours I would have waited at EAMC! That is the shortest wait I have EVER had at ANY emergency room, and I have lived in 3 different states, many cities/towns and I have visited several ER's in my lifetime for various reasons! I felt my wait-time at LMCH was reasonable considering there was only one RN and one Doctor treating 3 different patients and one of those patients  had to be life flighted to Birmingham (without hesitation)!  Yes...they have a helicopter landing pad for major medical emergencies! Their genuine concern is doing the best they can do for their patients, with the limited resources that they have! I was very impressed and I left feeling better than when I first got there...I mean, after all, that is the reason for going to the ER to begin with, right?

The avatar (photo of the hospital) that someone decided to use is "stock" imagery and is not a photograph of the hospital...in fact, it's not a photo at all, it's a drawing! That photo never concerned me! I don't feel the image was used to "lure people in" deceptively! It is just a generic photograph used as an avatar...nothing more, nothing less! I took a photograph of the hospital, that I decided to share, for those who want to see what the hospital looks like!

NOTE: There is a pharmacy located in front of the hospital, though I do not recall the name of the pharmacy or the hours of operation?

Nurses were FANTASTIC...  if I had questions... they were answered.... no stone was left unturned! Highest praise...

name: Lynn Dobbins
text: This place is garbage! They do not care about the patient or family members. No one can ever be on the same accord. Nurses, tell you something totally different than doctors & when you get to the bottom of things, they all are lying. This is one facility that I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!!! They are a DISGRACE to the medical community. If care anything about your love ones please take them elsewhere.

name: Nevergivenup 123
text: Feb 23, 2016 I was in the ER about 5 hrs. I was told after 2 hrs I was being admitted. They had a room that had to be cleaned. Then I was move after a total of 5 hrs. Anyways the ER doctor was terrible   no beside manner and didn't really even examine me. I went to the ER for shortness of breath. X-rays and blood work was ok. After I was moved to my room the 3rd floor nurses were not even concerned about my well being. I didn't use the call button all night. Then I did that morning and it took 45 min for the nurse to get to my room. And the doctor on my floor has done nothing. No test have been ordered or anything. I was in this hospital twice last year and I couldn't have ask for better top notch care. I don't know what has happened this go around. I'm writing this review as I'm laying here for nothing and me and my insurance is getting this outrageous  bill. I'm about to sign and leave on my free will. Very disappointed. My doctor this time here isn't Dr Jazwal. If it was he would not allow this kind of care..

name: joevgirl 4_ever
text:
Excellent hospital, doctors, nurses and staff. I was treated with renal failure on thanksgiving day.  They were very nice and I plan the go back and thank the staff that treated me and helped me. I am still in bad shape but trying to heal slowly. I was a GFR of 28 and now been stable at 47. This wasn't anything I done wrong but I had to take a medication that causes renal failure but usually is reversed. Can't thank all the doctors staff and nurses, even techs and imaging for all their help. Very professional and curtious. I did ask why they were so nice because I had been treated hostile at another facility and by a few specialist and their response was " it could be one of us in your position". They kept me calm, wasn't hateful not neglectful. When I went back on new years Eve in pain they understood, helped me and sent me home after finding out my gfr was a little better.

I could go on forever and wish I had the names of ppl who treated me. All I know is it was the best treatment and hospitality I've had this past year. I guess I had been going to wrong hospital before this one.

name: Gary Taylor
text: I absolutely love the hospital, and the nurses are the very best! I have been admitted 5 times in the past 2 months. They have taken such wonderful care of me. I wouldn't use any other hospital besides Riverview hospital, except UAB. I have a specialist in Gadsden and kirklin clinic, UAB that take good care of me.

name: Angela Mekertichian
text: Avoid this hospital at all cost. There is no care. Doctors are hard to come by and they do not care. My best friend was there for 4 days and past away. They could not even find what was wrong and he got so I'll that I could not move him. Terrible place. And 2 weeks later the doctor still can't be bothered to sign the death certificate.

name: S Owens
text: MARK your parking spaces CLEARLY if you don't want anything but Emergency vehicles to park in the two spaces just outside the ER.  Neither are marked and I was told by an ambulance driver I would be towed.   That would have cost you my attorney fees and the cost of them towing my car.  By first appearance, those are legal parking places for everyone.

name: Super Straight
text:
Went to this hospital last night at midnight with a family member who had an extremely high heart rate and was in a lot of pain. We were both terrified, thought this person might be having a small heart attack and could ultimately die. We get to the front desk of the ER and a young, skinny black woman was working it. Nobody was in the waiting room, keep in mind. We tried to check in, give her the insurance cards, tell her it’s very urgent.... and she’s got her head propped up on her left hand, slowly clicking things on her computer. She gives us the WAIT finger. Doesn’t say a single word. Just 👆🏻 the YOU CAN JUST WAIT A MINUTE finger. We sit down for 20 mins. She’s still clicking away. Looking disgruntled as ever. We go back up to the desk to try to reiterate how urgent this is ansnto basically beg her to take our insurance or whatever it is she needs to get us seen ASAP. We get the finger again. We then called Gadsden regional hospital and they said “Yes we will get you in immediately! Come now!!!”  They took care of my family member at Gadsden Regional and they feel better than they have in a year!!!

But I can’t figure out why these people act like that. Did we interrupt her Facebook scrolling? What did we do wrong but want to check in and get seen ASAP. We were (and always are) VERY nice and understanding. We know nobody is a miracle worker. But this is on another level of disgusting and piggish. What if my family member died while she played on the computer for almost half an hour and never ever got us checked into the system?! The place was empty. I guess she thought she could be lazy that night and was upset by us coming in and having an emergency, in turn making her have to do a little work. This was on 1/19/18 at MIDNIGHT in the ER.  Couldn’t get her name because I kept getting shoes off. She never spoke to us ONCE. I know Riverview will do nothing about this though and keep this heartless woman on as an employee. They could care less. GO TO GADSDEN REGIONAL IF AT ALL POSSIBLE!!!!!!

name: eric williams
text: While mother was in E.R. Male nurse was very rude to the point of being mean to her. We got the er supervisor involved and problem fixed with that incident. Then afterwards they admitted her we come into her room to check on her and she tells me a male nurse was trying to bathe her which was unnecessary to say the least. The night before that garbage was overflowing and all over the room and let’s keep in mind that this is a hospital. No hand sanitizer in room after asking for days. Bed sheets had not been changed in days also. Got another supervisor involved, and this man had the nerve to not only have a security escort but accused me of being rude to his staff. I grew up in a military family and say yes sir and yes ma’am to everyone I come across. Needless to say I will be contacting the board of directors for this mans total incompetence. But the best thing I can say about this hospital is the nurses on cardiac step down are some of the best I’ve seen in any hospital, very responsive and respectful. Also, Jane Yates was great and needs to be supervisor of not just the E.R. But I would say the whole hospital.

name: michael moeller
text: No zero option. The ER  is beyond inept. The entire area around room 12 in the ER is very dirty and smells.

name: Carlene Valentine
text: I am scheduled to do the pre-op testing today for foot surgery on Friday. NO ONE CALLED ME TO LET ME KNOW WHEN TO SHOW UP FOR this. I called them even though my doctor's office had told me yesterday when it was! I detest inefficiency, especially in professionals. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE grom MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS! Makes me wonder if my surgery will be done under proper procedures from the facility??? Will I ever go back for amy services after Friday? I doubt it at this point. I jave dealt with medical.professionals personally for over 45 years and this is the worst I have EVER seen.

name: Waymond McGee
text: I, Waymond McGee, went to Riverview Medical Center in 2015 where Dr. Donald Marshall did a verbal sexual harassment towards me. I went through every possible channel to get this matter handled and I was rejected. Since no action was taken, I wanted to inform the public on this issue so this will not happen to anyone else.

name: Bravo Chakras
text: It's a really hospital. April at New Vision is very sweet, understanding, compassionate, and awesome. @NewVision  @gadsdenregionalhospital

name: April Myers
text: The staff was very caring. My poor mom suffered a lot and was a very difficult patient due to cancer in her brain and a lifetime of being stubborn and strong-willed. Despite her physical lashing out, pulling out her IV's and trying to go home every minute she was there, they were very kind and caring. When it was clear she was dying, they did everything they could to make us comfortable. I never ate so good as I did staying there 24/7 for a week. The seats turn into pretty comfortable beds. My only issue, and it is a significant one, is that there were a whole lot of specialists each focused on their specific area of medicine, and it didn't appear they were checking her file before they walked in. So we had a lot of bizarre and non-sensical testing trying to take place, and even in her last gasps, someone came in with a gurney to take her in for surgery. The neurosurgeon came in wondering why she hadn't gone in for the MRI that morning. The last few days, I felt like I really had to protect my mom because their system is so chaotic and overwhelming. Even if you say no to something, the word doesn't get to the everyone and they still try to do it. Don't leave your loved one there alone, whatever you do. They are going to need your care and oversight. I will never forget the kind people there, and especially the folks who prayed with my proud, fighter of a mom. She decided to accept Jesus the day before she died, I'm sure it helped having people like that around.

name: Marquita Ervin
text: What a nasty hospital.. that smell is mold... The State need to shut yall down

name: Terri Odazier
text: Awful.  Nasty and doctors dont know anything.  I had to tell him it was my gallbladder and even then he told me that was not the problem. I told him to do an ultrasound and with hesitation he ordered it.  Yep it was inflamed and full.  Stupid.  I had to do his job.  Now they want to change me 10k.

name: Regina Gallagher
text: Best hospital ever!Very fast service and very nice  staff!

name: ChopinLover
text: In spite of the five stars the nurse tech on duty afternoon 4/23/17 made slanderous remarks toward the spouse of her patient. These remarks are totally unwarranted. I may sue.

name: Carol Lee
text:
Recently my mother was admitted to CCU. She has been there a week and a day.
The nurses told us on Sunday that she would be moved to a regular room on Monday. Now that it is Tuesday she is STILL in CCU. Apparently, they are waiting on the Dr. I understand that there are alot of patients to be seen but waiting on the Dr. to just allow her to be moved is not acceptable. She has improved tremendously thanks to the CCU and alot of prayers. You would think that the Dr.would take 5 minutes or call CCU and order her to a regular room. If he is too busy then the hospital needs more physicians. Not a good experience.......

name: Brandon O'tinger
text:
Hated that hospital. My dad had his prostate removed there. The nurses did not pay attention to the compression devices placed on the calves of his legs. These are used to try to prevent deep vein thrombosis, but they never even bothered to check to lake sure they were working properly. My dad ended up with.deep vein thrombosis in both legs, and suffered bilateral pulmonary emboli as a result.

The elevators are awful, you literally have to sit there and wait, and wait, and wait for the elevator to arrive, seems like it takes 5 mi utes every time you use it. Also several times i thought we were going to get stuck in one because it was ridiculously slow, and rickety.

I absolutely would advise avoiding this facility unless absolutely neccessary.

name: Allen Elkins
text:
From their deplorable bedside manner to their decrepit facility; this hospital deserves some sort of negative star ranking.

I went to their emergency room where the Physician's Assistant (I believe his name is Brian) cut me off several times when I was speaking, wouldn't let me run off a list of symptoms I was experiencing, told me I couldn't come In there with more than a couple complaints; essentially an extremely rude individual. His demeanor was that of a cowboy cop (yes, mustach included) from a low budget action film based in the mid 1980s.

As a result of said negligence on Brian's part, I was prescribed medications for symptoms I never even stated.

Also, the doctor never even came in the room to see me. I was given a message from the doctor through one of the nurses that mirrored Brian's statement.

My overall perception of the Emergency Room visit was that I was an unwelcome burden.

The only good thing I can say about the hospital is the admitting staff, and nurses were very hospitable and kind.

name: Kay Moore
text: Staff has been excellent and service has been exceptional!

name: Freda Mincey
text: Someone attempted a robbery and took my purse in a parking lot and come to find out the hospital has no cameras in the emergency parking lot my fiance is now sueing the hospital. This hospital is horrible and they are unbelievable my fiance calls and they hang up on him. No staff ever in the emergency room. Doctors are like street pharmacists and pill mills

name: Paul Coleman
text: So far i have no problem.they have been good to me.

name: Alex Abernathy
text: DO NOT GO HERE. MY POOR 1 YEAR OLD HADNT BEEN ABLE TO KEEP ANYTHING DOWN FOR 2 DAYS SO WE TOOK HER TO THE ER SINCE HER PED OFFICE WAS CLOSEDTHEY KEPT US THERE FOR 4 HOURS AND AND DID NOTHING TOLD US WE DONT KNOW TAKE HER TO HER PED WHEN THEY OPEN EVEN THE NURSE SAID WE SHOULD HAVE TAKEN HER SOMEWHERE ELSE AND HES SORRY THEY ARENT A GOOD HOSPITAL! I STRONGLY RECOMMEND YOU NEVER GO HERE.

name: JBL 3
text: Almost 300 dollars was stolen out of my wallet. They refused to pull cameras..Told me one thing and told police another..There was one nurse bless her heart knew I was done wrong but I believe she was scared to say anything in fear of losing her job.

STAY AWAY!! GO ELSEWHERE
ZERO STARS..BAD ATTITUDES EVERYWHERE . NURSES SCREAMING AT AIDES, AT PATIENTS...CURSING.

text: Thank you so much.

Sent me a letter stating my bills would be send to collection within 10 days if not paid in full after I made payment every month, and paid over 95% of each bill! I paid them off and will NEVER visit this place again.
