name: Lori Carver
text: I would not take my dog to this hospital.  They are rude and uneducated on how to treat patients.  I would rather drive to Fairhope than to go to the hospital in my own town.  I would not have given them 1 star but I had to give at least 1.

name: Dana Stewart
text: It's great as long as you don't have to go to the ER. There will be a very long wait if you do.

name: Miko Lynch
text: I WAS ADMITTED TO THE HOSPITAL ON 4/28, THE STAFF WAS VERY NICE AND ATTENTIVE BECAUSE I WAS HAVING A SEVER ASTHMA ATTACK AND BLOOD PRESSURE WAS HIGH , HOWEVER WHEN I GOT TO MY ROOM AND GIVEN SO CALLED CLEAN LINEN THERE WAS LONG STREAKS OF WHAT APPEARED TO BE POOP STAINS ON MY SHEETS I REPORTED IT IMMEDIATELY,  I SUFFER FROM ANXIETY  AND WAS APPALLED.  I CAME HERE TO GET WELL AND NOT CATCH ANY OTHER DISEASES.  THE CLEANING STAFF NEEDS TO BE REPRIMANDED FOR THIS DISGUSTING MATTER,  I AM SO DISAPPOINTED!

name: John Marcus Little
text: My wife came in for surgery. The doctor was awesome the nurses were great. Every time I asked for anything they were there for me. Anytime I ask for an update then mediately went back and checked for me.

name: Michael Stewart
text: Complete garbage, you could literally be bleeding out and they will tell you to sit down and wait for someone, super rude and do not care about the patients at all!! 1 star is to much to rate them, half a star would be better.

name: Rickey Lester
text: Wife came here with Drs orders. They don't want to help covid patients or even try to help anyone from what I cam see. Unprofessional and Not afraid of losing jobs.

name: Annette Hester
text: Went for a blood test as I do every 6 months.  Found thst location had changed from lab to rear of bldg in outpatient location- with no signage.  First of all no parking was available.  Receptionist took my order and I sat outside until there was room inside.  There were 3, then 2 patients waiting.  One, a lady, became more and more agitated.  She demanded to know problem and was told it was new software that had issues.  After more than 2 hrs, and no one acknowledging me except the nice receptionist Megan, i asked for my orders back so I could go elsewhere to get the test done.  Very disappointed, I try to support Bay Minette; our citizens and your patients deserve better.

name: Jennifer Holder
text: I was recently in the er twice within 6 hours and first time sent home told there was nothing wrong. 2nd time told I needed emergency procedure but wasn't going to admit me because it my Dr problem. Sent home to bleed out

name: E Davis
text: Had a knee replacement. Registration people were very helpful. Operating staff was great unfortunately the rest of the visit was a wreck. Horrible nurses that like their phones more than patients. My surgeon only operates here didn't have a choice. I will find another surgeon before returning.

name: Hayward Boyington
text: My wife been in for few days and was here through Christmas.So Christmas day my girls and family came with food and gifts so she wouldn't spend day alone.the staff were very helpful and sweet and polite and very professional.Day and night shift. I really appreciate there kindness.

name: Jennifer Ewing
text: This place is a joke. Got here a little after 9 for lab here it is 11:30 and still waiting.

name: Cheryl Hatter
text: My Father in law is 96 years old. He fell and broke his hip this week. The nurses and doctors have been outstanding.,they are so caring and attentive to our sweet man. The hospital is very clean and everyone is friendly and extremely helpful.

name: Shauna T.
text: I'm pretty satisfied with the actual surgery and medical services provided here but the wait times are horrible. They say to come 15 minutes early to get registered but it has taken at least 45 every time I've come. They need more people or better people in admitting because just getting registered (especially when they call and preregister you) should NOT take more that 5 to 10 minutes.

name: Susan Parsons
text: Have always had good care and the staff has always been very helpful

name: Robert Gross
text:
It was the week end when my wife began having breathing problems. I took her the ER. A nurse promptly checked her symptoms. The ER doctor on duty ran various test, and determined my wife had blood clots in the lungs and both legs.Both life threatening conditions were treated immediately. Everyone involved treated my wife like she was family. The nurses were very professional, and friendly. For a small town hospital, this one is the best I have ever seen. It is also the cleanest, and best maintained facility I have ever experienced.
The lunch room was nice and clean, and the food was excellent.
I thank the staff who took great care of my wife.

name: Matthew Obrien
text: I went in this morning, and much to my surprise, they took me straight back! I had problems breathing, dizzy, with chest pains, and my back was hurting really bad! The team of staff this morning was constantly there for me, right at my side, always checking on me! A special thanks to Dr. Timothy Toms for being a great doctor! Im home and can breathe, and move around more than i could before! A special praise go to the people who helped me out! THANK YOU ALL! AND GOD BLESS!

name: Tom & Shirley Frazier
text: This Hospital has the best surgery department around. I have had major surgery here twice. Dr. Travis Paul and Dr. Mark Crowell, there surgery team, are above excellent.

name: Brittany Woodruff
text: The absolute worst kind of staff

name: Shirley Frazier
text: I spent 7 day in ICU in this hospital week of April 15, 2018. The nursing care I received from everyone was awesome. Thank you all for being so good to me, these nurses know there job and do it.

name: Patrick White
text: Dr. Kevin Prewett did a great job treating me in the ER as he has done in the past. The staff last night was great and helpful. I'm glad they have weeded some of the bad staff. Keep up the great care.

name: Dee McClantoc
text: Husband's had 3rd major  surgeries since Jan.2019, at North Baldwin Infirmary the most caring, attentive and knowledgeable staff from admitting to ER to ICU to 2nd floor to hospitalist. A special thank you to his nurses (Jackie, Sonya, Megan, Donna, Jasma), Dr. Rogers, surgeon Dr. Paul...... Only 4 Stars due to the Morrison Cafe puts a hardship on those sitting with loved ones with out rageous prices (sm. grits & 1egg ONLY.....over $4), No prices posted either.

name: victoria nami
text: Worst experience ever. Incredibly rude nurses. when I say rude I mean RUDE and a bunch of other names I called them after leaving that I won't mention. Waited 5 hours to be told they couldn't help me. When I became upset they told me they would help me but it would be very painful or I could go home and take care of it myself. After waiting that long for no relief I tried to leave. In which they wanted me to wait "a few minutes" to be discharged. Well an hour goes by and I decide to just leave. They wouldn't unlock the door for me and made me sit and wait. Then came in and listened to my stomach. I went in for a problem with my EAR then they made me squeeze their hands. Again this problem is for my ear. At that point I was extremely frustrated to which they told me "hey people are dying in this hospital you have a small problem" then they told me the reason for the wait was a shift change. Something that happens everyday at the same time backed the hospital up 6 hours? Also the bed they put me on had dirt and sand at the end which makes me think someone else was on this bed with their feet up and it was not changed. Floors were disgusting the male nurse who came in and took my vitals kept his gloves on after touching me and touching everything else and wrote vitals on his glove. Touching his pen also So whoever he touched last time and did that is now on the gloves used for me and touching me. The whole thing was a nightmare. A few days later and I'm still having the issue with my ear. Thanks for nothing! Can't wait to see the bill. They're not getting a dime from me

name: GARY HARD
text: want ever go here, took my mother 81 years old to mental health coupld years ago, two days she fell broke her right hip and right arm 100 days in rehab, she went back month ago, fell again and re broke or whatever right hip again, had her on bed rest for two weeks before they let us know and we did the asking, they were suppose to work with her mental state but after breaking hip wanted to kick her out. finally got her moved to rehab because we found a place. she went in the first time on with walker, came out in wheel chair, this last time went in with wheelchair came out bed ridden. some of the nurses were excellent but no help from anybody else.

name: teresa dugas
text: This place is a godsend to me and my family!!! After being turned away and told there was nothing they could do by other "mental health " facilities  we were near our breaking point and these people helped!!!! I called and spoke with rebecca who was so helpful! She KNOWS what she is doing and is very educated on mental health issues!! ( unlike so many others) we first had to go to the ER where they were waiting on us!! The ER staff was AMAZING!!!! brittany and christie couldn't have been nicer and more understanding!!!  My brother is now getting the help he needs and is not on the streets or in jail like so many other mentally disabled people!! Alta point,  pine grove, pine belt, Pensacola mental health and soooo many others need to learn from this place!!!!! I can not thank them enough!!!!!!!!

name: Bradley Schwartz
text: If not an emergency avoid this hospital. I was seen for kidney stones and the care was fine but not great. The problem was, I moved to a new address a month or so after being seen. So after sending 1 bill to the address I haven't been staying at. With no phone call no other warnings at all they immediately put discrepancies on my credit reports. Any of you know just like I do how hard it is to keep your scores high and how important it is to keep it that way. I take pride in keeping my score flawless and have kept it that way for years unil these idiots. The saddest part is they done it over s 45$ bill that was unpaid because I was unaware of it. Why the hell do I have to give them a phone number if they aren't going to call it.

name: Rikki Dugger
text: Took.real.gold care of.my best friend

name: Christopher Hefner
text: Came in not to busy. Waited 2 hrs to have a rash on my 15 months face  looked at asked multipule people how long it was going to be never got an answer went to leave to go to urgent are and they all looked at me like I was killing my daughter

name: Brandon Powe
text: I'm going to be volunteering up there, in like a couple weeks.

name: Morgan Patrick
text: Do not go here unless you have no ( I mean zero) options. This place has one dr and too many patients, you will be here forever. Go to urgent care or other hospital if you can spare the few minutes on the front side.

name: Shawndale Brown
text:
Horrible horrible horrible my grandfather was there for two days due to taking to much blood thinner he lost blood from his nose and mouth
for 24 hrs before they gave him blood.. and that was 24 hrs after they found out his r&r was low. His cancer doctor said he was on the urge of bleeding to death.he was very unpleased with their care and asked the family to take him to Thomas next time

name: Chase Matthews
text: This hospital has a truly wonderful and caring ER staff.

name: Chad Greene
text: North Baldwin Infirmary, providing quality care and professional service.

name: LilMiss Nsanity
text: I called because I can't afford the antibiotic prescribed and was told that it wasn't their fault that I can't afford the script. Thanks for nothing! I'll skip the bills next time and just die on my couch, less aggravating

name: Anthony Roberts
text: had to click the one star..... they need to shut the doors on this place. fire everybody and start over.

name: Amber McDonald
text: Not my favorite place to go for anything other than imaging!

name: Asia Anderson
text: They are very slow and also very rude

name: Stephen Headrick
text: Had a hernia surgery this morning performed by Dr Figh. I wish I had taken note of names so that I could thank everyone of them individually. But suffice it to say the entire staff was excellent, professional, and very friendly.  I have had many IVs over the past few months due to cancer treatment which makes vein identification and establishment of a painless IV often difficult. Although it took two punctures (something very common for me) the nurse  was very good. She told me to prepare for a big stick, ha, I barely felt it and it was quickly set up. The in room staff was extremely attentive and the operating room staff was great. They kept me informed of everything happening before anything was done. Well at least as long as I was awake. They made a difficult event very pleasurable. Like most people I don’t enjoy getting older and experiencing an exponential increase in doctor visits and associated surgeries. However this trip was about as enjoyable as a surgery could be made. Thank you Decatur Morgan for making my rainy day pleasurable.

name: Maureen Feld
text: I think the staff and everyone there were very nice to me and everyone. There were quite a few people there but is was well organized. I was there on March 17th. I was impressed with everyone, even the people who were coming in like me! Thank you! We are all there for a reason and very lucky to have the opportunity to even have so many medical people helping us! I feel very fortunate to have gotten my first vaccine so I can feel so much safer.  Thank you all for your services..

resp.text: Ms. Feld thank you so very much for the encouraging words and the wonderful compliments, will make sure to share them with the staff at the Vaccine Clinic.  We appreciate you taking the time to give us a 5 star rating and for sharing your experience.  We are grateful to provide this service to you and to the community. Thank you again!

name: Heath Mayes
text: Very nasty er not worried about patients. I'll die before I come back here.

resp.text: Mr. Mayes so sorry to hear about your experience in our Emergency Room, we would like to have one of our Hospital Representative contact you to discuss your situation further.  If you would like to send us your contact phone number and the  best time for us to contact you. Thank you - send to decaturmorganhospital@gmail.com

name: Emily Brock
text: These people are so unorganized. I had to convince them to look for the lab work. They finally listened when I said it had been sent to the lab and they called the lab and lo and behold yep it was there just like I said it was. My child is a trooper when it comes to having blood drawn so when there was a complaint about how tight the tourniquet was, I knew it was serious. And then I could tell there was pain when the needle was being pulled out. Like I said my child doesn't complain about that.. so that was a pretty big deal to me.

name: Sandra Cooper
text: I went to hospital on 5/22/21 @ 9 pm. I had blood pressure pike up, face, upper arms,chest, and back turn bright red with heat. I feel like I was going to pass out. I told them I had a very bad headache but never offered anything for pain, to drink anything either. Dr shiver acted like I was wasting his time. The did a AEG and blood work. Then he came in and said he was not giving anything to lower BP or to help my head from hurting. I got out of their about 2 am with bp 190/98 and my head about to blow. It was a waste of my time and leaving me upset 😡  and disappointed in the medical care I received. The quality of care was bar to none. That dr needs to retire for he does not care enough to give quality care. I will no longer go there for care again.

resp.text: Ms. Cooper so sorry to hear about your bad experience at our Parkway Campus Emergency Department.  We would like to have one of Hospital Representative contact your to discuss further.  If you would please send us your contact phone number and the best time for us to contact you.  Please send to decaturmorganhospital@gmail.com  Thank you!

name: Wilbert VanDuynhoven
text: We arrived at the ER shortly before 10:00AM to be checked after a fall from a ladder. Filled out paperwork, got vitals checked and then back to the waiting room.  At 12:40 (over 2.5 hours) we decided to leave and try somewhere else. There is no telling how long we would have sat there and no one gave us any idea how long it would be. I recommend going to Parkway by ambulance, they have special doors and no waiting.  Hopefully my issues will go away with time ☹️

name: Dana Walizer
text: My friend took her 8 month old there last night with a 105 fever 5 hours they were there and then sent him home with 103 temperature now poor thing is in Birmingham  Childers hospital God be with him

resp.text: Ms. Walizer so very sorry to hear about your experience here at Decatur Morgan Hospital.  We would love to have one of our Hospital Patient Representatives contact you to discuss your experience further.  If you would please send us your contact phone number and the best time for us to contact you.  Send to decaturmorganhospital@gmail.com  - look forward to hearing back from you. Thank you

name: Tasha Ballard
text:
I was just in the emergency room earlier this morning
with excruciating pain in my left side which happen to be kidney stones. I was very impressed with how fast I was in and out. I did not have to wait and the nurses and doctor were so caring and kind. They started me with an IV and pain medicine and blood work which was very quickly. I got great care

name: Tammy Bollhoefer
text: My father has spent 6 days in the ICU and has received good care. The ICU nursing staff has been attentive and professional. The night nurse, Paige is one of the best nurses I have ever witnessed. He is efficient, knowledgeable and works with confidence and compassion. I  am grateful for his ability during my father's illness.

name: Rodney Stewart
text: The majority of nurses are very rude, uncaring, and act in a hateful manner. They make patient's wait for help up to an hour after being called to room. They sit at the nurses desk laughing and joking. They make patient's feel as if they are a bother. Unprofessional and should be unacceptable....

name: Cory Woods
text: I would put no stars but the staff is very unprofessional and a worker told me there is no one that works there that can give medical records what kind of place is this

name: Barbara Weinbaum
text: I have been to the emergency room three times since June. Each time I was helped quickly and efficiently.  The last time I was there I was admitted and treated for pneumonia and sepsis.  I was under their care for two days. The medical staff was wonderful! They were very attentive and answered requests quickly.

name: Will Wright
text: Doing xrays in the Er waiting room. Been here over a hour and a half with no one taken back. Disgustion for a hospital

name: Tracey Erklenz
text: Was admitted by the E.R. Doctor and ended up staying in the hospital for 4 days. I couldn't have asked to be treated any better! They were all Amazing!

name: Javier Kmasho
text:
TAKE THIS PLACE LIKE THE LAST CHOICE TO COME OR BRING FAMILY OR FRIENDS
Well  is really hard to do this  but I will try my best...
Staff  are really good  nurses  but my only concern is my wife is in here from yesterday around afternoon time...  by emergency services  she get room around 6 pm then  the doctor  show up around  7 pm
Today 11:50  am  nurses have no idea when doctor is going to come ...
My point is simple  "after

name: Jonalee Kittrell
text: Took my boyfriend here because he has all the signs of the flu. Took a flu test and took an xray. He had been sleeping for 2 days. Severe headache, body hurting and sleeping. Test result came back not the flu. They told him he didnt have anything wrong but brought him back in and then said he has a virus. Seriously, how would they know if they didn't draw blood? A doctor never even saw him. They didn't check to see if he was dehydrated.. Worst place ever! oh and they were all rude!!

name: Buffy Watson
text:
I had food poisoning and with hourly violent vomiting and diarrhea. We went there at about two in the morning several months ago. We were sent to the private ER room after about 5 minutes (not much going on). I was treated and taken care of very quickly. They gave me meds that completely stopped the vomiting and nausea (which was awful). The doctor and the nurses were all compassionate and helpful. After a round of glucose they let me go home. I am very grateful for the service that they provide.

Also, my husband's blood pressure spiked one day and we took him, they saw him very, very quickly and did a lot of tests to make sure he didn't have a heart attack. He was fine and we are thankful that they were so thorough.

Some towns aren't lucky enough to have hospitals in them, we have two. We are blessed.

name: SPICE Bro
text: My wife went in for delivery for my daughter. It seemed like no one cared. Also I have stage four cancer, the guy at the door of the emergency room was very rude to me. Staring and had an ill demeanor asking me was wrong with you. But not in the caring way. Also I whole time my wife was in the hospital non of the staff or nurses would help my wife and when that did you could feel like they just wanted out of there. Even a cup of ice. I would have to go get everything she needed or annoy someone for them to do there job.

name: Christopher Schaffer (BeardedMrPotatoHead)
text: If I could rate lower I would. You could be dying and they would still take their sweet time getting a doctor to see you. I spent 6 hours waiting to see a doctor and ended up leaving because they told me they didn’t know how much longer it would be. Now I’m headed to Huntsville because they actually care about their patients.

name: Felicia Easterling
text:
Majority of staff are extremely rude and uncaring. Another ER visit here but only due to Ambulance insisting because it's the closes hospital, and I use that term very loosely.  I would like to have a decent hospital in the area. Not sure what Huntsville hospital system needs to do other than literally clean house. When staff tells you they are going to beat your A*#, speaking of the lady at the desk in the ER... I think there's a problem. Administration.
Then there's the call button and no one ever responds to the call until hours later.
The 1 star does go to the RN who was polite, would sit down and talk to me, and the 2 women who offered me a hug and just stayed with me. AND FOR HEAVENS SAKE... DONT TELL SOMEONE YOU UNDERSTAND WHEN YOU HAVE NO IDEA WHAT THEY ARE DEALING WITH!!! ER DESK LADY!!!!

name: Jennifer Cobb
text: Parkway has the best staff. Everyone is so friendly and helpful

name: QD.
text:
They will lie to you so you will stay in the ER. They do not provide sick slips for work unless something is broken or your dying. "Got back pain? Go back to work you lazy bum. -Doctor"
I have an injury. Put me on light duty or give me an off day. Don't lie to me and say you can then tell me you can't.
This is why you can't trust anything they say, they will do anything for money.
If your not dying. Don't go to this place.

name: Dg Elovely
text: I was here for 3 days and had the best medical treatment, sweetest staff, and comfortable rooms.

name: Michael Hamilton
text: It's supposed to be a hospital with an active ER. If you have insurance or if there's a major problem you are treated somewhat professionally. But if you don't have insurance you have to see a PA. Some of them have an attitude and they do not treat you with respect. Dr. Putman  is a good veterinarian if you don't like your animals. There are some good Dr and nurses here, but they are few and far between, every since Huntsville hospital took over the quality of care has declined. This is just one man's opinion!

name: Jessica Johnson
text: I went in to the parkway campus er. I have had a headache since yesterday so bad I can’t eat and it hurts to move and I am very weak. I told them I was 22 weeks pregnant and I was miserable. They put me in a room and came in later and said I can’t do anything for you because your pregnant. I said you can’t do bloodwork or see if I am dehydrated and he said we can give you fluids if u want us to but that’s all we can do and sent me home! I will not be back this is ridiculous.

name: Frank Mitchell
text: Horrible Place! My wife and I had a tragedy during the summer she had a to have a still born birth. The nurses were very rude to me. I went to get food for everyone in the room when I came back they did not buzz me thru the door for at least an hour later ( no reason behind it). One of the nurses told my wife she had a false positive STD which to Doctor had to smooth over because that was not true (potential lawsuit). Then on the birth and death certificate the staff for some reason did not want my name on it. Horrible prenatal care from beginning to end!

name: Twyla Prince
text:
My friend that is having severe cramping and bleeding. She is 8 weeks pregnant and wants to know if there is anything wrong. She has been waiting for 2 hours in the ER waiting room.

A family comes in with a 10 year old that has her arm sprained and they take her back first after my friend has been waiting for an hour already.

This hospital is worried about a sprained arm more than the life of a baby??
Yet you guys be screaming at abortion clinics about SAVING A CHILD'S LIFE???????? But this shows how much this hospital doesn't care about babies.

name: Michelle BossChic
text: I came to ER on a Friday with my BP 220/166 n the worse Headache ever.....The BP cuff was pumping on my arm so much that it popped off by itself and when the Nurse came back in she was so rude ... She informed me if I'm not gonna do the treatment and take the meds then they would just discharge me... I inform her that it did it on it's on and it was hurting causing a bruise on my arm...She continued to repeat herself so I got rude back and asked her was she even listening to me...She had no remorse to the fact that the cup was bout to cut my arm off..... I have asked to be discharged so I could go somewhere else but they won't...I'm ready to walk out with this IV in my arm

name: Elizabeth Eubanks
text: I came here 6 weeks after I had my son via c section. My incision had busted open and was oozing green. They were not friendly at all. They came in and checked my blood and after making sure that it was all clear they were going to just send me out the door without cleaning my wound or putting a bandage on it or anything. I wasn't going to leave a bad review, but here we are a year later and my husband had a chest X-ray done at parkway and the dr nor a nurse ever come in to even discuss his X-ray. Someone came in to discharge him and never even offered an explaination for his symptoms or anything. They were trying to rush him out the door the same way they did me!! Not one medical professional discussed his X-rays or referred him anywhere else. He is having trouble breathing and having chest pains!! Parkway is a JOKE!!!

name: Marcus Hoeft
text: They have the worst wait times ever they rather see people with "pain" than people with actual problems. Been in this waiting room for almost 3 hours and only got vitals done. My daughter has a head injury and cant remember when it how she got it. Do not take anyone here.

name: mitzi quick
text: Went in to ER with kidney stone. Every staff member  I encountered was caring and helpful.

name: Heather Strickland
text: Awful ER doctor. I went because I had what I thought was seizure's. Had an episode in the room with the nurse. Doctor comes in ignoring the episode, wouldn't let my husband speak (I couldn't form words) and kept asking me why my eyes were dilated. I don't know, thats what I was there for. Doctor kept looking at my tattoo's and immediately wanted a urine sample and blood work done. Treated me as a drug addict. Everything came back normal. But the doctor not once asked about the symptoms I experienced, didn't ask about any of that. Just looked into my eyes, listened to my chest and said it was a headache. He wouldn't ask anything other than what is the level of headache do you have. Not once asked about my possible seizure, not once talked to my husband who experienced me having one. The nurse never mentioned to us or the doctor about the episode I had in the actual room with her. Nothing was done but blood work and urine sample. I went in for possible seizures and left without anything but a diagnosis of a headache. What a bunch of crap. I've had another episode yesterday but I will not go back to this place.

name: Chelsea Lynn
text: Rude ass front desk check-in workers who act like they don't care about your health and when you finally get back to be seen the staff is still extremely rude, act like you're not important when you don't have a physical injury. MENTALLY ILL PEOPLE NEED HELP TO. I SERIOUSLY HATE THIS HOSPITAL AND CANT WAIT TO MOVE TO BE NEAR A BETTER ONE.

name: Hallie Podhora
text: Worst hospital I've ever been to we set there for almost 3 hrs before my 11yr old son was even seen with a HORRIBLE EAR INFECTION!!!! I WILL NEVER AGAIN GO BACK TO THIS HOSPITAL. The worst part is, it wasn't even busy all the nurses and doctors were at the front talking laughing and cutting up while my son sits in a cold room crying his eyes out....

name: Susannah
text: Won't go back. Will drive to Madison, Athens or Huntsville for care...basically anywhere but here. My father-in-law passed away in this ER. Doctors should have asked for transport to Huntsville as soon as he came in, but he passed away during transport hours later. As for my own experience, I was there 6 hours one time just to get rehydrated from a stomach bug. The doctor was slow as Christmas and he thought he was being funny/smart and he wasn't. Another time, I came in and the doctor on call never said a word to me about my condition and then it was shift change and another doctor came in and didn't tell me anything either. The nurses filled me in. Ridiculous. The two doctors I did see looked as if they came out of retirement to work as they both appeared to be in their late 60's-70's and totally out of touch. This hospital was ranked #23 in the 50 most expensive hospitals in Alabama in 2015. I can believe it as they nickel and dime everything and yet they aren't ranked as one of the better hospitals in Alabama so they have no valid excuse for their price increases. If you want quality care with doctors that will take their time and explain things, go to Madison Hospital or Crestwood.

name: Samantha betts
text: I also work in healthcare and this is by far the worst hospital I've ever seen. Yes. I have high standards. The hospital I work for is a 2 time winner of the Malcolm Baldrige award so I know quality. This is 3rd world care at best and I won't allow another family member back to this facility.

name: Chrina Serrant
text: Absolutely, the worst staff an emergency department can ever have. I went in for a very bad sore throat an couldnt talk or swallow. I went through triage an i had to ask what was my blood pressure an my temp. Once taken to a room i waited 45 minutes before anyone an i mean anyone to come into my room. Very bad bedside manners. Now, when you come in with a sore throat an cant swallow with a low grade temp test should have been drawn. But Dr. Simmons came in with the worst attitude an ask why was i there, looked in my mouth an said oh well you have laryngitis.... now, they swabbed my throat.... an never mentioned what my results were. Then asked if i was allergic to antibiotics. About 40 mins after a nurse came in with discharge papers an a cup of liquid... now remind you i said i couldnt swallow anything an my throat was on fire. I told the nurse that i cant swallow anything, she was very rude an snotty an said ill go see if he will give you an antibiotic shot... well that would make more since, i mean for gods sake my throat is red an swollen. I had to wait another 35 mins before she came in an said very rudely he aint going to give you a shot. Soooooo, why would you treat patients like that. This isnt the first time he has treated me or any body else like this but im not about to hush about it this time. He is very rude, unprofessional, an it shows on his face that he dosent like his job an that he is only there for the money. He could have given me an antibiotic shot i wasnt asking for any pain meds just give me a shot to open up my throat. But he treated me very rudely. I dont understand why still have him there or anywhere. Everyone i talk to always say that he has a i dont like people attitude. Parkway is a total joke. If you want rude unprofessional staff that dosent take their job seriously then be my guess. As of now, because he didnt care enough to treat me i have an infection in my chest an my throat is worst. Ill drive to huntsville cause he be at decatur general as well. He will let you get worst before he puts his degree to use. Stay away.

name: Leann Ore
text: Went in for a painful and swollen leg. Wait was short, staff very friendly.

name: G G
text: At first I was split. I came here 3 years ago and had great service. Now I've been here 4 plus hours with no service.

name: 1 Vic
text: Worse hospital I’ve ever been to. By far. Stay away. You would be better off driving to Huntsville bleeding out before they would even worry about seeing you here. Stay almost 4 hours for the stupid “dr” to say there’s nothing we can do for you here. Screw that place

name: PATRICIA
text:
My Brother almost died in this ER.  By the Grace of God he was shipped out after sitting in the ER for over 24 hours.  Yes.. 24 hours sitting on stretcher for 24 hours after having a stroke and spiking fevers of 104°. Found out he had MRSA of the blood stream!
Way to go Parkway !!
ONLY reason you get one star is because I had to put a star before I could Start writing!

name: Courtney Haggermaker
text:
I was pregnant and went to see the OBGYN staff. I was considered high risk considering I had a previous preterm delivery. Not only did they refuse an ultrasound that I had requested, they also never even let me see an actual OBGYN. The staff knew my hcg level numbers and they did not do further investigation on them. They did not put forth any effort to make me feel positive I was having a healthy pregnancy. I personally had to call and ask and investigate my numbers on my own. I went on to Madison emergency room because as a mother, and just my gut feeling, I knew something was wrong. Also, I had told them i had been bleeding, not that they were concerned. I went to the ER and found out I had miscarried. Parkway did not offer to do any preterm/miscarriage prevention for me. I am not blaming them for losing my unborn baby, but I am blaming them for the lack of medical treatment and compassion. I will never EVER step foot in parkway again besides the follow up appointment I have to go to. Only because it is now solely for my health, and not for my baby and I. This place will forever be at the bottom of my list. Please .. if you are pregnant and want the best care for you and your unborn, do not consider this one of the places, if at all optional.

I think they need more educated and caring staff at this facility.

name: Crazy Girl
text: The nurses were great except on smart ass nurse. She said well the xray shows bones and it's not broken. Well I just got a call from another nurse saying the radiologist looked over the xray again and my son does have a break in his finger. Also the MD Christopher Simmons is a joke as a doctor. I went in with my foot hurting pretty bad and he treated me as if I was addicted to pain meds and I didn't even want pain meds. He said he was gonna put me in a boot and give me meds for neuropathy pain which is not a narcotic and it helps alot. Then the nurse the smart ass comes in and discharged us and we ask about the boot and meds and Christopher Simmons denys saying anything about helping me. This ER is a complete joke. And he should be fired he doesnt care about his patients at all. Oh and it was four days ago when I took my son. Just so y'all know. He has had a broken bone for 4 days.

name: Dan Mitchell
text: Arrived 1:35am severe headache and vomiting. Walked out after waiting til 3:45am right before name was called. Should direct patients to another hospital with a potential wait like this.

name: Suzanne Johnson
text: Nursing care is ridiculously poor. Patients wait hours to receive medication. Nurses leave their notes on patients laying around in rooms calling patients names. Horrible

name: Allison Mitchell
text:
I have a lung disease and I have to have infusions weekly. It causes debilitating migraine. Staff treats u like a drug addict.
Makes me sick

name: John White
text: Hospital staff friendly but in the ER my first physician was my only physician and a professional. However , upon discharge a shift change occurred and an unknown physician ( at the time ) discharged me using a disease she picked from thin air and was never tested for ( no tests whatsoever ) and then billed me along with the first doctor , which was also illegal. The Pegasus ER group supporting this doctor has illegally billed me for this doctors crime and its damaged my credit. To allow such criminal activity shows the hospital has no standard practices setup to keep this from happening. I'm inclined to find others she has committed crimes against and file a class action suit against Pegasus. This is a large black female doctor working in the emergency department. Please , avoid this so called physician at all costs.

name: Lauren Matthews
text: Y'ALL PLEASE READ THE REVIEWS ON HERE BEFORE YOU GO. THIS PLACE IS RIDICULOUS!!! I went to the emergency room because I was having chest pains. Waited almost an hour before being called back, then I was in a room almost 4 hours because they ran test after test. What took even longer was THEY HAD MY TEST RESULTS BUT THEY WERE ALL OUTSIDE LAUGHING AND GOSSIPING AMONGST EACH OTHER instead of coming in to tell me my results! My mom had go get them and ask them what's the hold up and all they said was "we we're just about to come in" AFTER HOURS OF LAYING ON THE BED! Then they MISDIAGNOSED me saying I had an enlarged lymph node in my chest and when I went to my doctor for an CT scan there was nothing there! These reviews are TRUE that hospital WILL NOT take care of you!! Worst care ever! if you care about yourself or family members DO NOT bring them there!!

name: Amanda Muse
text: I don’t understand how this place is still in business. By far the worst experience in my life.

name: Mindy Guffey
text: Excellent Group of Dr's, Nurse's, NURSE PRACTIONERS, and Staff at the OBGYN AN ASSOCIATES! They are Caring, Kind Hearted, Compassionate, and When I call  to talk to a Health Care Professional it doesn't take long for them to call me back! I also used them to deliver my 4 children, which is Young Adults and I WILL Always Highly Recommend These Groups of Dr's! I Greatly Appreciate What You Did For Me as a Young Mother an Now what Ya'll Do for My Children! THANK YA'LL AN GOD BLESS EVERYONE!

name: Burls Lynn
text: I am in health care. I know all about being busy. I sprained my entire foot, or that is what I was told. I never got to see the x-rays. RED FLAG...!!! Doctor told me, verbatim , " we will give you something for pain, a boot for your foot, and crutches." I had to beg for something for pain. I had to beg for crutches, and the nurse was very rude and non compassionate at all. My foot is bruised and swollen all over.. I never got the boot and was give Tylenol...WHAT!!! I went to the hospital bc elevating, wrapping, ice and Tylenol was what I did at home. Why would anyone waist of time and go through all that nonsense, to be told and given the same thing I was doing at home. And had to sit there elevating my foot by actually holding it. Was never given a pillow to help with elevation. NOTHING!!! It is confusing and just unreasonable for the whole entire stress of going to er, waiting and waiting. Hurting beyond words. I have a leasing on my liver that was just detected. And Tylenol is what my real Dr told me I definaltly did not need to take. The doctor was arrogant no sympathy at all. And the nurse could have helped get my point across and try and talk to him. But no.. it actually made me feel shamed.. I am no drug seeker. But when I  hurt, I'm not playing. And all I want is not not be in throbbing continual excruceiating pain.. idk know what's  the problem with that. Seems pretty reasonable to me. I understand the ones that only want pills and all that, but EVERYONE is put under the same umbrella. That is just wrong. And when you take the time to go to the hospital, when your doing more for yourself at home, and nothing works and you end up with less and unprofessional help at the hospital? This is just wrong, in every way possible. I am extremely unbelievably disappointed and makes my trust in the entire health care system, something no one can really depend on when it is there so the ones that are hurt can trust and believe in, that they will completely help and depend on. Things have changed for the worse, and makes no one trust they will get the care we as human beings deserve and pay for.  Maybe this review will help, I doubt it bc the way I feel parkway feels about a human being, and the way I was completely uncared for today is double noted and received..  IT IS JUST A SHAME!!!!!!!       Kim Mitchell

name: Sherri Ware
text: Hello my name is sherri ware this is the worst hospital ever i wouldn't recommend no one to go here very bad you will die worst staff horrible nurses and they will just leave you sitting for hours

name: Maggie Holder
text: I went to the ER with agonizing pain in my right side. I sat in a wheelchair in a room with no need for over an hour. Then I was moved to a room with a bed. The nurse came in and asked what was wrong. The Dr only came in 1 time never touched me. He told me I had a severe kidney infection based on blood/urine. He had already ordered a shot for pain/nausea meds but no IV. Do after he came in he asked do you want another shot. I said please I'm really hurting. He ordered the shot along with writing me some rx's one for pain and the other for antibiotic. The ignorant nurse came in to discharge me and gabby given me the shot yet. So she went back out and 30mins later came back with shot. Then she said you have to stay for 10mins. I understood cauz I don't think they wanted me to react but it was the same shot as before. Then 30mins later my husband went and asked if I could go home. The nurse said I was just coming to get her. She let me lay there almost long enough for my pain shot to wear off. I saw Dr Reddy and he was excellent. My previous experiences with Dr Putnam were horrendous. If they could get some good nurses I think they'd be better cauz I don't think Putnam is there anymore.

name: Kimberly Hogan
text: I wish I would've read the reviews before taking my husband there, but since I didn't, I'll do a public service and let EVERYONE know that this hospital is horrible. He has a history of neck issues including bulging discs which cause him severe pain. Today, his neck popped and he was in such severe pain, like none I'd ever seen him in. He's not one to put on a show, and he cried for 4 hours or more. The doctor, Dr. Putman, did not even come in and see, nor did a nurse practioner. He was given one muscle relaxer at the hospital and we were sent home with a prescription for the muscle relaxer and prescription Aleve. There was more they could've done for him, including giving him an injection of tramidol, also a steroid shot. I know this because I am a healthcare professional. I WOULD NOT EVEN TAKE MY DOG TO PARKWAY MEDICAL CENTER!!!! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE IF YOU WANT DECENT CARE!

name: Mercedes Caballero
text: I went to have a schdueled c section when originaly was going to go to madison hospital but decided to go gere cause was closer . Well, I regret it all. I have moved gere from another state a year ago and never have I experienced a hospital labor and dilivery and c section to be so bad. If I can report this.to owner I would. For one the anesthesiologist was perfect no problem there. The OR was ok also nice staff till the baby was arriving my hubby wanted to see and take pics more then two and I be dame they told him sit he cant take no more. He was upset this is the we haveing and wanted more pics and he always was able to take so many pics and ve all over the place and hold vavy in OR . Well this time not even let him or I hold her. Well afer that I went in my room then 2 days I had a nurse during the day that was ok but rarely came to.my calls and tore the tape off my belly like it was nothing and ripped skin made me bleed. I wanted to take pics but could not reach I still can but scabbing now . Anyways my nurse in the night was so awsome I loved her. The dinner for me and my hubby was ok except had nowhere to sit and was not set up so nice like we had in the past in other hospitals. Well anywaya with all that being said   I could have stayed 4 days to heal but I pushed to.go home the ahower did not work right the mattress was so old I felt all the metal under it horable. So much more im so upset and will always remember such a horrable days when should have been the time of my life haveing a baby expesually my last one ugh. Disgusted.

name: Chad Sourceone
text: Seen night security guard sleeping only waking up to harass the cleaning lady. He is a nasty slob. How is he employed by a hospital

name: Kimpy Prince
text: The absolute worst staff in a hospital facility I've ever experienced

name: Mike Sprinkle
text: ER is terrible.  My daughter was brought in by ambulance.  They were in NO hurry sending in a Dr.   Hrs later we were dismissed and told to follow up with primary care physician.

name: Pamela Baker
text: i took my 16 year old cause she had a knot in her leg the woman up front told us to sit then she call us to get her imformation she never called us i had to go up thiere and whenwe went up thiere she gave us a mean look was real smart with us she was just a rude woman decatur general is way better they aint smart butts like that woman was on 7/8/13 3am

name: scott appleton
text: My friend's son went there 3 times within a week and a half period. Everytime Dr. Michael Riehl sent him home saying that the 7 yr old was dehydrated and to give him gatorade and tylenol  for the fever he had been running. After the 3rd time my Friend carried his son to Huntsville Hospital, within 30 min he had 4 IV's, oxygen and was going to be in the hospital for a minimum of 2 weeks. DEHYDRATED!!!!!!!! He had caught a very aggressive bacteria and they are now going to have to have surgery to remove some of the worst areas of infection. This Doctor needs to have his license revoked. Dr's have forgotten that they have someone else's life in their hand's. Please do not use this hospital for anything or at least not Dr. Riehl. What if it was you or your child?

name: Jalisa Swopes
text: I had a experience from hell...i took my son to ER because he seem to have what look loke a spider bite and to make a long story short the RN was rude we asked did it look like she said she didnt know like come on now you are an RN you could have said it looks like one or we will make sure that its not but just toake the patient/parent feel comfortable...then the doctor comes and is being rude from the beginning and after she examines the seem to be spider bite i asked for an drs excuse and she says what time do you have to be at work and i replied 6...lets not forget we arrived at the hospital at 1am and did not leave till 3am but she says well you should not have been up all night...reminding her that my 3yr old might  have a spider bite...that was the worst wxpwrience i have ever had at the ER i will never take my child to Parkway ever again

name: Ali Saleh
text: Worst ER ever waiting time it’s crazy

name: Malcolm Bankston
text: If you actually value the life of the person....DONT SEND THEM HERE !!!!

name: Joseph Townsend
text: Mother waited 5.5 hours with blood pressure  at 183/110 before getting anything for pain or bp.

name: Jennifer Gray
text: On Wednesday, April 28, 2021, I went to Russell Medical Center Urgent Care. I went there after getting back into Alexander City from my job. I almost fall in my bathtub and I have back and pelvic pain from preventing myself from completely falling. I decided to go to Urgent Care because I could not get an appointment to see a doctor. I thought that it would not take long. The first time I went there the wait was long and I had to leave because ADT was coming to my house to update my system. I returned later to Urgent Care to get some help with my back. My back was supposed to been x-rayed. Well, the X-ray technician had a very unpleasant expression on her face. She was not friendly. She just proceeded to slam the doors open. When we in the x-ray room, she started questioning me. Asking me, why did I leave and come back repeatedly and she said she did not know why she had to do an x-ray on me. I told her that it was none of her business why I had to leave and come back. I left the Urgent Care because the x-ray technician clearly did not either want to do her job or she did not want to x-ray a black person or she assumed that because I am black that I am there for pain meds. I have been to this Urgent Care several times for my sinus infections. This was the first time that I had been there for something else. I will never use this Urgent Care or the hospital again for anything. My appointment with Dr. Holcombe, who was treating me for IBS, will be canceled and I will find another gastroenterologist outside of Alexander City to treat me. My husband drove me to Opelika to the hospital so that I could get help with my back. I am strongly considering talking to an attorney about unethical treatment from the Urgent Care at Russell Medical Center. In addition, I am also seeking to contact the State of Alabama Medical Board.

name: Nicolas Grams
text: Whoever is in charge of the patient portal is useless. It has not worked in 4 months. I've called three times with no call backs and I've emailed twice, with surprise, no response. The one time I actually had someone answer the phone, they took my information and said the portal was down, and they never contacted me again.

name: Padan Smith
text: Well known for their negligence, poor communication skills, and lack of empathy in general. I have heard a wide variety of people make negative remarks about this hospital and how poor it’s reputation is and has been over my lifetime, but I can now confirm that over the last 30 days my family and I were truly introduced to the most unprofessional and unorganized group of “professionals” we have ever encountered and we so badly wish that we had heeded all of the warnings. We called the ICU 3 times a day during my grandfathers 30 day (post Covid) stay and every time we talked to a different “professional “ we received a new and very different response regarding factual information every time we called, for example: when we asked how long my grandfather was able to perform during his once a day lung conditioning. Some staff members would tell us “about the same as yesterday (2 hours)” and then a few hours later when we asked about his overall well-being a different staff member would say “he’s stable but he only made it 30 minutes during lung conditioning today”. How can factual information vary so drastically regarding a once daily ( supposedly documented) test? We were also never informed in any way that my grandfathers Dr that initially evaluated him upon his arrival to the hospital and ultimately decided a day later to place him on the ventilator was out of the country for 3 of the 4 weeks that my grandfather was there (yes, under the care of a dr who was not presently in the same country which we would not have been comfortable with). No one ever let us know his dr was out until he was returning. With factual information constantly changing depending on who answered the call we felt so confused and discouraged because we never really trusted any information we were told. The hospital staff  failed to notify us until 24 hours after they accidentally punctured his lung and caused it to collapse. They still cannot get the story straight as to which lung they punctured. This hospital made a terrible time in our lives completely unbearable because we couldn’t rely on any of the information we were receiving to have any accuracy which resulted in a lot of heartbreak. We tried on several occasions to solve this communication issue and managed to always remain patient with them but no matter what we said no one ever cared to clear things up or apologize for the lack of communication. In the end everyone we talked to finally got on the same page and gave constant reminders that we needed to make a decision to either trach my grandfather or cut the ventilator off. Somehow they all were all able to be on the same page for that. A constant reminder for us to have that decision made in time for his drs return. To say we are displeased with the staff would be an understatement. Our hearts are broken obviously, but I do not think anyone should go through the valley my family did without trying to fix the issue for others to come. Please don’t fall victim to this place. This is the first review I’ve ever taken the time to share and if it potentially saves one life then it was well worth the effort. Seek medical help somewhere else, please.

resp.text: Good afternoon Ms. Shelton.  We have heard a lot of positive feedback from the community about how well-organized our vaccination clinics have been, and are very sorry you were not pleased with your experience.  Our team works hard to make every patient experience at our facility the best it can be.  In order to allow those in line for vaccination to wait inside the lobby area and not outside the building, it does unfortunately get a little crowded at times.  This is one reason we have never done a first dose and second dose clinic on the same day.  Because we give vaccines on a first come first served basis, we assign a number to each person to try to maintain an order based on arrival.  People are vaccinated according to their number in line which may have been confusing as some people could have passed you to get their vaccine while you were standing in line.  We are happy to help our community by offering COVID-19 vaccination administration and will continue to work hard to provide a positive experience for those getting a vaccine at our facility.

I worked here for about 6 months hoping to work closer to home . I reported almost every day that I worked , out of date food being left in patient pantry’s on each floor as well as molded food being found in the kitchen and refrigerator from being inappropriately stored and labeled and was being served to the patient’s ( yes I found mold several times on rolls or cornbread that was on the line being put on plates ) They are supposed to cook new bread everyday , they do not . . And bc of my constant  reporting (complaining as the manager calls it  ) I was shifted around constantly from area to area so I wouldn’t continue to report these issues ,instead of reprimands being written up . yet in every new area I would find the same issues , the manager finally stuck me out front so I’d be out of the kitchen and off the line . Yet I found the same issues .. English muffins out front in the dining area being served that were 3 months out of date . Food being recycled more times than is allowed . ( some stuff they put on the lunch line out front , they told you not to get that for your lunch , it’s ify , but the manager won’t let us throw it out ) yet it was put out on the lunch menu . For visitors and staff to eat . I wrote report after report  to the manager of the kitchen , I reported any issues I found in daily logs to make a record of the concerns as well as to the company manager which fell on deaf ears . The state came in to do their yearly check , and the cafeteria  FAILED for everything I had been reporting for mouths , the rating they got is specified as ( has the potential to contaminate a large group of people) . When I talked to the manager about the score , and hoped the concerns would be taken seriously FINALLY!!  I was told that they make to much money for the hospital and there’s no way they would loose their contract no matter what there score was . Needless to say I Quit and will never take my family there . The manager probably thought I was over stepping or trying to take her job which I wasn’t . There isn’t room for this kind of nonsense in the food industry. These poor patients are already behind the eight ball just from being in the hospital for and injury or illness. And these people don’t care to feed them contaminated food .
It’s appalling.

name: Jacey Brown
text: absolutely awful service... won’t b going there ever

name: Becky Wilson
text: Very rude people

name: Beck Norm
text: My dad had surgery there today and they were great. His surgery was set for 10 am and we were home but 2 pm. Everyone was so friendly.

name: John McLain
text: I waited nine hours only to have a doctor step in and tell me that he did not know how to treat me (I was having vertigo).  It took him all of three minutes to tell me this.  For this, the hospital charged me $1,800.  As if that were not outrageous enough, after I paid the hospital, the doctor sent me a separate bill for another $1,200.  No one, not the hospital nor the collection agency will give me a phone number or an address for the doctor.  No one has been able to give me any detail regarding what this doctor's bill is for.  I will not pay it and I will never set foot in that rat-hole again.  By the way, why do I have to give any stars in order to post this?

name: Carolann Lacey
text: This place is full of nothing but the most incompetent people. It needs to be under investigation. I had X-rays done and they tell me what's wrong but refused to print the reason for my visit on my papers and tell me to follow up as I will need a surgery asap but when I try to follow up they want $200 to tell me the exact same thing and set a date. Funny, thought this was an emergency? Why are they pretending I was never there for this?

name: John Daye
text: This place should not even be called a hospital it's a damn joke they lie to you wont help you and kidnap people against there will just out of spite they don't deserve to be in business.i or my family will never step foot in it again. Especially the so called special care unit the nurses are terribly mean and rude.

name: Nathan Machen
text: I was there having a severe panic attack. The only thing that keeps in down some is for me to and Everytime I turn a corner these nurses busy out laughing me while im begging them to help me. I was losing control of all movement about to go out and my stepdad had to catch me.

name: teddy bear
text: Some doctor don't  care  they just want to get you in and out as quickly as possible  and don't listen to the patient

name: Bellamy Gibbs
text: So, Like most of the reviews is how I felt for 10 plus years. If you have the sniffles, go to Highlands. If you got heart, go to Huntsville, Vanderbilt, stroke, Erlanger. Yesterday after 2 months of my family doctor saying UTI and giving me meds that even wasn't for that , I decided ok let's give it a shot. Huntsville has a long wait time.  I went in @ 11 :30 am. They were swapped. Ok. From admissions to Jarrod, Vonda, Dr.Jones were right there.  I didn't have a UTI. They literally didn't stop to find out real problem.  Cyst on ovaries, Bladder infection. Really? He done a CT scan, pelvic exam, urine of course.  The only wait time I had was waiting on discharge. 2 hours!! Oh well, in 2 hours they were trying to keep 2 ppl who come in code 4. Unfortunately 1 didn't make it. Not a car wreck either. I prayed for these families. Y'all gripe over wait times not knowing the other end.  The doctors, nurses, CNA's have priorities. Why go to a hospital and spend your money to walk out not knowing or getting your scripts to solve the problem?They were trying and I  saw with my own 2 eyes them doing CPR on a guy. You think bc you're sick with sinuses, back pain, tooth pain, sniffles, slight fever that they don't care?They do!  It's by priority though. I'm glad they saved one life. I'm sorry for who lost their family member. Remember you're not the only one in the world. They go home I'm sure questioning "What could I have done different"? I commend these ppl.  The law force, fire fighters, Military. Think if you're closest family member was to die... Would they help the person with a cough , fever? Or would they save your family member first? Once again Ty Highlands. My point of view changed bc you now have carrying ppl  God bless...

name: Jennifer Eagle
text: I have been seen in the Emergency Room a few times and was also an inpatient before being transferred. While the hospital was a little bit out of date concerning technology the staff was always very friendly and helpful and willing to do anything they could to make the stay as well as the transfer easy for me.  I would definitely continue to be seen here.

name: Emily Forsythe
text: I REFUSE to go back to Highlands. Dr. Espinel is the rudest man I have ever had to speak with. I have called to report this so called Doctor. The nurse staff was absolutely the best towards my son and I but a disrespectful Doctor literally made my entire night horrible!

name: Robert Lech
text: It's a hospital

name: Ryan Harris
text: I went in for a severe cough, they past me around from department to department, ended up with a $3000 dollar bill, and no answer, as to what it was from, ended up having to go to another place, Highlands is a joke, they only want your money, they don’t care for anyone’s well being in my opinion.

name: Terry Wayne
text: Do not use address 380 woods cove Rd. 205 parks Ave will work much better. I notified hospital of the error and duplicate addresses.

name: Jinni Harrison
text:
These inept individuals have a proven track record of having no common sense or medical knowledge. Most recently my father came in having chest pains. They sent him home saying his EKG was fine. Fast forward to 2 days later he was visiting family in SPRINGFIELD ILLINOIS and he had severe chest pains .... ended up being taken BY AMBULANCE to the ER and had 8 - EIGHT - blockages in his heart ranging from 85-90% which lead to immediate emergency bypass surgery. They said had he so much as got upset at a stoplight he would have had a massive heart attack and died right there.

This hospital is HORRIBLE.

name: ray Whitney
text: My wife's visit to the ER 13 May, was not very pleasant, with only four people ahead of us the wait was excessive.  She broke her wrist and we waited in the back two hours for a doctor to visit.  I went out to the nurses station and met Nurse Nathan and told him my wife was in great pain, He immediately  got her a pain pill and some ice, after we waited  for another hour I went looking for a doctor, found Dr Baird who said we would be next, after thirty minutes He did come in and put a hard splint on her wrist.   That was a five hour wait, thank goodness for nurse Nathan, he seemed to really care.

name: Cameron Ashley
text: Was seen by Paul A Avenel MD and was completely disrespected by him. We are stationed at an Active Duty Air Force base in New Mexico where our primary care physician is and was unable to get care for my 5 month old son anywhere local because military insurance requires a referral for outside care. As our only option would be the ER so of course we put it off because that is a last resort situation. Our son was reading a 102° fever and getting worse . He looked very weak so we took him in to the ER and waited around 30 min which isn't bad. We were walked back into the waiting room and the doctor came in shortly after and he immediately told us that there was nothing wrong with him and this was not an ER worthy visit and that it probably wasn't even a PCP visit (primary care) but I've already wrote you a script because I know that's all you want. He left the room and the nurses came in and swabbed him for some tests and they came back in a while later and told us he had an ear infection. The doctor never did come back in and hes lucky he did not. Long story short, do not give this hospital the time of day or your money. I'd rather bleed out than go back there, kudos to the staff though. They were friendly

name: Anna Wilson
text: I waited two hours in the waiting room with severe abdominal pain. Then once I was taken back (after I threw up in the waiting room bathroom a few times) it took at least another hour before I saw a doctor. After he finally came in, he had no compassion or sympathy. Right before I was discharged  (I spent a total of six hours there) the nurse told me I had a UTI and to stop the use of a different antibiotic I was on. The doctor came in and never even mentioned the infection and told me to stay on my other antibiotic. So, since we received mixed signals we asked the pharmacist what we should do and what the medication was for and he said the same thing the nurse did. I'm really glad it wasn't anything more serious. If I ever have pain that bad again, I'll risk an hour drive to a different hospital instead of going to Highlands.

name: Andrea T
text: Worst hospital I've even been to. The doctor who was in charge of seeing my mother for a possible ruptured hernia took hours to get there, then while explaining her condition to me and my family HE TOOK A PERSONAL CALL ABOUT A DAMN HUNTING TRIP...it took everything in me not to punch him in the face. Horrible place. Also, I had a miscarriage about 10 years ago, and instead of explaining what was happening to me they gave me a PAMPHLET on miscarriages. Come on people. This place needs shut down.

text:

Was feeling much worse at 2:00 pm  today (basically  6 hours later)

Went back to the emergency room and they turned me away ( I’m not a addict ) and have good insurance.
The reasons was they said I already had my prescription filled and I just needed to wait on my dentist to open on Monday
Well at this moment I’m at the Main Street Urgent Care , getting antibiotics and anti inflammatory meds
The main concern was getting  my co-pay
They did get that right

When it was brought to their attention, an employee stated, “Oh, that happens all the time.” Oh, no ma’am. It shouldn’t be happening at all.

text: I have never been one to rave about the ER at Coosa Valley because of my own personal experiences years ago but I can not say enough about how pleased that I am with the care that my son has received. Everyone is always so quick and compassionate when it comes to him.

name: Kim Weathers
text: June5,2016 my husband was having a massive heart attack  they went him to brookwood and saved his life!!  Go guys!!

name: Diana Jackson
text:
I am a nurse. I know that not getting your pain medicine as quick as you would like or not getting taken back first from the waiting room does not make a poor emergency room.
however, what does make a poor emergency room this this place. Came early in the morning with a nearly empty waiting room and quiet ER once we got taken back. We got taken back quickly but it took over an hour for the doctor to finally come see the patient. Giving them the benefit of the doubt on that one. The room was dirty with noticeable debris & blood stains on the floor. The attached bathroom had used wash rags on the sink! Not even a quick cleaning could have been done of this room.
I brought my friend who was having a major productive cough and shortness of breath. The physician did not listen to her lungs and no nurse ever assessed her.
She also had a red spot with scabbing on her back that she feared was a bedsore. The doctor took a 2-second look at it. Said that it was "just redness and there was no skin breakdown" therefore it's "not a sore, nothing to be worried about." Um, ever heard of a stage I pressure ulcer? The kind that is just erythema and no breakdown? Apparently not.
Sigh.

name: Ajiya Hobbs
text: Dr. Baxt was just rude and arrogant. He’s someone that just won’t listen to you. I’ve never had such and experience.

name: Chey Chey
text: If I could give 0 stars I would. My first experience here a few years ago, they told me that I didn't have a staff infection on my leg(even I knew it was staff). I had to go back a few days later because it got so bad. After they treated me, I sat in the room for another hour waiting for my discharge papers. I would've waited longer if I hadn't have gone to the desk to receive them myself. My next complaint is on behalf of a family member. They sent her home once with water on her lungs after her rib punctured her lungs. She told them she couldn't breathe, they sent her home anyway. She, too had to make another trip back to this hospital for the proper care. A different time they told the same family member that she had Hep C. She was put on medication for it. Years later, she went back to CVMC with stomach issues. They took her gallbladder out. Stomach pain and weight loss continued. She went to a different medical center to find out that she is actually Hep C negative and that her gallbladder wasn't to blame for stomach issues. It was stomach ulcers due to the Hep C medication. The same family member is now suffering from pancreatitis. They have sent her home 3 times now, each time a different Dr. has told her something different for her aftercare at home. One Dr gave threatening advice, telling her to eat, which sent her back to the hospital again, only this time to hear that she shouldn't have eaten anything. Be skeptical of their advice if you ever have to stop here.

name: Marlene Grier
text: NP Cathy and the Charge Nurse was AMAZING for my husband!! The ER was great and so was the staff! Thanks again for your help!

name: Natalie Hubbard
text: Another excellent experience at CVMC. Before, during, and after surgery, the nurses, doctors, administration and staff were excellent. I was quite nervous, especially when a needle was involved. Everyone went out of their way to make me feel at ease. My stay in the hospital was outstanding, and the discharge was a breeze. I would recommend this place to everyone.

name: Tiffany Lynnn
text: Very slow and doctors n nurses hardly come check on you doctor does a quick check over not really looking for what your pain is no one seems to care here place is very old and outdated only hospital close to me the next one is over an hour away...

name: Samantha Johnson
text: Horrible e.r. Dr. on staff tonight around 2 a.m. My 20 year old son went in for a forehead puncture wound and told them his head was hurting and he was concerned about a possible concussion. He said the Dr didn't seem interested and only glued it .No Tylenol/Motrin  offered to him for his headache ,no sleep instructions ,no offer for MRI or xray. He said he may just get up and go to another Dr or hospital tomorrow. What a damn shame!

name: Michelle Kesner
text: My family and I were evacuated from St Augustine, FL and we ended up in Birmingham AL . On our way home my dad needed emergency medical attention and the closest hospital was you . Your staff from beginning to end was Wonderful to my dad and to us . You treated him so quickly so we could be on the road to return home. we were so thankful that we didn't need to stay another night from home. We want to Say Thank You for all you all did !!!!

name: Squid 15 MEH
text: 3 stars because I don't want every CVMC emergency staff to get categorized with the awful ones. I don't believe 1 bad apple spoils the whole bunch!! The ones I remember left good impressions N.P. Cathy, Dr. Stanford & Dr.Ike so kind, listen, patient & compassionate I felt like they treated me like they would treat a love one. Also the bad ones left a impression DR.SLEETH he gave me a med. that induce seizures I take several seizure meds. I bought it to his attention that is why i say" Ppl know your medical issues & meds. I told him he said" Do what you want with it take it if you want & don't if you don't want to. Coosa Valley he sitting you all for a pretty lawsuit he should have taken the script back!! I still got it until this day from March,2019 if I filled it and had a life threatening seizure now what?I would be suing him & CVMC so a breathing body with M.D. behind it to have a shift covered it is shameful & careless because I am sure he has gotten reported before him & your night shift AWFUL!

name: Joyce Townsend
text: The doctor was very knowledgeable and the staff was great. I was in and out!!!!

name: Laura Strickland
text: Truly blessed to have quality healthcare at home in Sylacauga.  I have always had the best of care and customer service as a patient.  I feel completely confident in their ability to care for me and my family.

name: Kim McGinnis
text: Too much to text. Place is terrible. Let’s just say my mom has to go by ambulance to Er and they bruised up her arm while she was there poking around. Transferred to brookwood didn’t get one bruise from any tears they did on her. Sent brookwood wrong info. My mom never had colon cancer!!!!! Before that iv came out of her arm n told nurses for ONE hour that it was out n hit “be there in a  minute” while they on phones or laughing n talking to each other. Went up to desk multiple times my mom screaming  in pain. Let’s just say I cared for my mom more than they did. Can’t say what I’m here. I could go on n on but y’all know and get what I’m saying. Another thing back years ago for another example my son when he was in 5th grade got carried by ambulance on a stretcher in a neck brace. One hour later they came in. ONE hour and that’s me having to go up to desk over and over. Then they gave the nerve to get attitude

name: Abbye Sanders
text: Excellent patient care and great hospitality. The staff members of this hospital will truly go above and beyond just to make sure your satisfied with your stay.

text: Will never go back to the e.r again.. They seen everyone else but never came in to check on my child. Then they got smart after seeing me and my husband standing at the door waiting and freezing. Telling us to get back in the room..
