text: This is the nastiest place ever! My husband had to visit the ER and the floors were disgusting! There was blood on the sharps container and what looked like pubic hair on the bp cuff! Our wait time wasn't bad but its extremely unsanitary. We moved from Birmingham to the area and what a disappointing experience.

name: Mel Palmer
text: Thankful to have such a great facility in Sylacauga. My family owes much gratitude to the Doctor's and Nurses that work there.

name: Peggy Jackson
text:
Poor excuse for hospital! Had I trusted them with their diagnosis for my son at 2 yrs old, not sure he'd be with us today and grown into the 19 year old brilliant very handsome young man who was a 2018 graduate from C'burg High School with Honors! He's now preparing for the next chapter in his life...Jacksonville State, here he comes! My son could have even had brain damage had we listened to the undereducated staff in that ER! After they argued for almost a hour with his dad and I, that we WEREN'T taking HIM anywhere after  we informed and Stated to them WE wanted to and WERE taking him to Children's Hospital in B'ham. They told us his CAT Scan showed bleeding on his brain! The very heart wrenching words that's ONE of a parent's biggest fears and nightmare! Long story short, our son's pediatrician, Dr Robert Grey whom we love so much to this very day, gave THEM ORDERS to LET US GO, via transport by Ambulance! Dr Grey we still thank God for bc had it NOT been for God and that precious man the outcome WOULD have been catastrophic bc after Children's performed another CAT and compared it to that mangie poor excuse for drs and surgical team that was bam up in our face trying to take our son to the operating room, Children's found absolutely nothing wrong with our son from either CATscan! The lady Dr who was treating him at Children's called his father and I into a private conference room. First words that came out of her mouth was "Mr&Mrs..--- i want to first ASSURE you both there is ABSOLUTELY NOTHING WRONG WITH YOUR SON! HE'S VERY WELL & HEALTHY!! THOSE WORDS I'll NEVER forget and the BLESSED feeling of RELIEF in my heart and soul! I sat there crying as I thanked God and the Dr who knew exactly what she was talking about
She continued to explain WHAT had happened at Coosa Valley and it was just completely UNBELIEVABLE WHAT we heard!!! She said in pediatric CATscans they CANNOT be READ as an ADULT'S would be read and if our son HAD been an adult THEIR diagnosis may have POSSIBLY been correct however, HE WAS ONLY 2 years old and it showed that he was absolutely WELL and FINE!! I can't put into words what Coosa Valley put us ALL through that very scary day but i can assure everyone I'll NVR TRUST THEM! Id advise against trusting THEM with your pet!!! I'll continue to share our nightmare THERE which had a VERY happy ending once we were at Children's Hospital!!! My word of WARNING IS BEWARE allowing THEM to operate on your loved ones WITHOUT getting a SECOND OPINION!! God bless Dr Grey, the lady Dr in B'ham, our amazing son, AND God Bless You All!

name: Roxxy DaBoss
text: The E.R. IS HORRIBLE! We waited a hour and a half...my mom was admitted...we were in the back Er section from 5:30 until 1:30 when she finally got a room...Last year my sister was throwing up uncontrollably and they sent her home. I took her to Citizens in Talladega and they admitted her. Shame on CVMC! I was admitted a month ago and everything was good once I was admitted . Waiting in the waiting area was too long (I was in pain). The Er doctor was great but why are they SOOOOOO SLOW! The whole Er staff needs to be evaluated! Throw out the TRASH NOW! Professionalism is at an all time low!

name: Charlotte Johnson
text:
I wouldn't waste my time at this place
The old doctor who works in there at night in the ER hates his job and would rather show you pics of a diagnosis on his cell phone than actually remember what he learned in Med school! Go somewhere else asap
Charlotte Johnson

name: Brittany Young
text: Horrible Hospital. We visited the ER where there was a total of 3 patients. They were slow and the place was nasty! There was blood on the floor from a previous patient in the room that we were in. They had a hard time finding a pillow and we're short on blankets as well. All of the nurses here were sitting around hanging out instead of getting the tests done. This is not the first problem we've had here.

name: ToastyDoasty
text: I had some blood taken from here and they put the band to tight around my arm and my arm was turning purple and I couldn't feel a thing and they started moving the needle around in me wondering why no blood was coming out and when they took the band off my arm hurt so bad and they didn't do anything about it very bad doctors

name: Kaila Ogle
text: This hospital absolutely sucks i have had to take my son a few times but the last time we went we was sitting in the er with his nose gushing blood and no one else there, we sat and waited so I went and asked how long it was gonna be bc he was bleeding everywhere and if it was going to be long we was going to go somewhere else and the lady said well you should go somewhere else 😠😠😠😠 oh and my son was 4... well now my mom is in the hospital and every doctor and nursing says something different they have doctors coming to see her that has nothing to do with what is wrong with her im so sick of this place and wish we would never have to even look at this place.... !!!!!!!

name: Angel Scoggins
text: My husband went through the emergency department for abdominal pain. We had excellent care throughout his diagnosis of appendicitis, surgery, and overnight stay

name: Dani Browning
text:
I had a baby at CVMC in June. I love hospital staff. The staff is nice with the exception of one nurse that had a bad attitude.
They could definitely step it up on the cleanliness of the rooms at CVMC.  The floors and showers are filthy.
My husband spilled water on the floor in the labor & delivery  and when he wiped it up the napkin was black..
The floors are in general sticky in both rooms we were in.
The shower had ring worm growing on the curtain.
I don't understand why there is such a lack of cleanliness when bleeding follows birth.
And the lady that cleans is horrible. She sprays a lot of cleaning solution on the sink and toilet then does a quick wipe off, throws a card at you while you and your baby are choking on the fumes, and runs out the door.
Aside from the minor filth of the rooms I would suggest this place just because the nurses are so awesome and I believe Dr. Rehberg is the best OBGYN.

name: Marvin Grier
text: If you want to be treated like a drug addict or like listening to smart mouth doctor then this is the place. I went a couple times for infection the last trip there all the doctor was studying was making comments about pain meds. When i was trying to explane what was goin on he would say in the middle of me talking, let me stop you right there, then the comments about pain meds came. Like telling me that made it ok for him to cut me off when i couldnt even finish telling him what was wrong. I didnt go for his comments i went because the antibiotics were not working. The nurses done great but doc on hand had a major chip on his shoulder. I never once asked for pain meds i just stated to him i am hurting and want to make sure the infection is not worse. I will not be going there again. Worst E.R. I have ever visited!

name: Janice Sanders
text: What a great Hospital to have in our area.

name: Michael Wills
text: Not a problem after being released from ER...wonderful staff and treatment on 2 was in room 270 very clean great nurses...great care by my doctors every department I came in contact with fast and clean...food was not bad for hospital food

name: Jeffery East
text: Most of the nurses are awful.  There snobby and have attitudes.  This has to be the worst hospital ever. I even caught nurses eating out of patients plates before they get them .

name: Karen Varner
text: Used Coosa Valley for years. Great place, great staff, great physicians.

name: Lisa Hawk
text:
The post I posted early was Dr.Emily Rauburn if you want to call her a doctor.
Would not recommend  at all she has no heart for the work field she is in and when my daughter passed she never said she was sorry or anything and when we went back in room to see my daughter after she passed it was a garbage can filled with bloody towels and sheets, The Doctor whom did arterial on her did it wrong we lost her the resestated once and after that this doctor refused to do it again ...She was pregnant worried about herself not my baby ....she as well was giving to many meds and her bottom number on bp was 17 nurse said that was okay shortly after that when she passed .This doctor indicates liver failure natural cause I'm death certificate ...My child was always healthy no natural cause, suppose to been a autopsy performed at her age she passing at 22yrs of age ...So I have talked to alot of people and everyone told me they had about over dosing patients there ...however I did have a doctor that told me the truth about how my daughter passed ..wrote and called the to speak to the Administrator no reply and will not return calls also I did call Emilly Rayburn I asked her why she just let my baby for like that she replied well if we did she would been brain damage anyway, that should had been my call not them  and the entire  staff is as unprofessional and rude.

text: tiff  at  coosa  valley gettin her  test  done

text: Needs to be updated

Really? Afraid to take my elderly mother here for their emergency services because she may get something she didn’t have...or I might!

name: Jennifer Copeland
text: Great hospital esp the ICU team of docs and nurses they take excellent care of my mom and so informative and friendly .Dr Mir is the BEST! I told my husband always take me there if I ever need a hospital

name: Chris Mahoney
text: I went for an X-Ray and Labs and the staff was super nice. I was in and out in about 25 minutes total.

name: Gene Peppers
text: Emergency Department is Excellent. No waiting, very friendly Doctor's and Nurse's. Definitely recommend!

name: Tracy Green
text: Went in at 2am  on Friday the 29  with vomiting and sever pain in my side. The Dr at the er told me that even if it was my gallbladder he wouldn't do anything bc it was a holiday weekend. Do not go here ever!! Don't even take a wild animal, this hospital is a joke

name: cathryn vomsaal
text: The ER doctor was great but the RN left something to be desired she came in once to hand me my paperwork, she didn’t go over the paperwork. I would of understood if they were busy we were her only pt. I asked her questions and she said it’s in the paperwork. Luckily I am an ER tech and I helped the doctor with my son because their was no one else offering to help.

name: Brian Tetter
text: They starve you to death if admitted here. They always forget your tray altogether or bring you things you cant eat. For example, a person on a low sodium no caffeine diet gets ham and coffee or bacon.

name: Judy Richeson
text: I was admitted to the ER on May 19 after a fall in  which my nose was broken and I had several cuts and abrasions.  I was treated so kindly and efficiently by The ER staff.  They were kind and caring, and all questions and treatments were carried out in a very professional manner.  Thank you to the administration and staff...we are fortunate to have this fine facility to serve the medical needs of our area.

name: Brian Turner
text: I had friendly,and surprisingly prompt service by the staff and doctor,my only problem is they didn't screen anyone who came in the er and at least 4 people that came in weren't wearing mask!!! They need to in force the mask wearing especially in er !!! They didn't check anyone's temperature either( I don't think this helps anyhow) over all good job!

name: Bonnie Allred
text: Don't go!!!!! I understand if your critical and can't make it any where else.  However if at all possible do not go to this hospital!  My husband spent 5 days in this hospital with Covid-19.  We needed to have his short term disability and FMLA paperwork completed for him to maintain his paycheck.  It took a week to even get someone to tell any information on the status of the paperwork.  When I did get information (3 attempts on my part) I was told the hospitalist, Dr Hargraves worked 7 days on and 7 off.  That could be the reason for the delay.  I received another followup that said the Dr. stated it would take 2 weeks to get that paperwork completed and if we needed it sooner to call our primary care Dr and have them to complete them.  I don't see that happening as the family Dr did not see my husband at all during his hospital stay.  My husband does not receive his pay until these papers are returned to his company's corporate office.  Thank you MMCN for your concern and care of our family.  I am sure we will extend the same customer/provider relations when we start getting in those medical bills.

name: Gwendolyn Horton
text: If u want to be sent home after having 2 strokes and your blood pressure being 220/160, this is the place to go.  What a joke.

name: Joseph Quinones
text: Son was born here 6/7/19 and the staff was nothing short of amazing. Excellent care, clean quiet facilities and the food was really really good; especially the chicken fingers! Almost makes me want to have another kid...almost. Seriously though, very good experience

name: Dani Frost
text: They literally starved 25 pounds off me in 1 week because i never got my food trays and the nurses don't get in a hurry trying to get you anything else.

name: Cameron Slaten
text: My mom went to Marshall Medical Center twice and they gave her xrays and said it was a little hazy and nothing was wrong, 4 days later here I am watching her breathe on a ventilator in the ICU. This new hospital she's in said she had pneumonia and had been sick for awhile. I told the doctor she went to the hospital twice about this and he just gave me a puzzled stare. If you have an extreme medical problem that requires serious attention go somewhere else if you have the opportunity.

name: Bevely Smith
text: No long waits when going to the ER. Great Drs and stafg.

name: Hazel Gracelin
text: This is a great place,  you have to remember these nurses and doctors are working their hardest to help each and every person. I’m proud to have a hospital this nice and convenient for where it is. Sure beats driving an hour! Anyways long story short, thank you guys! I appreciate all y’all do!

name: Jojo Eiland
text:
Had wife taken there for a possible stroke.the er Dr.was arrogant rude and apathetic.after addition was still basicly nothing done room was filthy nurses are lazy and rude techs are no
No better the doctors can't be found and will do nothing eitherwent home for a couple hours came back asked about her nurse hadn't bothered to check on her the tech got up and went to check vitals right then.told me she was asleep and had been whole time.when I looked she wasn't asleep she was trying to communicate.she pressed nurse call button someone said they would get nurse I repeated several times over the next hour including calling switch board and the shift supervisors number.nothing nurse finally showed took vitals said she was would call doc.couldnt find him when one did show he did Not him gave a shot for pain and left.i wouldn't take anybody there again if I wanted them to live!!!

name: Andy Knowles
text:
My dad and I called an ambulance to take my grandmother to this hospital (ON CHRISTMAS EVE) because she could not use her legs and they would not admit her. They took a single x-ray, "saw nothing," and said they couldn't admit her because all she had was "muscle weakness." My grandmother finally sees a specialist three weeks later and she has a fractured vertebra which she has to be fully admitted for.

Tl;dr: don't take your loved ones here if you can avoid it, very poor quality of care.

name: laura doss
text: Got a bad report from an urgent care in Madison Alabama saying besides being anemic there may be a possible blockage in my intestines. I was also severely dehydrated needed intravenous hydration administered. The doctor there literally said, "your bowels are dead, they arent working at all". So she referred me to Hospital ER for further testing and treatment that she said they just werent equipt to do. They printed my blood test results and  xray results and gave me a copy to take to Doctor at ER. She told me she wouldnt be surprised if the admitted me.  So, being tired and not wanting to wait long hours in an ER waiting room, I decided NOT to go to Huntsville or Madison Hospital (where I should have gone) and went to one closer to my home in Marshall County. I had been to Marshall Med Center North for broken ribs a few years prior and they seemed to be ok so I figured, "how much different could they be, they are all educated medical professionals right? " They had a way shorter waiting time and at first everything seemed to be going as it should. I gave the girl who did my intake my urgent care paperwork and she asked if she could hold on to it for awhile. I said no problem cause of course the Doctor needed to see it. They put me in an er room and the doctor came in and told me that even though they had the urgent care results they were gonna start over and then if they saw the same thing they would do CT and further testing. He said I was dehydrated and the hooked me up to a bag of water to hydrate me while I waited. The xray girls came to me and took three xrays of me in one position with an xray machine that looked like it was older than me (I am 48) . After my bag of water ran out the doctor came in and informed me that he saw nothing on the xray but they found a UTI with cystosis and he believed I had viral gastroenteritis. He said they werent going to admit me and made me call a ride even though they had not administered any meds to me. He wrote me a rx for an antibiotic that specifically warns not to take if you are anemic and an anti nausea med. There was no mention of why my red blood count was so terribly low, or why I hadnt  urinated but maybe twice in a month or had a solid bm in over a month. I just feel like there is more to it than a virus. Anyway I asked the doctor for an excuse for two days from work and he said he would write me one. When I got to the pharmacy (my 80 year old neighbor came and got me) i realized there was no dr excuse and they hadnt given me my urgent care results back. Called them when I got home, talked to Heath  and he assured me he would have my paperwork and excuse waiting for me at front desk in morn. Got up early, drove back to hospital (18 miles away) and no paperwork or excuse to be found. So the girl comes out hands me a freshly written excuse for only one day (I was on my second day of missing work at that moment) and tells me they misplaced my urgent care paperwork (overnight) and apologized. I told her I could probably get a reprint from urgent care, not to worry about it. Been a week today and I have been urinating more but my other conditions havent changed. I hope it wasnt a total waste of time to go to mmcn.  Cause this doesnt seem to be over quite yet.

name: BMAC Live
text:
Horrible care by an uncaring staff. I brought my grandfather to MMCN on Monday for what was suppose to be a direct admit from Lakeside Clinic. We were instructed to go to the Emergency Department waiting area by his physician. When we got there, however, we were told by the front desk staff at the ER (brunette female and male with a heavy mustache) that they “didn’t have a bed available right then.” We said that was fine and began waiting patiently. After about 15 minutes, however, the staff members came up to us again and asked if we “could just come back tomorrow because they don’t have enough nurses.” I was honestly stunned. I’ve never been to a hospital where the staff encourage you to go against a physician’s order for admission/treatment. After relaying that concern to the staff member, she left to speak to her supervisor and was able to move forward with the admission. Once we were placed on 2nd floor, however, the substandard care continued. Every single Nurse and CNA that entered the room continuously talked about how ready they were to be off shift. It was really sad to me because my grandfather was extremely sick (Afib, double pneumonia and an acute mental status change that caused confusion). He has never been so sick that his level of orientation has diminished and instead of being comforted by his “care team”, he was hearing how much they didn’t want to have to continue to care for him because they were “so ready to go home.” This is also the first sickness he has had since the passing of his wife of over 50 years which makes him feel even more vulnerable and fearful.

Currently, he has been waiting for over 24 hours for the cough medication he requested yesterday. When we asked his Nurse about it just now, her response was that “She did not have time to deal with that right now because she was trying to check another patient in.” It’s so sad that as medical professionals we have the opportunity to serve these vulnerable patient populations yet some of us don’t take that as an honor but instead act as if it is a burden.

name: Harold S
text: Quick wait time in ER to be seen.  Oversll good experience

name: Katiyanah Hollis
text:
8-1-19 I went to the ER for severe leg cramps, especially my left calf. I was crying with it. Did not mind waiting. I was never given an ultrasound in my legs nor any other testing even though a week prior I had been in ICU for heart issues. They said I was ok, gave me a muscle relaxer and sent me home.

8-2-19 I stand up from my bed and feel a pop in my left calf. I take one step and cannot breathe, cannot move, I fall to the floor. My family calls 911. I get to South and still no xrays, no ct, no ultrasound even though I try and tell them it's my leg. When blood tests come back that my heart enzymes are off, I am transferred to Birmingham, AL Princeton Hospital. I am told a blood clot in my calf dislodged and went to my heart. I got lucky and I lived through it.

Never again will I go to Marshall South or North. I would have died if not for Birmingham. Due to having not just clots in my legs but in my lungs. Never again!

name: Natily
text: This is not a place to go to if you have issues beyond needing a bandaid or birthing a baby with no complications. It's just a bunch of glorified nurses pretending to be doctors

name: Sam Tedder
text: Doctor talks over you, doesn't listen, told me livedo reticularis is "caused from anxiety"

name: Rachel Wilkes
text: Don't waste your time going here. Completely useless.

name: Kaye Salorio
text: I have, over the past several years, had the pleasure of dealing with MMCN hospital throughout several  ER visits, extended stays, surgery, you name it, with my Mom.  I know everyone has good and bad experiences with every area of hospitals. This has NEVER been the case with this hospital. I'm grateful for the way my Mom has been taken care of each & every time. You guys wouldn't want to move to Florida, would you?  Thank you for all you do!!!!

name: Mistah Z (TheTechnician)
text: Presented with really high heart rate, and low oxygen levels. Spent 2 hours in the Er(not a big deal) then I was given a chest xray which the Dr. Said was "slightly hazy " yet I've been coughing up foul smelling sputum with a fantastic bright yellow color to it. They denied me oxygen 3 times, even though my saturation was 88-91 which is low enough to warrant o2 therapy. The Dr didn't even introduce himself to me, and barely let me speak two full sentences. They eventually gave me a shot of strong antibiotics and still discharged me with 35 breaths a minute and a heart rate of 140 at rest. Ultimately they made me feel like their oxygen bottles were more important than my respiratory distress. They didn't even culture my sputum after I showed it to the nurse and Dr to see what kind of chest infection I have. But according to mr ego dr every thing was "fine" Also was denied water after asking a few times, yet I wasn't going to need surgery. So there shouldn't have been a problem with me having water. They kicked me out after 5 hours once they realized they wasn't going to get any money off me, since I have poor people insurance if you value your health, skip Marshall Medical North and go straight to Huntsville or Uab at Birmingham. My Treatment plan included some weak antibiotics and cough syrup. /sarcasm/ top notch health care.

name: Kenlon Burcham
text: Care is adequate.  Would be better if, like tonight, we did not have to deal with Nurse Ratched.  Elderly Mom deserves better than an unhelpful snob who desperately needs an attitude adjustment.

name: Miranda Hadden
text: My personal experience has been poor in multiple areas.  The support staff are usually very nice and hrlpful.  I have had issues with the physicians and professional staff on most occassions.  ER Docs, CT Imaging, Family Practice Physicians all need some improvement.

name: Haha Noope
text: If you value your life RUN.. Go to another hospital! I am having an allergic reaction to an antibiotic and they are telling me its just a "side effect" of prednisone (I have talked to a pharmacist who says that prednisone DOES NOT cause this reaction). They are going to kill people by telling them this.

name: Noodly Panda
text:
What kind of bloody idiots keeps trying to call a deaf person?  **Ring Ring** **Pass phone to my husband** Hi is this Glenn?  Oh, can we speak with him?  Hurr durr.

I'm deaf.  DEAF.  I CANNOT HEAR YOU!  This means no sound.  None.  What kind of idiotic, stupid, inane, moronic imbeciles see on file that the patient is deaf and requires an ASL interpreter while in the hospital STILL freaking tries to call a deaf person over the damn phone?

All I can say is, I've officially blocked their number from being able to call me.  I only have a cell phone for texts and IM's to begin with, calling me will do you absolutely zero good.

So note to the hospital staff:  Read my damn file you morons and if you're unsure what "deaf" means, pick up a dictionary while you're at it.

And one last thing, note to the nurses and doctors.  I CANNOT HEAR YOU WHEN YOU TALK TO ME FROM BEHIND!  And if I happen to be sleeping during my stay, it is NOT ok to just waltz up and put pain killers in the IV.  I'm sure you looked at the arm band and verified who I am, and was just verbally saying everything to me expecting me to wake up and hear you but alas, I cannot magically hear you when you speak to me in a hospital.  I know, it's crazy right?  A deaf person can't hear you talking, crazy notion.

And to that one tubby nurse guy, no I don't read freaking braille.  Look up the word deaf in a dictionary and then quit your job because a nurse that doesn't realize what the word "Deaf" means is terrifying.

name: Eddie Petry
text: I was at marshal North ER with arm pain and high B.P.  Dr Pettit along with his Nurses and tech's were very thorough. Very caring, compassionate .  I really appreciate the way they went out of their way to make sure I felt at ease. Thanks Dr Pettit and everyone . Great to have such quality in our hospital...

name: katina adams
text: My dad is getting old and sicker. We  go a lot more than normal now days to the E.R.. My dad has seizures , extremely high blood pressure, artery issues and stroke and heart attack history . They go to work on him right away. I feel safe and good when  they are done because I know he has had good treatment.  Dr Christensen is the best doctor ever.!!! He explains for my dad everything going on in a way that he can understand.( I am a nurse but he doesn't listen to me as well. I'M JUST THE DAUGHTER  ;-)    ). The nurses and lab techs are also great. Marshall north has saved my dads life by surgery three times . We have nothing bad to say about this hospital. I am very impressed with everyone and their skills.

name: JOE Montana
text: I was rushed to the ER because I was choking on a piece of chicken. Coming in and out of concessions from lack of oxygen stomach and face numb. I couldn’t stand and fell to the floor below the desk as 3 women working at the desk stared at me and said nothing as I’m trying to say I’m choking and cannot breathe. 30 seconds later they ask me to physically walk around. Started asking questions like my weight and height my address as I’m still choking and can hardly talk barely getting breathes. I finally get into a room 10 minutes later. I wait in the room for 10-15 more minutes with a piece of chicken still lodged into my esophagus. A doctor finally walks in and tells me to calm down. I’ve been choking for over 30 minutes at this point. They give me medicine to puke it out. After I finally get it up there comments were “wow, there really was something in there.” And the nurse comments “he just hocked up a hen!” Everyone’s attitude changed as they finally realized how serious the situation was. They was all peachy sweet after the realization. So 1/5 stars for when my life was in danger. And 4/5 after I was okay.

name: Kim Sawyer
text: I'm disappointed in Marshall North.  We have had some good experiences with them in the past, but the last  2 times have been very disappointing.  The first disappointment was over a year ago with my son who definitely had a concussion after a wreck he had. The care was non-existent.  They did not care.  That's a shame.  Well I decided to give them another chance with my husband yesterday.  He has early onset Alzheimer's and had a fall on our driveway.  I told them at arrival that he has Alzheimer's and I have power of attorney which I brought with me.  They didn't want my power of attorney.  I try to be discreet about his diagnosis as he is aware.  He prefers to call it a head injury or concussion. He gets extremely upset and depressed when the A word is connected to him.  Triage was fine.  The wait was non-existent.  The nurse and Dr talked to him.  He was not explaining the events correctly to them so I chimed in as is normal for us.  They kept looking at me like I'm crazy so I whispered he has Alzheimer's to the nurse.  Do these medical professionals not understand what that means?  There are varying stages of Alzheimer's but my husband's is mid to late.  He can't write, he can't drive and has not driven for almost 2 years,   he can't retell any event accurately,  he can't fix a sandwich,  there are so many things he can't do that he once did.  To look at him,  people say he looks normal.  His obsession is working out so he's fit.  I guess they thought I was crazy or controlling,  I don't know what they thought.  But they were rude.  I'm with him 24/7 as his caretaker. This would be like ignoring the mother of a child.  In his mind,  he is a child.  Anyhow I had to tell them many times he has Alzheimer's.  They just continued talking to him,  he kept looking to me.  His hand was covered in blood,  his head was bloody where he hit the driveway.  They did do a CT  scan,  I guess???  They did an x ray of his ribs.  They did not clean up his wounds to check the damage.  The nurse did put a steri strip on the brow/ temple cut but did not clean it first.  He put an antiseptic but I do believe cleaning the wound should have been the first step.  This wound later popped open with the swelling.  ( WE did ice it, but it did swell)  I cleaned his hand up and it appears to have debris embedded; nothing big but I could have used some help considering his mental condition and he is bigger than me.  I was mainly concerned about the head injury.  He hit his head on the concrete.... hello?!  That is how the biggest onset of symptoms began 2 years ago when he fell from our roof.  The doctor did not discuss the CT scan and walked off when I told him I had a question.  Not professional at all and highly upsetting to me as his caregiver.  I am responsible for him.  I need to know.  The nurse discussed discharge instructions with him, not me.  Not cool at all.   He has Alzheimer's, he is not going to remember.   I was upset,  they did not care.  I told them they were rude.  I have been married to this man for almost 29 years and his Alzheimer's caregiver for 2 years.  I was told congratulations and sorry I had a bad experience.  I don't appreciate the snarkiness.  It is disrespectful and highly unprofessional.  Are you not in the business of caring for people?   I really wanted to make sure his brain was not damaged.  I still don't know.  Maybe to them it doesn't matter,  I don't know.  He seems to be acting "normal" for him but I will have to get Marshall North to send records to his neurologist to get pace of mind.  I'm not going to give the names of the doctor or nurse but I do hope they exhibit more care with people on a regular basis and for heaven's sake,  clean up the wounds so they can be evaluated properly. That is common sense.

text: Really great and caring hosiptal.  I see some bad reviews but they cant cure every problem.  I stayed 11 days about 5 weeks ago and would return in the future for any problems thx so much for the caring staff at this hosiptial ✔✔✔✔✔

text: Wowl, aweful service. Wouldn't give my son, with a severe migraine a room where it was quiet. name: deranda ruiz
text: Wait time was awful and always is. There was no one else in the waiting room but still had to wait 20 mins to get back but once back it was great. We've had really bad previous visits. My husband has been in and out of the hospital since 2010 with chronic pancreatitis. In December 2010 I brought him to the er for stomach pains they ran all the test and sent him home. Normally when he has a flare up he stays for 3 days to a week. 3 days later he ended up having to go back to the er this time they emitted him. I came back the next day to find his room empty. I went to the desk to find out where he was which they replied he's been moved to ICU. I got no phone call nothing. When I reached him he was breathing very heavily and they had him sedated. The dr told me that they were going to put him on a ventilator to help him breath that his body was shutting down. Later that day they told us there was nothing they could do at this hospital for him we had him transferred to UAB. There are some nurses and Drs that are great then there are some that aren't. I know that's with every hospital but there just seems to be more bad than good in this case.

name: Tracy Edwards
text: The Nurses and Dr's treated not just my son who was sick with his heart rate 32! Every Dr,Nurse,CNA,Phlebotomist.X=Ray Technician,even the cleaning  people mopping and sweeping the rooms EVERY SINGLE SOUL we had contact with treated my son on the spot if an alarm went off his nurse was rite there. I've ALL WAY'S USED RMC OR STRINGFELLOW OR CARROLLTON ER's because of where I lived! This is sad to say but out of my 39 yrs experience with the Dr's and Hospitals in the calhoun Al and Carroll Ga area have NEVER HAD A DR NURSE NO ONE EVER stop everything and take 15-20mins with the patient and family to go over each and EVERY TEST Explaining in so much detail but yet in a language we that do not have alot of Medical knowledge will understand. Review Marshall Medical Center North at 8000 Alabama 69, Guntersville, AL 35976 I was very impressed in how the dr went ahead and had EVERY TEST my son needed done rite there in the ER they even had to call in someone to do a test that is NORMALLY ONLY done Monday-Friday! I WANT TO THANK EACH AND EVERY PERSON DR NURSE ETC. I sure hope we don't have a reason to return to any ER again anytime soon but if we did there would be no doubt we will NEVER USE ANOTHER ER! The Nurses came in every 2-3 mins checking on him me every family member was allowed to stay with him and they made sure I was beside him at all times!! Thank You Review Marshall Medical Center north

text: I ended up staying for a few extra days following complications from a surgery. I cannot remember all of my nurses names, but Nurse Rahel probably stood out to me the most. A nurse Kevin and a security guard had threatened to drag me out and assaulted me, and they knew for a fact that my transportation wasn't there yet. These two then hurried me by the wheelchair they dead-dropped me into, to a back exit where they forced me into the weather. I was able to hide in the entance facing Simon Williamson Clinic around 10:55am ish for warmth, but an exiting tiny white lady employee spoke to me there only saying "they're closing this entrance" to me, not one word about my health or safety, then soon a black security officer forced me into the cold from that entrance also.
This hospital employs and defends hateful criminals who likely have patients suffer serious complications during their shifts, and several should be in prison.

I was the caller to 911 BPD, twice, for them attempting to hold me against my will, but I never saw BPD once, and nurse Kevin in the images had yelled down the hall to them "I'M IN CHARGE HERE!" from my critical care room doorway. They had distracted BPD into inaction, making them think the rest of their absurd actions would be unnoticed. I was filming for my life however, and clearly needed to.

That morning nurse Chrissy was quitely trying to add something in that IV port without waking me THREE TIMES but did each time. The only nurse who tried anything without waking me. Then she told my wife i was out of my mind midway to pick me up, and she should turn back. Then she tried menacing me into 15 more pills that morning, which would have made 45 pills total. She also called Sun Jan 10th and said "Hi I'm Chrissy I discharged you yesterday." but she knew I refused signing anything at that point, and only wanted to check if I was dead. My people are convinced my 10 days of full-body sweats after home were from expelling poison from my body, and if this has happened before NURSE CHRISSY IS A SERIAL MURDERER AND SO IS HER APPARENT MATE AND CO-WORKER NURSE KEVIN.

Here then now too is His Grace and only of a Living Breathing Eternal Christ in which all things and required of this existence: This post will be unavailable soon as I ask forgiveness of my many transgressions of Him and in only His Perfect Wisdom, do extend this Spirit Fruit out to all His children, no matter the darkness that may be upon them. name: Desiree Paxton
text: I’m giving 5 stars to the people who did amazing during our first visit, today was my first time ever being there 6/3/2021 and i had a TMJ surgery done by dr maniscalco who is an amazing dr by the way for anybody who needs a TMJ surgeon 5 stars to him! Also the lady who was my morning nurse who did my IV was very sweet and comforting and did a great job with the IV I don’t remember her name but she definitely deserves 5 stars as well. The anesthesiologist was very professional and did everything to reassure me that I was going to be okay because I was very scared, she answered all my questions she deserves 5 stars as well. The anesthesiologist nurse assistant was so sweet she seemed very concerned about me and that meant a lot to me, she desveres 5 stars as well, the lady who wrapped my hair in a towel was very nice and supportive and gets 5 stars as well. Ken was my nurse after surgery while I was recovering he was also very very good my husband really liked him he always made sure I was comfortable 5 stars to him. However there was a few women outside room recovery area who was being very loud, complaining about who’s going to be off work for the Fourth of July and all that. It’s like they were forgetting that there was people trying to recover from getting surgery, I was in a lot of pain, the anesthesia made me extremely tired and I wanted to try and sleep some of it off, but no I couldn’t because they kept yelling as they were talking and they were literally sitting next to each other so they really had no point in having to yell. There was no door on my recovery room just a curtain so It sounded like they were in the same exact room with me. For one please have respect for those who are waking up from surgery and probably in pain, for two if you don’t like the fact that you have to work on weekends, or holidays etc then pick a different job. You knew this going into it so it shouldn’t be surprising. That’s my only complaint. Everybody else was amazing and thank you guys so much!!

name: Janice Parker
text: After the terrible experience I have endured at Brookwood I will not recommend anyone come to this hospital where their employees STEAL from unconscious patients. I was admitted Saturday evening and kept until Monday for emergency surgery for the removal of my gallbladder. I was informed of a copay that I had for my surgery so I kept my wallet the whole stay at the hospital. The morning of my surgery my money was in my wallet and I had NO VISITORS because you are only allowed one visitor and it has to be the same one the whole day. No one had access to my room except my nurses and the cleaning crew. ONE OF YOUR INCOMPETENT THIEVING EMPLOYEES went through my items while I was unconscious and stole my copay money for my surgery. I am more alarmed than anything because apparently there are no cameras on the 4th floor where I was located.  I have never had an experience like this in my life. I came to this hospital to be treated for a health diagnosis and left in pain and emotionally distraught because my money was stolen. Your security, floor supervisors, administration and all have been no help. I have created a police report and all. I feel so taken advantage of and all you all are saying is that you will investigate. You all will not hesitate to send me a bill for my surgery but no one can properly look into why were my items gone through and why is there no proper way to monitor who has access to patients rooms. I am not satisfied and I will not let this go. These are very trying times where people are already limited in access in high stress situations with family so to know your employees are taking advantage of those they know do not have family to watch over them or their personal items is beyond ridiculous. Now I am stressed because I do not have my money to pay this medical bill and I am very highly stressed after having my surgery.

name: Brandy Carden
text: I'm 23weeks pregnant. I tried to go to doc in the boxes before I went to ER. But none could see me. So I was told by my ob to go to the ob ed so I did. I have not felt good for 3 days taking everything I could while pregnant so last hope was dr. Well I get there everything is good. But when I get called back to get seen evaluated. The first rn I had acted like she didn't know what to do where anything was etc. Then I had another rude rn say something like "she needs to be in covid unit" mind you they did not test me and I had no reason to be moved like I was. I asked her" are you hoing to test me first before you send me there and expose me" but she ignored me. They put me in a room and said they'd get blood and strep test. Then left they were gone for a hour and half. I ended calling the nurse then 30 min later another nurse came in. Took samples then left. A dr.and the nurse come back ask me what's going on then leaves. Then another nurse comes finally brings me tylenol and I ask for something to snack on because it's after 1. Well a hour later another nurse comes brings food she said she was waiting on strep test. Well when she comes back with news and discharge papers she then decides to put on my hospital band and says "everything looks good." I ask "will they test me for covid since they had to rudely move me and the flu.?" She says" dr. Says they won't test for flu because it's not flu season and they don't test for covid" Well I ask" why did I get moved then?"She then tells me "to find another place to get those 2 test." Go home and rest. My experience was horrible so unprofessional and just plain rude. I never saw the same nurse had 4 different nurses and saw the dr. once. I love Brookewood had 2 babies there about to be 3, but this was beyond a horrible visit. They need nicer and more professional staff.

name: Micheal McGraw
text:
I have had a few procedures done here and I have had 2 out of 3 good experiences here. Today my wife had back surgery today. She has been worried about her I.V all day a new girl put it in the first time and missed (it happens) Then second time she still didn't get it right, 6 hours later after her surgery was over my wife (whom is very tough when it comes to pain) she doesn't complain ever, she is in tears because the I.V is burning her arm, leaving marks through her veins. We have asked multiple times to have a new I.V put in and all the stuff is been sitting on her bed here for about an hour waiting for someone "qualified" to come put it in and yet not one has come. She can not hit the pain button they gave her after the rods and screws and hardware they put in her back because the burning through her arm and I.V is worse than the 6 hour surgery she had on her back today. I used to be the biggest fan of this hospital because of the awesome attention and treatment you we able to receive but apparently that is not the case anymore. If some of the doctors that are here were not this would be the last visit we would ever have here. Im not trying to be ugly but some things are just unacceptable. In my industry if I treated someone like this it would tank my business. Im sad to see this. I especially understand the times we are in now but no one should ever have to ask multiple times to fix something so simple. I sit here and apologize to my wife for something I can't fix nor am i trained to. But there is nothing worse than feeling helpless to your wife.

Part 2 of this review.

There are some really great people that work here one of which I was honored with the pleasure of meeting last night. His name is George. He is very attentive very kind and truly cares about the people he is endowed to take care of and the ones that fall through the cracks by the people that have fallen asleep on the job. His shift was done at 8 this morning and was still working till almost 10 to make sure that everyone knew what needed to be done and had all the information about the current patients that he was in care of. Today it seems as though there is a change in people in this unit Tara and Emily are who we have today and they are also a blessing. When I left to check in at work this morning and run home to shower I listened to other nurses talk about George and how hard of a worker he is and how much he cares. He is a game changer to this hospital and I hope that anyone who has to stay here gets the honor and pleasure to come in contact with him in the last 24 hours my mind has started to shift when I see some of the greatest heroes we have here in Birmingham they are kind, empathetic, and place other people in front of them selves im am glad I have had the pleasure to meet these heroes thank you Natalie for all your help. I hope one day we can meet you and thank you in person for all you and your team have done.

name: Brandy Jones
text:
I filed a complaint with them regarding my visit. Just had Theresa call me. She wanted me to go through everything again. When I refused to go through it all again because it traumatized me so much, she wouldn't give me any information about what was said or what happened with the so called investigation. She asked what I wanted from her, I stated I didn't ask her to call and to never contact me again. Why is the world would you make me go through that again?

I had the same experience with the mental health department. They take everything away from you and stick you in a room with absolutely nothing. I couldn't even have my underwear or deodorant. None were ever offered. I'm gluten free and they continued to ignore that and send me food I couldn't eat. I didn't see anyone until the next day and that was the NP. She came in and said I know you don't have covid.. I stated they told me I did. I was tested two weeks prior and it was negative. I don't leave my house and everyone else I've been in any contact with had tested negative. I was very upset learning I all of sudden had it, and was visibly crying about it. The nurse Farah came in and I stated I wanted to go home and self isolate since this positive test has messed up the support system I had for my two children. She just kept repeating what's changed since I admitted myself. I repeated it over and over. She stood outside my door telling someone else I was suicidal. No, but keeping in a room with no other contact and feeling less than human would upset anyone. The Dr didn't come in the second day. I had to keep opening my door and requesting that he see me before he left the hall. He finally opened my door with his foot, refused to come, when I asked why he said he was afraid of covid. He went into every room except mine. He asked what I thought about the covid test, I stated I don't think I have it seeing as I have had zero symptoms. He said he would retest me and talk to the nurse about discharging me. About 1 1/2 hours later a nurse comes in to have me sign AMA paperwork. I said I thought he was going to discharge me, she said nope. I asked if I would get a script for whatever they gave me while there. Again she said no. I will never ever go back to that place. How you treat people who are already depressed is a big deal. If I would have stayed any longer I don't think I would've made out. Like the other said it took me days to get over that experience.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your experience, Brandy. We will look into this situation further and address the issues you raise to avoid it in the future. We would like to learn more about your experience. Can you please e-mail your contact information at patientexperience@tenethealth.com?

name: Jena Hayes
text: We had an amazing birth experience at Brookwood. The first nurses/doctors we met in the OB ER calmed my fears and helped educate me on what to expect. Our labor and delivery nurse, Brittany, was top notch. She was professional and incredibly knowledgeable. Dr. Routman helped us make important decisions and has fantastic bed side manner. She is the best OB! Our anesthesiologist, Dr. Varner, placed my epidural perfectly. The nurses we had postpardum were also incredible (Molly, Grace, Pam, Jantella, and Bonita). Each nurse gave us tips and educated us on how to care for our newborn. The lactation ladies were kind and encouraging. We left the hospital feeling prepared to be parents. Thank you Brookwood! Our journey started at Brookwood with Dr. Cecil Long with fertility treatments and ended at Brookwood with our beautiful baby. I will be forever grateful.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Jena! We’re so glad everything went well for you. We will pass along your praise to our doctors, nurses, and staff.

I arrived and was told I didn’t have an appointment so I could either wait an hour (actually was almost 2 hrs) or come back another time. thank y’all for wasting my time!

text: I had outpatient surgery at Brookwood on 10/9/2020 and it was some of the best care I have received at a medical facility. I also had to have COVID testing done prior to the surgery and even the nurse that administered the test was caring, patient and calming. The nurses, admin and staff were all helpful, attentive and very nice on the day of my surgery. They explained everything perfectly and were very caring and nice. It was early in the morning and they had bubbly personalities! My husband waited on me during surgery and they made sure he knew where the gift shop, pharmacy (to pick up my meds), parking (pick up) and the cafeteria was located. It couldn't have been a better experience for us. Thank you to the staff! SSA: Catherine, Preop RN: Tara, OR RN: Phyllis, CRNA: Shelly, Anesthesiolist: Hale, Recovery RN: Julia. A special thank you to Hale for keeping me calm and talking to me when going back for surgery! A wonderful team!

resp.text: We’re so glad everything went well for you, Jenna! We will let our staff know how much you enjoyed their company. Thank you for sharing your positive feedback!

name: Green E
text: My loved one was dying and only had a few days left when I last visited her here. I had signed in, had my temperature taken and was given the visitor sticker like normal. I got to her room, but forgot something in my car so I went back down to get it. When I came back in the entrance the front desk lady, who was the same one who wrote my name down, took my temperature, and put the sticker on me, told me to stop and that I couldn’t go up. I pointed to my visitor sticker and told her I just came through and had just needed to run to my car. The woman didn’t care and rudely told me that I could not go back up even though I was almost in tears. There was no way I was going to leave without telling my loved one goodbye and I was eventually let up there after someone higher up had to contact the front desk. This situation was already traumatic enough without your employee adding to it. And no, I won’t be contacting you to talk more about the experience, the details are right here.

name: Greg Glasscock
text:
I went here voluntarily for some mental health. I arrived and was wheeled to a covid unit where I waited in isolation for 3 days in a green jump suit. Also know that even if you come voluntarily you cannot leave until you test negative for covid. That could be weeks and I wouldn’t trust them keeping you alive.

At one point I was given so many pills I developed serotonin syndrome where my body was shaking and my neck and feet spasmed so much they were stuck. The nurses gave me a Benadryl and “some other white pill” and gave me no answers. It wasn’t until a day out I sought medical help for not being being able to move my neck that I healed.

I also had been going through some breathing problems and one nurse there told me if I stopped breathing she would resuscitate me. I frequently missed my doses of inhalers and it would normally take an hour to get one after I had to ask.

The rooms you are isolated in are bare with nothing but a bed. They strip you of everything and arevery skeptical of you making calls. I do not recommend anyone voluntarily go here. Most mental health can be managed and handled better as an inpatient local to you.

It took me several days to process what the isolation did to me. I’m over it now but these places are not set up appropriately to handle people with mild mental illness. These are holding cells for the mentally insane or those they push to that direction.

Gregory Glasscock

resp.text: We’re very sorry to hear about your experience, Greg. We take patient complaints very seriously and would like to follow up with you directly. Can you please email your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com? We would like to learn more about your experience and address your concerns.

name: Andrew Barckley
text: It's not often you see high praise online for a medical facility, but Brookwood deserves it! My wife elected to have our 4th child here, and we had an amazing experience! Surgery was on time. The facilities were pristine and the staff was communicative, friendly, and operated with the precision and efficiency of a Swiss clock. When we moved from recovery to our mother-baby suite, our nurse Mary Beth was as sweet as could be to the whole family. Sometimes, we dads can feel out of place and somewhat excluded from the process. Mary Beth and her compatriots were inclusive and caring all the way up to our departure. As for the rest of the hospital, not enough can be said of the gift shop! Staffed by the friendliest folks and stocked with anything you might want or need! My only complaint would be better signage to get you where you're going. It can be a bit confusing to get from one of the parking decks to where you need to be. Thankfully, the janitorial staff was just as delightfully helpful as everyone else!

resp.text: We're thrilled to hear that everything went so well for both you and your wife, Andrew. Thank you for your review.

text: I came here with my husband on the 5th due to my husband vomiting,diarrhea,and stomach pain. The e.r did a ct scan that showed his small intestine was enlarged. They admitted him that day. Now we have been here for 3 days and still there has been no change. He's still vomiting,diarrhea, and the stomach pain has gotten much worse. He has been on 2 different antibiotics and been on 2 different pain meds and 2 different meds for vomiting.  Yesterday the doctors did another ct scan and this time the g.i doctor said he sees nothing. But my husband still has the same symptoms and has fever and white blood count is high. 3 a.m. this morning they give him a different type of fluids that was disconnected during the night. At 10:57 it was reconnected. Its now 5:11p.m and only 3/4 of the bag has been entered into his body. I went administration about the issue the lady in administration gave me a free parking ticket and had someone to come speak to me about the issue. Since then nurses have been rude. When the g.i doctor came in today i said i wanted my husband to be transported to u.a.b. the g.i doctor said he is a charity case that u.a.b will not accept him.  1st of all just because my husband is Hispanic and does not have insurance or a social does not make him a charity case. He makes enough money the hospital bill will be paid. The test they promised has not been done. We still do not know what is wrong with my husband. And from how the g.i doctor said he is a charity case its like they do not want to do their job. Regardless you can not refuse to treat someone because of no insurance. You spend years in college to help save lives not to treat them different because of no insurance. This hospital is ridiculous. Its not cleaned probably and the doctors do not keep their word. I will not be back up to this hospital. Like a free parking ticket what is that suppose to do shut me up it won't. I want anwsers i want my huaband better. He might be a charity case to this hospital but he is my loved one.

name: B J
text: My family member’s second admission two weeks after a month long stay.   Oncology staff amazing. Chemo nurses go the extra mile for their patients. My brother stayed a month previously and they really were fantastic.   MICU treated him well.  One of his night shift nurses was amazing.  I wish I could remember her name.  He was transferred to MSU, after I warned the nurse verbally and it was already posted that he was a high fall risk, he was left unattended and he fell.  They called me and told me he scraped his knee.  They x-rayed his knee, I see him and his elbow is red, slightly swollen and the surrounding area was bruised.  No mention of his elbow.  Mikayla and Shay both night shift nurses were kind and helpful.   Transferred to Ortho-neuro for no apparent reason. I think just a bed.  Ortho- Neuro needs some kind of pep talk. Mackenzie, a nurse hung up on me when I asked to speak to a supervisor.  The supervisor on Ortho Casey basically was trying to dismiss her actions and behavior. I doubt she will be written up.  Oh and he has LOST WEIGHT,  so his oncologist stopped his chemotherapy. I see his skeletal outline.  Nutrition doctor talking about stopping his IV feeding like he is dying any moment.  I took him a two piece Popeye’s chicken. He ate both pieces, he ate the biscuit and the red beans and rice.  So, naturally I think Ortho Neuro is not a place  where he can thrive. He is really declining.  Camila who was pulled to the unit for night shift  due to short staffing was wonderful. It’s the only unit, I had problems checking his status. Problems with day shift staff.  It’s the only time, I lost confidence in his care. If nurses didn’t even want to verify in his chart I make decisions regarding his care because I have forgotten his code, who would they call if something happened?  Would they call anyone?  First time I didn’t stay all night the majority of the stay.  Based on the previous admission, I thought I could trust the care.    Brookwood needs to get its act together.  Hire more nurses and techs. Treat them well. Pay them well.  Ortho is a reflection of the problems with the hospital.   Brookwood has always been our family hospital.  We have weathered many changes and storms.  I worked there around the time Tenet bought the hospital.    I am now considering other facilities for care.   I wrote a lengthy review, but it really could have been longer with more details that only make my heart hurt from disappointment.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear about your experience but appreciate you voicing your concern. Can you please email your contact information and name of patient to patientexperience@tenethealth.com? We will have someone from our hospital leadership reach out.

name: Rebecca Terry
text: Ok so I understand it's 5:15 am but I asked fo coffee and get told there's not any made ! Umm you don't know how to make coffee babygirl. I've never had a bad experience here but I want coffee. I mean they dang sure won't let you smoke here at all so the least I could do is have a cup of coffee first thing when I wake up. I get it you have several ppl you take care of but really? The tech tonight was Kesha and she's been really sweet but coffee is a must with me and takes me over an hour to get water. I didn't ask for water I asked for ice to out my drink over. . Anyway I just wanted to rant. I want my coffee and I want it now.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out and voicing your concerns, Rebecca. This isn’t the experience we want you to have and we will address with the appropriate staff.

name: Mike West
text: Heart surgeon and staff took exceptional care of my dad with his heart surgery.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Mike. We’re glad everything went so well for your father!

name: Tess S. Scott
text: They help  sick people, here...  But, I despise  the  way  they run the  parking  deck,& there are  not enough  handicapped  parking  places  !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: ToastyDoasty
text: Very good Hospital went here for some stomach problems I was having and they fixed it very quickly nice and helpful staff I like it A lot

resp.text: We're glad we could help! Thank you for sharing your experience!

name: Wilson Ng
text: Brookwood provided me with excellent care that exceeded my expectations. Everyone went above and beyond to ensure my surgery went well without delays and complications. They did all they could to make sure my comfort issues were addressed. It began with Pre-admission testing. Leigh and Sheryl They addressed all anticipated obstacles before they became issues and were very detailed.  Their diligence let’s the Pre-op team to to stay on schedule and minimizes possible delays. Heidi Irvin did a very thorough assessment and incredible IV start. I didn’t even realize she had stuck me. Then Dr. Bloomston, Samantha, Main OR RN, and Cami, CRNA, made me at ease and explained the entire process to me. I woke up in PACU where Kerri Graham addressed my pain and comfort. She made sure my family was notified and updated. She did so well that I was able to be discharged from the PACU instead of being admitted. She transitioned me to Phase 2 in recovery to Justin. Once again, he focused on my pain and nausea concerns. My discharge instructions provided me with everything I should be doing and who I should contact if I came across and issues. Dr. Wade did an amazing job on the procedure. I am pretty much 90% pain free from the issues I had prior to this procedure.  After this amazing experience, I can’t even imagine why anyone would even consider using any other hospital. Brookwood Baptist Medical Center is truly a community built on care.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out to us, Wilson! We love hearing that our staff took such great care of you. We appreciate your review.

name: Meredith Cook
text: Not a good experience. Don’t come here

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear this, Meredith. If you have more information on the problem, please send us an email to patientexperience@tenethealth.com. We’d like to learn more about your experience.

name: Kyrian McDaniel
text: Dr. Yalamanchili has to be one of the worst doctors I have ever met. He has the worst bedside manner and is very disrespectful with patients. The first time I met him he was using his phone the whole time I was speaking and when I pointed that out he gained an attitude.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out and voicing your concerns, Kyrian. We are sorry to hear we didn’t meet your expectations and will look into this situation further.

name: Alexander Newton
text: -11/10      Very unprofessional staff. I understand that you're understaffed and overbooked, but that doesn't excuse you from taking your job seriously. For doctors and employees that spend so much time here, you have a very poor understanding of who is in which rooms waiting for you and exactly how thin the walls are. Your voices travel, and your patients don't appreciate your disgusting, disparaging comments. You may have become disillusioned in healthcare work, but your patients and their families are human and worried and hurting and COUNTING on you to do your JOB without being lazy and insulting. If that means nothing to you anymore, we are PAYING you to care. WORTHLESS excuses for medical personnel. If I could put you on blast in such a way that would actually affect your checkbooks, by GOD I would. I just hope someone sees this review and decides to take their slice of the insurance pie to another provider. I hope you realize how inhuman you can be when you and your loved ones are treated like this someday, and I hope it introduces a new level of depression and misery to your life that follows you to the grave.

name: Nathan Saint
text: We have been here often (never for an emergency or surgery - just regular checkups in the clinics) and have always been well cared for. We find the place to be very clean and the people nice and friendly. We look forward to having our first child here.

name: Colby Lane
text: great hospital, great service

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive feedback, Colby!

name: P Vines2
text: I went in at 10 pm and did not leave until 6 am!  i had my nurses swapped on me 4 times and i only saw each nurse one time. i saw the Dr for maybe 1 minute, she asked me 2 questions and then i never saw her. we had to walk to the lobby to ask why i wasn't being seen and they supposedly forgot about me. There is no excuse for this, and thank God it wasn't anything life threatening

name: Kayti Currington
text: My fiance was admitted here two days ago to an inpatient program. He arrived at approximately 1 a.m.. He immediately was placed in an empty room and made to sit until 5 a.m. with no amenities including his usual medicines such as blood pressure medication among others which were a day over due from being administered. At 6 a.m. he was finally placed in the usual living quarters. He was not allowed a shower in this entire stay of one day and still NEVER given any medication. Other patients were allowed small amenities such as ear plugs to help sleep but when he asked for the same, was rudely and sternly turned down. His wallet was placed in a confined area "locked up". Upon his release the next day when he received his wallet, all the cash that was in it was missing. Not only was he treated like a prisoner so to speak, he was denied medical care and stolen from. This is the worst treatment I have ever seen out of a medical care facility and I am appalled. These actions were by far what I expected especially in the nice area of Brookwood. Henceforth, we will never return under any circumstances to any of the medical centers of this area.

name: Sheryl ANDERSON SOMMONS
text:
I was admitted Friday to Brookwood thru the ER. My room number is 287 and the room was not sanitary; floor, air condition unit and IV pole. I asked the charge nurse, Denise, to be moved to the 2nd floor but on the women's floor. She stated she called and that the floor was closed until tomorrow (Monday 9/23) and she would try to get me moved. I have an autoimmune disorder which causes my platelets to test low also seasonal allergies which if triggered will cause an asthma attack. Not only is the room not sanitized but I am also on the floor with several patients in isolation ( not good for someone who already has a weakened immune system..ITP)
content://media/external/file/9586
I posted pictures under photos:

resp.text: We're sorry we didn't meet your expectations, Sheryl. We will investigate your concerns.

name: J. Don Clark
text: I have always gotten the best of service, and excellent staff treatment at Brookwood. I have had heart artery by-pass surgery, prostate surgery, and several other things done in recent years. I have never been treated any better in any hospital. I can recommend Brookwood highly.

name: Jensie
text: I had an MRI done here, and everyone I talked to was extremely nice and helpful. My MRI technician was especially helpful. Everything went smoothly, and I immediately got my test results back. Very pleasant experience.

name: Tam SK
text: I used this facility when I had my older son. Nurses were all nice to me but there was  one black woman who comes in for light dusting, purposely dusted off the TV mounted on the wall directly above my 1 day old son. She even looked to see my reactions. I'll never forget that incident and never gone back for anything else.

name: Mona Clark
text: My husband went from the cardiologist office which was about 15 minutes away,  to ER at Brookwood and they were ready for him when he walked in the door. I dropped him off and by the time I gave valet parking my car keys and got in the hospital the crew had him on the bed undressed and all wired up. His stay was two days because he had suffered a heart attack. I think improvement could be made in providing an ice water bucket like they use to  do and just a little more attention could help for sure. Appeared clean though.

name: Kesha B.
text:
To Whom It May Concern:

I think it was a bad decision to merge Princeton Baptist Hospital with Brookwood. Also, allowing Select Specialty Hospital to lease a space inside your hospital was a horrible decision. Select Specialty Hospital is a place that provides subpar care and where people go to die. They pride themselves on weaning people off of vents but don't count on your loved one being weaned off the vent. If you decide to put your loved one in that facility, count on them dying. During my dad's tenure at that facility, 2 to 3 people were dying daily.

The doctors there are as rude as sin. The only good Dr. they have is Dr. Bell. The GI doctor Dr. Thompson was so rude he told my mom and sister they were cruel and evil for allowing my dad to be a Full Code. This was said in front of my little 8 and 9 year old niece. Dr. Heidipriem dragged my father's surgery out over the weekend knowing he had gangrene. We were told it could wait to Monday because he doesn't work on weekends.

There were two respiratory therapists that knew what they were doing at Select Specialty Hospital.

I wrote all of this to beg the leadership at Brookwood to not renew the lease/and or contract with Select Specialty Hospital. This facility is giving Brookwood Hospital a bad name. The nursing staff there are rude, the workers are unprofessional, and your medical business is not that private. The cleaning lady knew my father had his leg amputated. Select Specialty is ruining a good name such as Brookwood because most people that have issues at Select point their fingers at Brookwood Hospital.

resp.text: Kesha, we appreciate the feedback. We will share this with hospital leadership. Do you mind sending your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com so we can reach out?

I was admitted Friday to Brookwood thru the ER. My room number is 287 and the room was not sanitary; floor, air condition unit and IV pole.
