I posted pictures under photos:

resp.text: We're sorry we didn't meet your expectations, Sheryl. We will investigate your concerns.

name: James Pittman
text: Up until December of 2017, I loved this hospital. However, on December 31, 2017, without any explanation from my doctors I was transferred to the Geriatric psych ward. When I refused to sign the paperwork agreeing to treatment, I was told that I wouldn't be allowed to leave! It took me over a 8 days to get a patient representative. The hospital doesn't honor it's patient bill of rights! I was sent a bill for $50.00 twice since I was released from the hospital with no explanation what I am paying for. Today, I received a bill from a collection agency for $50.00. Brookwood Baptist Hospital refuses to tell me what I am paying for!

resp.text: We are sorry to hear about your experience, James. We will look into this with our team to address your concerns.

name: Mallory Thompson
text: My mom just got a hysterectomy and endometriosis removal today. The staff is absolutely splendid and friendly, and here to help her with everything and not a single one has acted inconvenienced by us. Dr. Childs was amazing doctor and everyone is very professional. Also, the surgery went very well!

resp.text: Thank you for your review Mallory. We are so happy to hear this and we will be sure to share your kind words with the staff.

name: Deborah Doyle
text: Our Grandson was referred to Brookwood for outpatient treatment by his Doctor in Huntsville. Everyone at Brookwood treated us with kindness and concern from the receptionist to the Doctor to the Anesthesiologist and others doing the surgery. We were very pleased with their bedside manner. The one nurse did have a hard time tapping a vein for the blood work. She tried a little longer than I would have liked trying before she got another nurse to do it. But it was not all that bad. The worst of it was the waiting. We were told to be there at 10:30 and it was after 3:00 before he was taken back for the surgery. It was a very long day and we hope that it will be shorter on the next visit.  Everyone we encountered seemed caring and competent and went above and beyond to make us feel like human beings.

name: Helen Haley
text: The Talladega facility is not equipped to treat anything more than a common cold. If you go to the ER and need to be admitted please ask to be transferred. They only have 1 doctor and she has the worst bedside manner and doesn't have a clue what she is doing.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback, Helen. We will look into your concerns.

name: Tammy Robinson
text: I Love working here. All you have to do is speak your concerns and there is always someone to help.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Tammy!

name: Destiney Adams
text: My experience at Brookwood was horrible when they placed me on the 5th floor 05/02/19, to recover from having my baby. The nurses were rude and racist during my stay. I also notice they were using the intercom speaker inside the room to listen too my conversation with family and friends that visit me while I was there. I feel that’s illegal to spy without me knowing. They were so unprofessional to the point some of the stuff I said behind close doors was basically thrown back into my face like I would’nt notice it. My last day which was 05/04/19. I had to give one of the nurses that worked on the 5th floor a piece of my mind. I told her that I’m very aware that they were listening to my conversation over the intercom speaker and she literally shut down in a state of shock and was hesitant while speaking because they were caught. With that being said I want be returning to have a baby there...

resp.text: We are sorry to hear about your experience, Destiney. Do you mind sending your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com so we can look into this for you?

name: Christine Watts
text: Wonderful staff, great facilities, they have taken good care of me many times over the years. I would always go back here for medical care. A few years ago I was gravely ill with a rare illness that was very difficult to diagnose. Dr Favor at Brookwood Medical Center worked tirelessly with many other doctors and the CDC to figure out what it was, and I am doing just fine as a result of their care.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out to us, Christine. We will pass along your praise to Dr. Favor and the staff.

name: Deborah Doyle
text: Our Grandson was referred to Brookwood for outpatient treatment by his Doctor in Huntsville. Everyone at Brookwood treated us with kindness and concern from the receptionist to the Doctor to the Anesthesiologist and others doing the surgery. We were very pleased with their bedside manner. The one nurse did have a hard time tapping a vein for the blood work. She tried a little longer than I would have liked trying before she got another nurse to do it. But it was not all that bad. The worst of it was the waiting. We were told to be there at 10:30 and it was after 3:00 before he was taken back for the surgery. It was a very long day and we hope that it will be shorter on the next visit.  Everyone we encountered seemed caring and competent and went above and beyond to make us feel like human beings.

name: Larry Long
text: My wife came in for thyroidectomy.  The Dr's and staff have taken great care of us. The facility is a bit dated in spots but it looks like they are remedying that now. My family and I have used Brookwood for many years and never had issue one.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Larry. We are so happy to hear that things went well during your wife's stay.

name: Ann Lang Gober
text: The worst experience I have ever had in a hospital experience.  I was admitted for severe depression and the possibility of suicide.  Totally unorganized staff.  I felt more like I was in prison than a hospital.  Froze to death the whole time I was admitted.  Food always cold.  Staff was rude and and uncaring.  Watched the TV programs that they wanted to watched.  The doctor would interview each patient, one at a time...spending at least five minutes, (if that much), ask the same questions every day, ie., (Do you hear voices, do you see shadows,  do you want to harm yourself,  do you want to harm others, ect.)  In others words, he gave you no chance to talk,  just answer yes or no questions.  When I would ask questions like "how much longer do I have to be here?"  The answer would be that "if I kept asking this same question, I would stay two weeks instead of one week.  So accept the fact that I would be here at least one week an the very minimum,  and he would make the decision when the time came.  There is much more that I could say and will when asked.  I hope that I never have to deal with that hospital again.

resp.text: Ann, we are sorry we didn't meet your expectations. Please send your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com so we can follow up with you directly.

name: Lakisha Pate
text: I haven't ever recovered from the treatment my dad received here and he died in this place I wish I would have followed my first mind and taken him to St Vincent's or Uab. I once had the highest respect for this place delivered a child here some years back but after seeing and witnessing how the nursing staff treated and communicated with my elderly  father and also was promised he was expected to live and he declined the same day and they new nothing only response I get it was a surprise to them they didn't expect this I would never thru gods grace with hopes enter this place again neither encourage my family too.

resp.text: Lakisha, we are sorry for your loss and your experience at our facility. Can you email your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com?

name: Natalie
text: My dad has spent the past several months in and out of Brookwood because of his lung cancer, brain cancer, and spinal cord cancer. The staff at this place is ridiculous, especially the nurses on the cancer floor. If it weren't for the techs, my dad would be completely ignored. We've had incidences where we've had to press the nurse button several times over an hour or more and then physically go find someone because no one will ever come in on their own. He's in a diaper right now, and in the week he's been there my mom has had to change it and clean him up every time. Nobody checks it or asks him about it. People have flat out refused to help him. They've been rude to my mom and to me. We were told today when we said something about how long it took for anyone to come in that my dad isn't the only patient and that he would be fine if we would "quit messing with him." This isn't the way to treat a family who's just found out they're losing someone, and it definitely is not the way to treat a patient.

name: Kristian Coon
text: There needs to be geriatricians and palliative care trained providers at this facility.

resp.text: Hi Kristian, thank you for the feedback. Do you mind sending your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com?

name: Patrick Wood
text: I have a friend Carlos who has a history of colon cancer and required an annual colonoscopy. Carlos came out of the outpatient endoscopy building in a wheelchair with his two front teeth in a styrofoam cup. No doctor, no nurse offered an explanation. What added insult to injury was the games played by the patient reps. Initially calls were handled professionally with promises to get back to him (they never did), then calls went to answering machines. Carlos was never compensated for his teeth. It took him a long time to save the money to have his teeth repaired. Carlos is Spanish speaking, but fluent in English. I guess they figured he was an illegal alien and they didn’t have to worry about him. I am still livid when I think of Brookwood Hospital.

resp.text: We will review your concerns with our hospital leadership immediately, Patrick.

name: Becky Upton
text: Husband admitted for heart cath....excellent staff...have used this hospital for years and have most always had very good experience.  Nursing staff very professional and attentive as well as the physicians. The charge nurse even came by to check on our experience which tells me they are wanting to be on top of any issues.  I would definitely recommend Brookwood.  I have had experiences at several other hospitals in the area and only have had a bad experience at Shelby Baptist Medical Center.

name: Acinok Acinok
text: So I was at the ER last night and they put me in a room. My husband pointed and said what the heck is that... after been in the room for a few hours, we looked and saw this...JUST 🤢 NASTy....Someone else blood bag!!!!!!

resp.text: We're sorry for your experience. Please send your name and contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com so we can address your issues.

text: There needs to be geriatricians and palliative care trained providers at this facility.

resp.text: Hi Kristian, thank you for the feedback. Do you mind sending your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com?

name: Conan Hutchison
text: Their ER staff is not attentive. I waited hours before I was helped. I was told they would bill my insurance but never once did they tell me they did not accept my insurance and that they do not have a contract with my insurance company. Now I'm left with a $4,800 bill that I have to pay out of pocket. I recommend going anywhere other than this hospital. I will spend the next two years making payments for the antibiotics I received.

name: Eugenia Mercado
text: Tremendous hospital, the staff is very committed to patients and the public. I loved the service is quality !!

resp.text: Great to hear, Eugenia! We appreciate the positive review! Thank you!

name: Wendell Burdick
text: BEWARE!! Employees parking in handicap spaces with no obvious handicap. I witnessed two this morning!!!

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention, Wendell. If you have more information on the problem, please send us an email to patientexperience@tenethealth.com.

name: David Plokhooy
text: Not sure what is going on with this “medical center”.  I’ve received numerous odd phone calls from someone claiming to represent Brookwood Baptist Medical Center”.  Other than claiming to represent the Medical Center the caller provides no information, claims it is a “business matter” then demands SSN, DOB and other personal information.  I have no affiliation or business relationship with this business so it seems a clear attempt at identity theft by someone on staff or representing this facility.  Beware.

resp.text: David, thank you for reaching out. Can you email your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com? We would like to learn more about your experience and address your concerns.

name: Neal Hauser
text: Simply Amazing Hospital. All three of my children were born here, family members have had surgery here and this is my second surgery here. The staff has always treated us as VIPs. The food for patients and in the cafeteria has never disappointed me. My wife just received a voucher for a complimentary meal. Communication is superb. I thank each person who interacts with me and they respond appreciatively to me. I could go on but simply put every aspect from preop to billing from 1993 to 2017 has exceeded my expectations. PTL for Brookwood hospital!

name: Jim Chappell
text: I’ve had 2 major surgeries at Brookwood and received Excellent Care in all departments. From one department to the next I was taken care of by caring professionals.

name: Leslie Robbins
text: Worst hospital ever!!! There are too many people that work there that are full of there self.  The patients are more important than these snobby people.  They think they are too good for everybody.  There are more humble hospitals in town who actually care about you.

name: KATHY MILLS
text: Doesnt deserve a 1 star ,I can easily see why the ratings are so bad !

resp.text: We're sorry we didn't meet your expectations, Kathy. We would like an opportunity to hear about and address your experience. Do you mind sharing your contact information to: patientexperience@tenethealth.com?

name: Ginger Ray
text: Doctor was so rude to me. I’ve NEVER had anyone speak to me so unprofessional before , it was shocking . I will never go back there , Doctor John Burke was so unprofession and I do not like someone talking down to me or treating me as if I’m stupid .

name: Jesse Vance
text: Staff was professional and attentive. Dr. Tierney was very professional and answered all questions and took his time to make sure we understood his information

name: Fnaf _Master
text: If I could rate a 0 I would, one of my family members went in late Monday evening to be admitted to the pysch ward for evaluation with meds currently on for depression/anxiety, 12 hours to be finished with intake, never given meds, didn't get to eat for 2 days , no pillow and they never explained to him how people can call and check on him or visit, so his own family had gone without being able to check in on him for almost 3 days....was supposed to see a doctor today , it's now 9 pm and nothing. And after FINALLY being able to communicate, he informed us how badly the nurses treat people there. Clearly they could care less about mental health and the patients seeking help, no wonder the mental health crisis in our country is so bad.

resp.text: We are sorry for this experience, Nicole. We'd like to follow up with you. Do you mind sending your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com?

name: Brenda Smith
text:
Wonderful facility, Drs., nurses, and staff!
Excellent care!

resp.text: We love hearing that! Thanks for the positive review, Brenda!

name: Lillian Lillian
text: The worst service possible I am writing this review from the waiting room as we speak.. I have been sitting here for 2hours I have not been seen by the triage nurse or anyone .. people who have come in after me were seen immediately I listened to their reasonings for being there and they were not life threatening

resp.text: We are sorry for the wait, Lillian. We will look into this situation to address your wait time concerns.  If you would like to provide additional details, please email socialmedia@tenethealth.com.

name: Broken Heart
text: Terrible hospital. Money hungry insurance scammers. Go to Grandview if you want a great experience.

resp.text: Your feedback matters to us. Can you please email your contact information to patientexperience@tenethealth.com? We would like to learn more about your experience and address your concerns.

name: Monika Singletary
text: I had a wonderful experience at the Women's Center with our first baby. Their staff was wonderful, caring and sincere with their care. Dr. Aultman is hands-down the best OB/GYN I have ever had. Thank you for a great experience, we will definitely return to Brookwood for baby #2!

name: Leslie Robbins
text: Worst hospital ever!!! There are too many people that work there that are full of there self.  The patients are more important than these snobby people.  They think they are too good for everybody.  There are more humble hospitals in town who actually care about you.

name: Jordan Margavio
text: I had a open abdominal myomectomy in 2015, and a baby recently in 2016.  I have gotten the absolute best care possible, and have been very well treated.  No complaints whatsoever here.

name: ochocinco334
text: This place sucks. Nurses suck everything sucks. Still here actually I’m upset I didn’t bring a bed and some food. I hope they don’t charge me rent. Been here for hours and still in the waiting room. I see why they don’t take appointments

resp.text: We are sorry to hear about your experience. Would you mind sending us the patient's name to patientexperience@tenethealth.com? We would like to learn more about your experience and address your concerns.

name: Jarrad Bates
text: To start with, our family has been using Brookwood for over 20 years. My wife has been seeing Dr. John Morgan for that long. We have used the ART fertility program. Both kids were born at Brookwood. I have had two back surgeries and one neck surgery performed by Dr. Jeff Wade and one shoulder surgery by Dr. Kenneth Bramlett at Brookwood. My wife had a surgery at Brookwood by Dr. John Morgan. We have been very pleased with this facility. This past Wednesday our 5 year old son cut the end of his finger off so the first person I called was Dr. Bramlett looking for suggestions of a surgeon. He immediately took charge and said he would fix it, don't worry about it. Sure enough, his staff jumped into motion and had him scheduled for Friday morning surgery. We were not sure what to expect since he is a pediatric patient. From the moment we arrived we were absolutely blown away at the care he received on his level. The nurses, anesthesiologist, Dr. Bramlett, EVERYONE just absolutely got on his level and made him feel very comfortable. I just want to say thank you to this special place and to everyone for the level of care we received this past week and for the last 20+ years. You guys ROCK!!

name: bubba bubba
text: I found this place to be a HELL HOLE...I was assured of a male prep nurse for a urological operation in 2009..I was to have a spinal so be fully conscious as the  prep work was being done.   When a woman named ESTELLE MURDOCK came into my room I informed her of that.. My in advance request and one that was also written out for her was denied.   Even after that physical violation while in the OR a woman came in to see Ms. Murdoch and had a conversation with her about nothing medical in front of my completely exposed genitals.  I complained to the hospital about all that happened to me on this 2009 visit  and got nowhere.. A patient LIASON named LEIGH ANDRESS was incredibly rude and insulting to me and equally insulting was the hospital CEO KERRY TIERMAN.   I would not send a dog to this place.  I ended up there I think because the operating urologist had a brother who was on officer of the hospital. I filed a complaint with the nursing board, the hospital regulatory board. and NOTHING was done.   Had a woman told a MALE NURSE  not to touch her can you imagine the trouble that would have caused?  I was ignored and treated as if nothing out of the ordinary had happened to me. I have had operations at 3 locations in Birmingham. text:
This is the worst experience I have ever had during a pregnancy. Went in with active labor was seen by a Dr that has never seen me nor asked about my medical history. Dr Mackenzie told me I was having Braxton hicks that were consistent and 5 minutes apart. I went home, went to L&D about 1.5 hours later with contractions 2-3 minutes apart the nurse didn't hook the machine up properly after being there for 1 hour she came and fixed it immediately the contractions started to show no more than 5 minutes later Dr Mackenzie comes in tells me I'm not in labor and I'm not having contractions doesn't even check my cervix (I was 4cm at the first visit of the day) q.. At this point I am miserable and livid at a how a Dr doesn't know how to do his job (Also I was supposed to be induced Fri at 6am. So I went into labor early you couldn't admit me and at least help me be comfortable so you don't have baby or I in distress). I call the ambulance when I get home since I was shooed away. The contractions are 1 minute apart now... I refuse to be seen at Brookwood L&D so I ask to be seen at UAB L&D best desicion I've ever made, I gave birth to a healthy baby girl not even an hour later oh & I was in active labor.

Wish I could give this ZERO stars!

text: DO NOT COME HERE!  My father had out patient surgery at Brookwood and was sent home the same day.  He returned to the emergency room later in the day because of extreme pain.  They sent him back home three consecutive days when he told them when he left something was very wrong.  After returning a fourth time he was admitted with a fever, blood clots and severe pain because of an incorrectly inserted catheter.  The damage done by the ER may ultimately be worse than the surgery.  They were uncaring, unresponsive and unprofessional in their communication and care.  His surgeon was unavailable and did no return calls.  Can you say law suit?  They deserve it.

name: Felicia L Roberts
text: I arrived at the ER with symptoms cohesive to gall bladder issues. I sat in the ER for 2 hours before a nurse came to speak to or check on me. I waited for an additional 45 minutes before a physician made it in to introduce himself. Blood work was done to see I'd my gall bladder had actually ruptured. It had not. However, no ultra sound, ct scan,  our any other diagnostic testing was performed to determine if I had any abnormalities at all. Needless to say, it in fact was (thank you UAB west). My entire visit began at 9:30 pm and ended at 3:52 a.m. the facility was filthy as well. I would never recommend this hospital to anyone else.

name: Alicia Wiggins
text: The wait here was entirely too long. I came in for a mild case of dehydration and was in here for 6+hours. Patients have come and gone whilst I STILL am waiting to be seen by the doctor to be released. Meanwhile, the staff moves around idly seeing patients without any sense of urgency. Many are just chatting it up until their shift is over. I know where I will NOT be going in the case of an emergency. So disappointed.

name: Amanda Fox
text: This is by far the worst hospital in the Birmingham metropolitan area. Spend a few hours waiting to be seen in the ER after you wake up with numbness in your entire calf and foot, and get to be billed hundreds of dollars so a doctor can walk in, spend two seconds looking at you, and refer you to a neurologist that you will never be able to see because you're uninsured, hence the reason why you ended up in their horrible ER in the first place. No physical examination, no diagnostic tests of any sort. Then at a later date, be brought to the ER by ambulance because a sudden pain in your head in the middle of the night has escalated to the worst pain in your life, all you can do is scream and wish to become unconscious. Even though it was pretty clear that I was having my very first migraine at the age of 22, they gave me NO pain medicine or medication of any sort besides IV fluids, which did absolutely nothing. Don't get me wrong, I know about drug seekers and that they're a huge problem in emergency rooms, but I didn't want opiates. I've since found out that ibuprofen is effective for treating the migraines I've had since then, but for whatever reason they could not be bothered to give me any. I even asked a doctor straight up to "Give me that medicine you give to people who are having a migraine," meaning triptans, a class of medication that helps a lot of migraine sufferers. I'm sure they thought I was asking for opiates, and felt validated in their decision to let me scream in pain all night and vomit all over myself. After about eight hours of vomiting and screaming, my pain finally began to subside on its own and it seemed like they were in a pretty huge rush for me to leave the ER. Maybe they had lots of other patients to not treat. But it's pretty surprising that their ER is so hesitant to treat patients who are suffering in pain, yet their ICU gives morphine to known substance abusers despite their family members explicitly asking them not to. With so many hospitals in the Birmingham area there is no reason to ever go to Brookwood. If one day I am literally dying and have five minutes to live, I will demand to be taken to any other hospital that is not Brookwood. Oh, and if you post any sort of critical review or comment on their Facebook page they will block you from ever posting again. Good thing there are other venues for that, right?

name: Pamela Warren Jones
text:
I am a seasoned medical professional. I had a horrible experience with this hospital. My brother was discharged with a blood clot in his heart and in Atrial Fib even though we requested a longer stay due to his unstable condition. When we asked to speak with Case Management or the Attending physician, we received a phone call in my brother's room from a discharge planner who was uncaring and then a Charge RN came in and "preached" to us as to why it was ok for my brother to leave. Two days later, he had to be readmitted due to low blood pressure, weakness and continued high heart rate. He died the next day. Two months later I still cannot believe how he was treated. There were too many physicians involved, passing off his care every day. Nurses were over assigned/stretched. Alarms would go off and not be attended to. I insisted on staying with him overnight. I left for three hours to sleep. During that time, I called his RN, she said he was stable. I returned an hour later and he was in active dying phase asking me to get him to UAB.
There was one Cardiologist who really tried his best during the last two or three hours. I feel my brother lost his life because he was discharged too soon and was not carefully treated.

name: Kao Lee
text: Long story short: procedure to be done. Humana says it's covered. Brookwood nurses says it's covered. I didn't think I'd be getting screwed out of this situation, I didn't document anything nor did I record conversations; should have. Humana no longer doing business with Brookwood a few months after simple procedure (literally, 15 minutes), Humana denied the claim. Brookwood sends me a bill for $2800. This has been a whole bunch of he-said-she-said, placing blame on me because I "didn't read the fine print" (that you're responsible for whatever they charge if everyone decides to step out on what they promised). I did, the thing that's not in the fine print though, you better get every shred of your conversations with these people on paper and/or on a recorder because at the end of the day, it's their word against yours. I was told my word wouldn't win. WILL NEVER DO BUSINESS WITH BROOKWOOD AGAIN. They have plenty of shoddy business "ethics" in their history, do your research. I'm so sorry that I didn't. I would never recommend this hospital to anyone.

resp.text: Kao, it is always our aim to provide patients and visitors with a positive experience at Brookwood Baptist Medical Center. We would like to speak with you about your concerns. Please call our Patient Liaison, Frankie Wallis, at (205) 877-1963 if you would like to discuss your experience. He has been briefed on your feedback and is ready to assist you.

name: Mary Lemley
text: The only reason there is one star is because I have to pick at least one.  Dr.Ajouha or whatever the sp. is, called me refusing treatment to my dad in the ER.  Told me he was having him put in Nursing home by Monday. Call was on Fri.  Now they are accusing me of leaving him up there.  Sick place for anyone to HAVE to go.   My dad ended up being treating AFTER I called Admin., with a blood clot in his leg.   And thats only 1 time.  That Dr. will be sued before it is over and I HOPE this pretend Hosp. closes.

name: Lisa Knox
text: I would not recommend this hospital to anyone. On September 4,2013 I had a robotic laparoscopic total hysterectomy. On September 12, I returned to the doctors office because I was having complications. I  was given a prescription and told that their was nothing to be concerned about. On September 15 I was taken to Northport DCH Emergency Room.I was told that I had a rectovaginal fistula and that I would need surgery (a colostomy bag,to be done the next day).I would have to wear it for six months. However,the ER doctor contacted the doctor who performed the hysterectomy and I was transported back to Brookwood Medical Center ,by ambulance. When I arrived the doctors confirmed that I needed the colostomy bag,but they still needed to do more contrast test. When I returned to my room I was told that their was nothing wrong with my colon and that I did not need a colostomy bag. The contrast test showed that both ureters had been cut and would need to be repaired. During the first attempt to stent my left ureter I was not properly sedated,so I  woke up during the procedure. I could feel the doctor making the incisions and injecting the needle into my back. My blood pressure was elevated to 246/199,therefore the surgery had to be stopped. The second attempt was done successfully by a different urologist. The right ureter was so severely damaged it had to be reimplanted a few weeks later. In November I was told that the left ureter had healed and the stent was removed. I thought this was the end of this nightmare;however I continued having urine leakage. On December 17, the left ureter had to be stented again. A few weeks after surgery I started having severe constipation. I complained to the doctor. He prescribed different medications that didn't work. At the time of surgery I had Blue Cross/Blue Shield insurance. The doctor said he would make sure my premium was paid because I wasn't able to return to work. That never happened so my family paid for me to see different GI specialists to try to find out why I was having such severe constipation. I had two colonoscopies done and other tests done and I was told that their was nothing wrong with my colon. I had no insurance so I was referred to UAB charity care program last year. Last year I was told by a GI specialist and surgeon that the colon transit study I had done in 2014 revealed that my colon is not functioning. Their is nothing that can be done to repair my colon. I'm going to need to have my entire colon removed(total colectomy) but their still is no guarantee that I want have to wear a colostomy bag for the rest of my life. So my question to the doctors at Brookwood is did you really do a contrast test or did you try to repair my colon and make it worse? I never had any health problems before the hysterectomy but now I'm left with a damaged colon, high blood pressure,severe arthritis,depression and anxiety. Let's not forget NO insurance,NO income. I would not recommend Brookwood Medical to ANYONE!!! They really should be shut down.

name: Barbara Ellis
text: Amanda R.N. 3rd Floor NURSE VERY efficient

name: Joshua Williamson
text:
--Update 1/15/19--

My father has had several more visits to Brookwood and I nothing good to say about this hospital. Everything I've previously written still applies, except with one extremely large new issue.

My father recently had a very bad fall and was admitted to Brookwood's ICU. Brookwood's ICU is, without a doubt, the single worst ICU I've ever experienced. I was appalled! The nurses do nothing but sit around and talk! When my father started coughing uncontrollably and his oxygen level began to take a worrying dive, the nurse blew it off as a non-issue. Thankfully, my sister is a nurse and insisted that they talk to a doctor, and after his oxygen had apparently dropped enough, the nurse finally agreed. On top of all of this, the next night when the cough started back again (the same cough that coincided with his oxygen drop the previous night, mind you), they let him cough CONSTANTLY for a HALF HOUR before I finally had to go and get someone. I know they heard him, because his room was literally next to the nurses station. And what did I find the nurses doing? Talking. A man who had breathing issues and head trauma was allowed to cough practically non-stop for over half an hour.  This is just simply unacceptable! I have NEVER witnessed an ICU that bad before. I shudder to think about if he had a life threatening issue. Would he receive the proper care? I should not be afraid to leave my father overnight anywhere in a hospital, but especially not in intensive care.

I want to be very clear about something here: My father may come here because all of his doctors are here, but I will not. If I ever needed emergency care, I have been very open about taking me ANYWHERE but Brookwood. My insurance is such that I gladly will pay more per month to ensure that I am able to go to any other hospital, but this one. It is a disgrace and by far the worst of the Big Three.

--End of Update--

Miserable hospital! One of the worst I've ever been to and I was born here! My dad was suffering chest pains one morning and so we called the paramedics and they recommended he go to the hospital, so he chose Brookwood. The emergency room people were attentive and helpful. They ran several tests on his heart and all pointed to it NOT being a heart attack (which was great news). They admitted for observation (understandable) and did some tests on his gallbladder, which also came back negative. By this time, my dad is feeling perfectly fine. Once he vomited, he felt better and all the tests showed no problems, but they STILL kept him! For two extra days! At this point, I feel like they were taking advantage of him. All tests were fine and any other concerns they had could have been handled out patient. I understand and appreciate caution, but this whole thing has been overkill to the max.

On top of all of this, the hospital is a completely confusing mess of a maze. It's very difficult to figure out where you're going. It's also outdated and not very clean. The nurses were okay, but not the most attentive. I had to go to the desk and get them after waiting 20 minutes when calling them. I often saw them congregating around the nurses station talking, so there's no excuse for that.

I will say that all of the doctor's were professional, nice and knowledgeable. The only pleasant surprise in this miserable place.

If you have a choice, go to Grandview,  UAB or St. Vincent's. This place is just a mess.

(No, I am not interested in sending you my information or contacting you to talk more about my issues. There's nothing more to say and I highly doubt that you are actually interested in correcting the issues)

name: Liz Wilson
text: My husbands belongings couldn’t be located when he was discharged.  A week later I was told that they were in fact in Security, security said they were not, was told they would be mailed to us, 7 days later nothing.  It took 5 days for the stuff to be located.   Ridiculous.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your experience, Liz. Please send us an email to patientexperience@tenethealth.com with your contact info. We'd like to follow up with you directly.

name: Kyrie Eleison
text: I do not recommend this hospital, at least not the ER! In late August, my mother, a 94 year old copd patient, aspirated on some thick liquid and so I had her taken via ambulance to Brookwood Hospital, as we had had a decent experience there earlier. When she left for the hospital, her oxygen was reading 93% on about a liter of o2. I had to drive behind the ambulance to the hospital, so I arrived a few minutes behind her at the ER. When I got there, she was on a gurney waiting for a room with a cannula in her nose...with NO OXYGEN attached to it. I was terrified; I asked the emts where her oxygen was and they told me she wasn't on any. I told them I could see that; why was she not on any? They said this was because the doctor wanted to see what her baseline was on room air. She was gasping 'help me', and getting weaker. I told them her baseline on room air would be crossed abgs, low oxygen, elevated co2.hypercapnea and acidic pH, and possibly DEATH, and to get her on oxygen STAT. They did not do this; and when they finally got her into a room and on oxygen and a monitor, her oxygen was reading in the 50s. Once admitted, she got decent care and rallied; but the insult of that severe distress, which could have easily been avoided - when the emts picked her up at her home, they asked me what her normal oxygen flow was!!! and I had told them, so I expected them to maintain it until she got settled in the ER, as crossed gasses were not an issue when they came and got her. When her blood gasses were drawn in the ER, her co2 was reading around 90 and her pH around 7.20, which can be fatal, especially in someone of her age. She recovered enough to stabilize and get discharged home after nearly a week in the hospital, but she never recovered from the overall insult of that crisis to her body systems, and died at home 6 days after her discharge. That hospital had treated her before, and those emts had transported her to that and another hospital numerous times; there was no excuse for that dangerous level of incompetence. She was also badly bruised on her legs when she got home, and the nurses neglected her dangerously for most of the day of her discharge. Don't take anyone you care about to that ER. They have some good doctors and nurses there, or at least they used to, but that quality is not consistent to the point that it is like Russian Roulette.

name: Lana Sherer
text: This place is horrible

resp.text: We're sorry we didn't meet your expectations, Lana. We would like an opportunity to hear about and address your experience. Do you mind sharing your contact information to: patientexperience@tenethealth.com?

name: Kenney bu rgess. r
text: Extremely organized and friendly

resp.text: We appreciate your positive feedback!

name: Donald Kelly
text: My partner has been laying in the Er since last night and was admitted and is still laying there waiting for a room what is up with that

name: john ging
text: who ever I spoke with in HR is dumber then a box of rocks!

name: Rebecca Bearden
text: Only complaint is the room we stayed in after my husbands surgery on 4 west desperately needs updating.

name: Jesse riding
text: Don't come here with an emergency. You'll die.

name: Eric Ransome
text: I hate hospitals!

name: Daisy Garcia
text: Next time I will think twice before taking my children to this hospital. Why rating it with one star? For misdiagnosing my daughter X-ray. I can’t complaint about the admission to a room because they admitted her ASA we got there because she injured her foot. But now they did an X-ray on her foot and was diagnose with just a sprain which will be better in a couple of weeks. This happen a Saturday afternoon and she was sent home with just an ankle supporter, crutches, pack of ice and a prescription for pain. My daughter had a miserable weekend because the pain will not go away! She did not slept the whole night and still cried Sunday the whole day. I knew there was something else wrong with her but just a “sprain” because it was really swollen and couldn’t touch it at all. We took her to her pediatrician and they ended referring her to bone and joint and YES! Just what I imagined she had a BROKEN ANKLE! I mean how in the world they did not saw that in her X-rays?

name: Melissa Hodges
text: First, the two ER Registration Clerks were rude, and unprofessional. I was told to get there quickly, and they gave me problems about getting back. Then, the Dr. told me I had a choice, but when I chose the opposite of what he wanted, he said I'd have to sign AMA papers,  then insurance wouldn't have paid. So, how did I have a choice..I didn't. Then, not the nurse I was dealing with, the other one was not nice at all. My husband was about to be transferred out, and it was an act of congress before I could see him. Not once, but twice. However, the nurse I was dealing with was great..Thanks, Monica..Hopefully, before long you'll have a decent staff to work with..So, all I can say is Russellville Hospital needs to step up..Especially with their ER staff...05/01/21..Day Shift..

name: shannon neal
text: Please don't take your loved ones or yourself to this facility for an emergency. I have lived in Russellville my entire life and not one time since I was a child have I been in the ER less than 5 hours. I wouldn't complain just about time but also factoring in that 90% of my visits the doctor's are very rude or incompetent or both. Will definitely be driving a little further for care.

name: Chris PENNINGTON
text: I had hernia surgery there jan 22nd, was first time I ever been there, had a Awesome Experience!! Everyone was very professional and nice!! Thank you guys!! I RECCOMEND them for Anything!!

name: Herschel Young
text: Had an emergency and went to Helen Keller hospital. I sat there for six hours and still wasn’t seen, so i left. I was going back home to Russellville because i was in the Shoals all day and decided to try Russellville hospital. Before i even finished my paperwork i was taken to the ER. I was seen by a nurse and doctor within minutes. Both were very professional and kind. Was out of there in an hour.

name: Geneva Miller
text: People like this.... caring for loved ones. No thank you. Plus her grammar is..... well.... horrendous.

name: Angie Hutcheson
text: Don’t take a COVID patient here. He was in here on oxygen and has been there 2 days. I have yet to receive a call to let me know the status of my husband. The only call I have received is when a family friend that works there made them mad so they called me. This place is a JOKE!!!!!! Needs to be closed down

name: claire brownstein
text: I hope Linda Hucheson is closely monitored.  Sounds like she's only concerned about some patients

name: Cayden Miller
text: They killed my grandma

name: Alanna Cason
text: This place is absolutely hideous. You would be better off taking your chances going all the way to Florence than coming here. I have yet to deal with a really competent doctor and the nurses act like they hate their jobs. I am appalled at the fact that this place is able to operate at all.

name: Vanessa Jones
text: I would have rated lower if possible my husband was taken there in an ambulance cause of death was heart attack got the death certificate it said COPD. My husband never had COPD. Russellville Hospital is the worst place I've ever been roaches crawling they need to be shut down.  This is being added to review just to show how truly sorry they are I got a call the other day they wanted to talk to my husband concerning a review all I could say was I'd love to talk to him also and maybe I could have if he had been taken somewhere else.

name: Rena Mccovery
text: Really these are the type of people  who work there

name: michelle wagner
text: Horrible place&nurses are very rude...never go there.

name: The Mad Splattr
text: Short staffed usually, but the nurses are fantastic people. The ICU nurses especially, from my experience, are amazing and hard working. The overnight security guard guy is very nice.

name: Peyton Hulsey
text: Not a good place at all, if you need medical help, i say go to Sheffield's Heller Keller or Florence's new hospital

name: Big Hairy Balls Plopped Menacingly On The Tablet
text:
Would rate these guys lower than dirt. Misdiagnosed an infection in friend, ER doctor there made fun of her, tried to label him as some sorta drug addict. Did blood work, urine work. Was mad that he didn't have anything illegal in his system. Discharged her quickly, nurse rolled her out the door, almost throwing her off the wheelchair and was still sick, puking her guts out. Went to Helen Keller 2 hours later. She was admitted for having sepsis, strep throat and inflammation in the lungs.

I strongly recommend you to use either Helen Keller, ECM or Walker Baptist Hospital in Jasper instead. Stir clearly of Russellville.

name: Big Wurm
text:
Recently had a family member die, who a week prior had went here. They were ready to admit him until he told them he had once been an I'VE drug user. He had a staff infection that took over his brain, caused many strokes, and died about a week after they treated him like garbage. I wouldn't take my DOGS here.

Even active drug users deserve adequate medical treatment when they have infections that are life threatening!  Drug addiction is a DISEASE. I highly doubt they'd have treated a diabetic  (these days is mostly a self inflected condition) the same way. Basically gave him a bag of IV fluids and kicking bim out the door. They could have saved his life. Instead, they perhaps directly caused his death. He was 30 years old.

This place should be shut down, period.

name: B. D. Kober
text:
Went there with my son and daughter with a high fever.
A strange guy showed up and  pointed at my daughter. After several whats I got he was doing an xray. I was never told they were needing xray. I was not leaving my young son alone nor my teen daughter with a strange muttering guy. Then they wanted my son back in the room and wanted me to leave my daughter alone with a guy in a dark section of the hospital alone.They took the unnecessary actions like chest xray and drew blood and then did the actual useful strep and flu. He was shivering on the table wrapping himself up with the bed sheet. They left us sitting in there for 3 hours and forgot about us. Then came in without making eye contact and said.. oh there it is. The nurse picked up the strep test she left sitting in the room. When I asked what we were waiting  for she said a urine test. She never brought us a cup or showed us to the bathroom. 3 hours waiting for a urine sample for a high fever, which she never provided a cup for. The doctor then showed up and said it was viral. I read their moto. RELATE. Reassure= nope
Explain= never told us what they were doing.
Listen= never did listen to my questions on what they were doing.
Not sure of the rest... do not go here. Incompetent and creepy.
The lady who drew blood was nice. Why she works there I don't know.

name: B. Kent
text: Rude nurses.  Poor service.  Avoid.

name: Derek Urban
text: Real rude nurses, slow, make you feel very uncomfortable.

name: Sierrah Vandiver
text: The er is ridiculous! Hate it!

name: Emily Walton
text: Need better docs there I like died if hadn't went to another I would have just got out uab... this is serous let's come together do something

name: Jennifer Loveless
text: I've worked at Russellville Hospital for the past three years and it's a small town hospital with people who truly care about their patients... I've worked at much bigger hospitals and Russellville Hospital rivals their care.

name: Allison Mitchell
text:
Overall very caring staff great nurses, doctor's are mostly thorough.
There is an excellent set of physicians there Dr.Griffitts, Dr. Bridgewater, Dr. Sleeth.
Very clean facility overall.
Take very good of patients.

name: Chell Credille
text: I've been using this hospital since I was 16 I had both my kid's here and this is also where I've had most of my surgeries. My family doctor is here along with my GYN, urologist and my kid's doctor's as well. There's a lot of great people who work hard here and devote all their time with their patients and their jobs. I'm not gonna lie there is a few doctor's that works the ER and or stands in for some doctor's that have to be out of town or family business what have you that shouldn't even be able to work due to the fact they rather either just write you scripts and not order the first test much less even look at you than anything. And some of the nurses would rather tell you what your gonna do with your life how to live it and what you can and can't do a long with yelling an all than to do their own jobs. When you have to listen to them talk bad about patients and hear them say they don't care if they live and how they can't wait to get them out so they don't have to treat them there is something seriously wrong. Or watch while your child is having seizures and the

name: Kristy Bryant
text: Horrible experience. If you need acute care I would recommend a better ED where you are not treated as drug seeking just for walking in the doors. You also can hear all patients issues due to the fact only curtains separate you from the next patient so no privacy at all there.  Major hippa violation.  One nurses incompetence Almost caused me to be placed on a ventilator at a different hospital bc they don't have an up to date triage system and mistook my severe asthma/allergic response as an anxiety attack and left me in the waiting room until I had to leave and have an ambulance meet me Enroute to take me to a better facility  running code with 3 medics in the back trying to stabilize me.   If you care about your loved ones take them some place safe

name: Joe Bama
text:
Hate to say it but very unhappy with er visit.
My mother was not doing well and a lot of pain. Had to beg for something to help with that before discharged. Nurse told us to hurry up and get going because they needed her bed. The bed was disgusting had old blood on frame and smelled bad. The whole place was very rough. I usually go north to shoals or florence when i need er but my poor mom likes to stay in rsvl if she can. I think blue cross just down graded them to lower tier so my copay would be higher if i go there anyway. Go some where else if you can.

name: Wm Bradley Franks
text: Unless ur dying, keep driving...

name: Traci g
text: Would not have rated them so low but literally I sit in the room for 8 1/2 hours .... I was crying by the time I got up because I was sooooo tired of sitting there . They were nice but didn't have a lot going on just kept on talking and having a great time instead of treating patients

name: Thomas Horton
text: I'd rather die than go back to this God forsaken hospital.

name: Anita Huerfanita
text: Hi can someone get the number of this hospital because I try the one that appear in the information and is wrong

name: The Big Chief
text:
One star is more than they deserve. My granddad- one of the most renowned men in Alabama history and a Crimson Tide legend- was recently diagnosed with covid. They sent him home with pneumonia. That's their first mistake. Of course, he eventually needed to return to the hospital. Then, they didn't have the decency to help escort him back into the hospital- making a 75-year-old man walk, with the little strength he had. That's the second strike.

There is a special place in hell for the people who are this irresponsible. I'm sure I'm not the first person to have a family member suffer because of their incompetency. I hope I am the last, but that doesn't appear likely.

Do yourself a favor: avoid at all cost. Life is precious and deserves better than they can offer.

name: Penny Norman
text: My husband was here for a CT Scan . Total disregard for patients time . Appointments are a joke. Very poorly managed. Waited one hour and ten minutes for a scan that took approximately 5 minutes.  We were late for his Doctor appointment due to the inadequacy of this facility. We were here a month ago and the same thing happened. We were told to be here 10 minutes prior to his appointment time and We waited well over an hour for the test. Very disappointed in the service at this facility. The staff was pleasant and apologized for the delay.

name: April Allison
text: The only reason I gave it 1 star was because of the wait at registration for a test I was having done. The lady at the desk was super slow and there was a line of 8 people waiting

name: Bee McCain
text: Nurses were very sweet and helpful. Clean and fresh.

name: scott harris
text: Mother had 3 trips to ER in 2 weeks and they gave her meds for a sinus infection. Today we drive to Huntsville and in few hours we find out she has a tumor on her brain.

name: Betty Korner
text: I went to the hospital because I thought I had broken my hand, thank God it was only a few fingers. I have a medical condition and can not were a mask, but told them I could were a shield and they Nurse at the front said that was fine. He went to get a shield and another Nurse came out and told me I would not been seen because I have medical issues that prevent me from wering a mask, and that the Dr would not see me if I did not have one on.. She also told me that if I was picked up by ambulance and could not put one on they would leave me were I was.

name: Darryl Farmer
text: I have been to the ER multiple times, most recent with a dislocated shoulder. The staff was very attentive, and I have to say the nursing staff and doctor did a wonderful job setting my shoulder. Special thanks to Chris, Craig, and all the nurses that helped me while I was there.

name: Kayla Martin
text: Took my mother for an ultrasound, in and out in less than 45 mins

name: Cleveland Brown
text: I had gone into the emergency room after being sent there from work because I was doubled over in pain. 2 other in the waiting room, still took an hour for me to get into a room then another 30 minutes just for a nurse to come in, never saw a doctor. I was there for about 3-4 hours in the fetal position on the bed. All they told me was if it got worse that I needed to see a GI. The only reason I got to leave when I did is because my mother who works for a cardiologist knew someone that was working at the time and she had to come from the main hospital to get them to "release" me. A month and half later I receive a bill in the mail for almost 700 dollars basically walking in and sitting there for 3-4 hours while they couldn't tell me what was wrong. The attitude from the beginning was very closed and rude. After I made comments to myself loudly about the attitudes the nurses proceeded to put on a very fake high pitched happy attitude. I would just about rather suffer in pain rather then go there and tell me that they have no idea how to do their jobs, but the hospital is supposed to help you with your health not cause mental stress.

name: Donna Hubbard
text: This hospital has the potential to be very good. Unfortunately many of the staff have hateful attitudes. Get a copy of your medical records. This will be a long process, for some unknown reason since they try to withhold your records. They document incorrect information and falsify records just like someone said below. Many of the staff are rude. This is MY HEALTH.

name: Saphronia Winkles
text: Always received top notch care for myself and family

name: Angela “Miss Priss” Gould
text: They were quick this visit and not bad help but don't agree they were thorough enough with the injury I went in for

name: John Pearson
text: The ER is the star here.  The main hospital care seems to vary shift to shift, floor to floor.  Facility is clean with a nice cafeteria.   A bit of a disconnect with staff and too many Personnel/HR conversations overheard.

name: Tiffany LaShea
text: The worst exsperience in the emergency room. Found out I was pregneat and they put on my paper missed abortion. The lady that did the ultra sound was very unprofessional. I couldn't know the results but she went next door and discussed it with the door open. I went to doctor today and expecting my first baby. If anyone find a their self in similar situation go get tested by a trusted resource.

name: Soraya Alexandre
text: Went to the ER I had a heart palpitation bad headache I found out two days before I go to ER I was pregnant I let them know they took my blood they didn’t do any ultrasound they can’t  even Tell me my HCG level when I ask the nurse about the hcg level she’s said we did the urine text it’s come positive you pregnant worst experience

name: High KingMargo
text: If you liked being abused, this is the right place for you! If you don't mind discrepancies in your medical records and outright discrimination, I would highly recommend having surgery here! They are great at abusing patients, discrimination AND falsifying your medical records. They are a TRIPLE THREAT, literally. They are victorious with their vast amount of skills causing failure in all areas of patient care. They are truly the best at being the worst, congratulations!

name: Erin Jones
text: I'd like to give zero stars but I cannot. I have to give one... Marshall South is the worst jokes ever. My daughter was scheduled for an 8:45pm MRI on her knee. With 3 kids we sat for and hr and saw nobody. Not one person. Couldn't even find anybody to ask about finding out any info. on when she would be seen. Zip zilch nada nothing nobody.. No other patients around either. A regular old ghost town.

name: Maria Irizarry
text: They have almost everything you need for your health. Doctors, are amazing with their patients. Fast services..

name: Terri Findley
text: I had bypass surgery on my leg at this hospital. My doctor name is Dr Willis he is great. The staff at the hospital was very nice. The nurse I had his name is Dan he was very caring and did everything he could to make me feel comfortable.

name: Kaelani Angelique
text: Absolutely the worst hospital I've ever been to. The staff is rude, way too long wait times even when the waiting room is clear, and unsanitary conditions. I brought my toddler in here with a 104 fever. They did a swab of his throat and nose to check for flu and strehp throat. They said it would only be a few minutes, and after 2 HOURS in the waiting room with an extremely ill toddler with a high fever, I asked them the test results and they informed me of the results and said they had the results for an hour and a half and "forgot to tell me." Flash forward 2 MORE HOURS and they got us in a room. They did an X-Ray to look for signs of pneumonia. Then 2 MORE HOURS later I go out to the desk and the doctor literally has her head in her hand looking at her phone. I asked them what was going on, and the doctor rolled her eyes at me and told me all the test results were negative and they gave him some fever reducer. I had to go out and ask them for test results and what not 4 different times, and every time they had "forgot" or had the results and were too lazy walk 2 feet into my room with my severely sick child with a high fever to give me simple results and put me and my sons fathers minds at ease. Worst hospital experience I have ever had.

name: Ersie Banes
text: I HAD TO USE THE BATHROOM AND MARSHALL SOUTH WOULD NOT ALLOW ME TO... WHAT KIND OF HOSPITAL IS THIS THAT SOMETHING HAS TO BE WRONG WITH YOU BEFORE YOU CAN EVEN GET IN TO USE A MUCH NEEDED BATHROOM

name: Susan Luallen
text: First time here, brought my friend and I'm impressed. Everyone was great! Good care and very clean in the emergency room

name: Tim N
text: Appears very clean

name: Linda Johnson
text: My husband and I have been there 3 or more times. Every time we have been treated wonderfully!! Most recently I had outpatient surgery and my treatment was A++.

name: Hazel Gracelin
text: Hospital is very nice and surprisingly very quiet!  I appreciate the services and how nice the nurses and doctors are!  For someone who always has to be in the hospital scene of things, this hospital was quite refreshing!  Got my will lab work done quickly and efficiently, plus wasn’t stabbed more than once! Lovely nurse! Thank y’all!

name: Joy Millwood
text: Everyone was friendly and helpful, I wish the time spent waiting was less but overall had good treatment.

name: Jennifer Smith
text: Tonight's experience was better than 2 weeks ago they actually listened and did something to help my son.

name: Sue Harviel
text: My 85 yo mother was seen twice in the ER at another hospital in 3 days because she kept fainting/falling.  Both times they just sent her home & told her to exercise to build up her stamina. The 3rd time, she fainted we took her to Marshall MC South.  They quickly discovered she had 100% blockage in one artery & 85% in the other AND they discovered that when she fell, she shattered her shoulder! They have been quick to take care of her needs.  They have kept me informed at every step. They literally saved my mother's life.  Also, the cleanliness in that hospital amazed me.

name: Brandie Miner
text: Wonderful place. I had a heart attack and they took excellent care of me.

name: Sam Vance
text: Nice people did a goog job .I wish Highland MEDICAL in Scottsboro al. Were half as nice and treated people like they were worth helping.

name: Randy Tucker
text: Came in to have lab work done. The person at the front desk is very rude. June 28 2020. By the way I have problems hearing.

name: June Bradfield
text: Everyone is there to give it their all for your recovery. Very accommodating.

name: Easy G
text: This Hospital Deserves No Star's! The triage nurse's are so unprofessional it's rediculous, they sit around and gossip and ignore the real emergencies, I hope when they have to seek hospital care they get treated 1 million times worse, I'd have no sympathy for their sorry as**s!! I'd recommend you seek medical care out of state before going here!!!

name: Randy Bryant
text: Everyone was very polite even the staff was very nice and very nice to to get you registered has fast has they could.

name: Patricia Roberts
text: My dad is here and I am very impressed with nurses. A special shout out to Kay and Kasie the day shift nurses. They have laughed with us as well as cried and prayed with us. These two have a heart of gold and their passion for what they do shines through!

name: Mandy Lager
text: Compared to North this hospital is far better. Could be a little more efficficwitefficieneffwitefficienefficie

name: Geneva Franco
text: Horrible place! My 2 yr old was running a very high fever and having trouble breathing against my better judgement i took her MMCS because it was close . They said she was negative for RSV and flu and sent us home. She got worse so i took her to MMCN and they said she had Flu type B. And to take her to her doctor the next day. We take her to premier care in Guntersville and turns out my baby has RSV and pnemonia. She got progressivly worse that night and so i took her back to MMCS and they completly downplayed her. Her o² was 92 and her fever was 104. The doctor didnt even touch her PERIOD. And said if my baby was sick she wouldnt be alert or interacting. This hospital is A COMPLETE JOKE!

name: ruby mitchell
text: There good but not all the nurses the late night shift ones are the best the day time ones are very mean! The emergency room is very good nice people and they are there to help.

name: Megan Williams
text:
Excellent doctors and staff.

Billing department: VERY poor.  Watch out, they don’t keep a good paper trail. One representative will tell you one thing while the next will tell another. I have an account sitting in collections, which I was told was going to be pulled from collections due to their error. I’m 30 and never had a bill in collections.

name: Doug Tucker
text:
I've had surgery in Birmingham, Huntsville and MMCS. I've never felt in better hands than I did today. Granted the doctor takes much credit but I felt as though I was in great hands today during knee surgery. Thank you all.
While services rendered were satisfactory. Recently I started receiving bills that I absolutely do not owe. In fact my insurance company has issued an investigation into their billing practice. Next Medicare will also be notified.  As of this date the mistake is north of $2500.

name: Angie Dorsett
text: Worst place I ever been to they charge you when they don't know what's wrong they just tell you stuff and charge you for it. They even miss dicnose my son my family calls it the death place people go in half come out if lucky others die my mom and dad would still believe they they done there job right the first time

name: Deanna Hall
text:
My daughter has been there for two weeks. This is the the worst patient care I have ever seen. She is on restricted diet and food service sends expired products often.  Aides and Nurses don't seem to give a care what  is going on.
My daughter is trying to get better in order to get surgery.  They keep her so stressed out, meds late, have to beg for a bath, etc.. I will be trying to move her to  Marshall North or even a Gadsden hospital . These  people just seem to flat out not care. So sad.

name: Mike Works
text: Better luck going to a vets office. They suck.

name: Candy Cantrell
text: I spent 12 days there in July 2017 with pneumonia and sepsis. I received excellent care. I had never had such excellent care by nurses. I was very pleased. I also had a hysterectomy this past summer. Could not have been more pleased! I highly recommend.

name: Shannon Long
text: Maternity ward was very clean, friendly, considerate and attentive. Billing department also extremely professional. Most of all, Dr. Johnson OB/GYN and staff went above and beyond for me. I was so impressed with their services.

name: Mason Giles
text: Absolutely the worst medical care facility in Marshall county. Charged a 19 year old girl who lives on her own with no insurance 1100$ to see a doctor for the common cold. How is anyone supposed to afford healthcare? There should really be some discussion about the costs up front. Terrible administration and management. I'm sad that this hospital is still in existence. It is a disgrace to our town!!!!

name: Jennifer Copeland
text: Worst run hospital on Earth.My mom is walking out today no discharge process.Nurses are ignorant all they say is "ask the doctor."When you hit the nurse button, it takes forever to get help.One male nurse screamed at my mother.They are not comforting or knowledgeable at all.The room was nasty.. no housekeeping around, a/c unit was filthy and barely blew out ..they left bloody tissue and gloves and garbage on the floor.This place sux!!Wouldn't take my dog...she deserves much better.

name: Dana Dixon
text: Two and a half years ago I would of given the 1st shift ER an excellent review. Last night makes me wish there were half stars available to give. Without going in to great detail, I was in (and remain in) respiratory distress. I was treated for bronchitis. They didn’t even offer a breathing treatment. The doctor heard me cough and assumed. I’m willing to bet he didn’t read my complaint coming in or review my history with distress & failure. I’m almost certain he didn’t even read my chart. I was put on an ekg in the room because the front failed to do so. However still hooked to the ekg I was signing my discharge paper that didn’t even mention an ekg being done. I had to remind the nurse that I was still attached. Aside from leaving the hospital still clearly in distress and the completely incompetence of the staff, the ER was disgusting unkept and wreaked of urine through out the entire hall. I will not be returning to this hospital; ever.

name: RICHARD OAKS
text: Took my friend in emergency room and staff was very nice and helpful. nurses there are top quality people. many thanks

name: James Pinkston
text: This has been by far the best hospital experience I've had any where staff members were excellent thanks guys and gals at mmcs

name: George Batten
text: Don't know what others were there for; but they saved my wife's life. Went from ER to ICU , and then to the general floor as she has progressed. Very attentive staff, clean rooms, and competent Medical personnel. I am a recent Liver Transplant at UAB Birmingham and my wife is receiving that kind of care.

name: Karley Robinson
text: The most god awful hospital I've ever had the displeasure of being at. They were awful to me when I was in labor with my son. Then when I took my mother in law up there because she was having symptoms of a heart attack, they again, proved how incompetent they are. They did not take her blood pressure, they didn't give her an IV, they didn't even do something as simple as take her temperature. The doctor came into the room (after a 6 hour wait) & told her it was prob a stomach virus, gave her a nausea pill, & sent her home. Fast forward 2 days later, I take her to Gadsden Regional. They took her right in, no wait, & listened to her, did x-rays only to find out she had scarring on her heart were she had had 2 or 3 minor hard attacks! Then when my aunt went to that hospital with a infected spider bite, she caught staph (while in their care), so they moved her to ICU. In a matter of hours, she developed sepsis & they told us she wasn't going to make it. Obviously we were upset, crying, asking if they were going to even TRY! The head nurch in ICU said they've done everything they can & kicked us out of the room. Wouldn't even let us say goodbye. She passed about 15 mins after she kicked us out. This is the most neglectful, hateful, incompetent, sorry excuse for a hospital! Take 30 mins and drive to Gadsden Regional. Your chances of survival will be greater.

name: Gilbert Galvan
text: I've been there several times. Big mistake .Some of the staff there are arrogant. Especially the doctor treating me. He couldn't answer any of mine or my wife's questions .

name: Speakman28
text: Had to wait in ER way to long when there were only 2 people ahead of me. 2 hrs. and still waiting.............. Still waiting going on 3 hrs. My review of 3 stars dropped quickly. Now 2 stars, because it seems they just don't have any organization. Edit 1 (1-1-2018): I took my stepdaughter to the ER yesterday and there wasn't a Dr. working. They had a P.A. and CRNP on duty. ER = Dr.?????

name: Walter Camp
text: Worst medical facility I have ever been to. The ER was full of bums and obvious melingerers. I waited 5 hours and never saw a doctor. I was suffering from kidney stones.

name: LoveMy AckwardButt
text: If you wanna die this is the right hospital they worthless.

name: Tabitha Colburn
text: Womens center is the only good thing about this place. They go above & beyond!

name: Janice Lynn Warpool
text: They take care of you

name: Grant Myers
text: My wife her sister and my son have all been to Marshall County Hospital in Boaz. They have all received prompt quick Professional Care and depending on the urgency have left the emergency room and as little as 5 minutes I rate this Hospital higher in quality and professionalism in St Vincent's UAB or any other Hospital in Birmingham. I would highly recommend going here for Emergency Medical Services.

name: Taryn Horton
text: I had to take my daughter to the ER last night, I had stopped taking my kids there years ago because of the service and disrespectful way some of the Drs treated their patients. I had no choice last night, my daughter is 16 and has never asked to go to the Dr much less the ER. I was concerned about her symptoms. I got there and the Nurse we had named Pearce was AMAZING!! My daughter was sick and scared and he talked to her, asked her about school and track. The Dr was also AMAZING! Dr Christianson (I hope I spelled that right) . Not since Dr Sleeth have I met a Dr that was genuinely concerned about my child. He put her on IV fluids right then and there, got her tests ordered and gave her meds for her stomach and dizziness . Was I there a long time? Yes. But when we got to the room we were seen very quickly. If these are the new kind of people y'all are hiring for the ER then if I have a sick kid in the middle of the night or an actual emergency I won't be so worried about my kids being there .That Pearce guy needs a raise!! Thank you guys for treating us with concern and respect .

name: C Baker
text: The younger girl that work in the phlebotomy/lab on the lower level is the rudest woman I have ever dealt with. I was in to have my blood taken and when I walked in she snatched the paper out of my hand without saying a word. After that she questioned me on filling out a form right, although it was correct. Then, when I was going to leave she said have a good day and I said it back and she let out the rudest snicker. Sorry but it was a very unpleasant experience that left my blood boiling. If you hate your job that much or hate dealing with People, find somewhere else to go. PLEASE. The other older lady in the lab was super nice and helpful.

name: micah goble
text: Wasn't very well taken care of I went in with trouble breathing first question I was asked was if i smoked marijuana then he gave me a breathing treatment and told me nothing was wrong with me . turns out he wasn't even a Dr he was a P.A ..I will make the 35 min drive to north next time! Wouldn't recommend even  taking an animal there

name: Cody Elrod
text: 5 hour wait!!!!! This ridiculous my father 63 come in with pain from head to toe barley able to walk and they couldnt get a room for him nkt just this time but multiple times before on averaged a 4 to 5 hour wait fir the emergengy room

name: Alise Wald
text: Everyone was absolutely wonderful to me while I was there after my surgery! Wonderful staff!!!

name: Sonya Buchanan
text: Go to the ER for vertigo bc it got so bad. They did several test and did nothing. They say it will run its course and go away eventually. That was in March!!!! Get a freaking $350 bill 5 to 6 months later for things my insurance doesn’t cover. How long does it take to know this?!?! Two months later get another bill. Then today get yet another bill. Can you be charged freaking 10 months after and never even known there were charges?!?!? Absolutely NO help with my problem. No meds no nothing but cost me about $700 on top of bcbs!! Bunch of rip offs!!! Ridiculous!!! This even after another terrible experience with my daughter needing crutches and they say “they are out”?!?!?! Your a freaking hospital!!! Sad this place is our only option for help locally. Terrible service even when you call in that place too. Just sad.

name: Jan Allen
text: Was sent to the ER with abdominal pains from the VA clinic in an ambulance.  They took blood, did some  xrays, gave me GI meds, but no CT scan. Told me it was a virus. Doped me up and sent me home.  They ignored the high white blood count and high bacteria count from my blood test. My 'virus' was actually a ruptured appendix.  And they doped me up and sent me home. I could have died, if not for my VA doctor calling and insisting I go somewhere else for a ct scan. Because they SENT ME HOME WITH A RUPTURED APPENDIX

name: Michael Wheelock
text: 1st visit, Aug 7th. Came in with heart attack symptoms, told indigestion. Two wks later, major heart attack, Two stents in South Carolina. Now back here because of major reactions to meds. Want to keep me for observation. How can you accomplish that when they forget to hook you up to the monitor's, then don't Ck in on you for over an hour. Don't come here. I never will again.

text: Personally the worst hospital I’ve ever had to experience, I’ll never come back here again!!!

It took 4 hrs for anyone to return and finally discharge at 4 am. We arrived at 10pm by ambulance. The nurses were all at the station in the er cutting up and laughing. Acted rude if I asked what's next
